verses.name: Isaiah 1:1
verses.text: The vision concerning Judah and Jerusalem that Isaiah son of Amoz saw during the reigns of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz and Hezekiah, kings of Judah.

verses.name: Isaiah 1:2
verses.text: Hear, O heavens! Listen, O earth! For the LORD has spoken: "I reared children and brought them up, but they have rebelled against me.

verses.name: Isaiah 1:3
verses.text: The ox knows his master, the donkey his owner's manger, but Israel does not know, my people do not understand."

verses.name: Isaiah 1:4
verses.text: Ah, sinful nation, a people loaded with guilt, a brood of evildoers, children given to corruption! They have forsaken the LORD; they have spurned the Holy One of Israel and turned their backs on him.

verses.name: Isaiah 1:5
verses.text: Why should you be beaten anymore? Why do you persist in rebellion? Your whole head is injured, your whole heart afflicted.

verses.name: Isaiah 1:6
verses.text: From the sole of your foot to the top of your head there is no soundness- only wounds and welts and open sores, not cleansed or bandaged or soothed with oil.

verses.name: Isaiah 1:7
verses.text: Your country is desolate, your cities burned with fire; your fields are being stripped by foreigners right before you, laid waste as when overthrown by strangers.

verses.name: Isaiah 1:8
verses.text: The Daughter of Zion is left like a shelter in a vineyard, like a hut in a field of melons, like a city under siege.

verses.name: Isaiah 1:9
verses.text: Unless the LORD Almighty had left us some survivors, we would have become like Sodom, we would have been like Gomorrah.

verses.name: Isaiah 1:10
verses.text: Hear the word of the LORD, you rulers of Sodom; listen to the law of our God, you people of Gomorrah!

verses.name: Isaiah 1:11
verses.text: "The multitude of your sacrifices- what are they to me?" says the LORD. "I have more than enough of burnt offerings, of rams and the fat of fattened animals; I have no pleasure in the blood of bulls and lambs and goats.

verses.name: Isaiah 1:12
verses.text: When you come to appear before me, who has asked this of you, this trampling of my courts?

verses.name: Isaiah 1:13
verses.text: Stop bringing meaningless offerings! Your incense is detestable to me. New Moons, Sabbaths and convocations- I cannot bear your evil assemblies.

verses.name: Isaiah 1:14
verses.text: Your New Moon festivals and your appointed feasts my soul hates. They have become a burden to me; I am weary of bearing them.

verses.name: Isaiah 1:15
verses.text: When you spread out your hands in prayer, I will hide my eyes from you; even if you offer many prayers, I will not listen. Your hands are full of blood;

verses.name: Isaiah 1:16
verses.text: wash and make yourselves clean. Take your evil deeds out of my sight! Stop doing wrong,

verses.name: Isaiah 1:17
verses.text: learn to do right! Seek justice, encourage the oppressed. Defend the cause of the fatherless, plead the case of the widow.

verses.name: Isaiah 1:18
verses.text: "Come now, let us reason together," says the LORD. "Though your sins are like scarlet, they shall be as white as snow; though they are red as crimson, they shall be like wool.

verses.name: Isaiah 1:19
verses.text: If you are willing and obedient, you will eat the best from the land;

verses.name: Isaiah 1:20
verses.text: but if you resist and rebel, you will be devoured by the sword." For the mouth of the LORD has spoken.

verses.name: Isaiah 1:21
verses.text: See how the faithful city has become a harlot! She once was full of justice; righteousness used to dwell in her- but now murderers!

verses.name: Isaiah 1:22
verses.text: Your silver has become dross, your choice wine is diluted with water.

verses.name: Isaiah 1:23
verses.text: Your rulers are rebels, companions of thieves; they all love bribes and chase after gifts. They do not defend the cause of the fatherless; the widow's case does not come before them.

verses.name: Isaiah 1:24
verses.text: Therefore the Lord, the LORD Almighty, the Mighty One of Israel, declares: "Ah, I will get relief from my foes and avenge myself on my enemies.

verses.name: Isaiah 1:25
verses.text: I will turn my hand against you; I will thoroughly purge away your dross and remove all your impurities.

verses.name: Isaiah 1:26
verses.text: I will restore your judges as in days of old, your counselors as at the beginning. Afterward you will be called the City of Righteousness, the Faithful City."

verses.name: Isaiah 1:27
verses.text: Zion will be redeemed with justice, her penitent ones with righteousness.

verses.name: Isaiah 1:28
verses.text: But rebels and sinners will both be broken, and those who forsake the LORD will perish.

verses.name: Isaiah 1:29
verses.text: "You will be ashamed because of the sacred oaks in which you have delighted; you will be disgraced because of the gardens that you have chosen.

verses.name: Isaiah 1:30
verses.text: You will be like an oak with fading leaves, like a garden without water.

verses.name: Isaiah 1:31
verses.text: The mighty man will become tinder and his work a spark; both will burn together, with no one to quench the fire."

verses.name: Isaiah 2:1
verses.text: This is what Isaiah son of Amoz saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem:

verses.name: Isaiah 2:2
verses.text: In the last days the mountain of the LORD's temple will be established as chief among the mountains; it will be raised above the hills, and all nations will stream to it.

verses.name: Isaiah 2:3
verses.text: Many peoples will come and say, "Come, let us go up to the mountain of the LORD, to the house of the God of Jacob. He will teach us his ways, so that we may walk in his paths." The law will go out from Zion, the word of the LORD from Jerusalem.

verses.name: Isaiah 2:4
verses.text: He will judge between the nations and will settle disputes for many peoples. They will beat their swords into plowshares and their spears into pruning hooks. Nation will not take up sword against nation, nor will they train for war anymore.

verses.name: Isaiah 2:5
verses.text: Come, O house of Jacob, let us walk in the light of the LORD.

verses.name: Isaiah 2:6
verses.text: You have abandoned your people, the house of Jacob. They are full of superstitions from the East; they practice divination like the Philistines and clasp hands with pagans.

verses.name: Isaiah 2:7
verses.text: Their land is full of silver and gold; there is no end to their treasures. Their land is full of horses; there is no end to their chariots.

verses.name: Isaiah 2:8
verses.text: Their land is full of idols; they bow down to the work of their hands, to what their fingers have made.

verses.name: Isaiah 2:9
verses.text: So man will be brought low and mankind humbled- do not forgive them.

verses.name: Isaiah 2:10
verses.text: Go into the rocks, hide in the ground from dread of the LORD and the splendor of his majesty!

verses.name: Isaiah 2:11
verses.text: The eyes of the arrogant man will be humbled and the pride of men brought low; the LORD alone will be exalted in that day.

verses.name: Isaiah 2:12
verses.text: The LORD Almighty has a day in store for all the proud and lofty, for all that is exalted (and they will be humbled),

verses.name: Isaiah 2:13
verses.text: for all the cedars of Lebanon, tall and lofty, and all the oaks of Bashan,

verses.name: Isaiah 2:14
verses.text: for all the towering mountains and all the high hills,

verses.name: Isaiah 2:15
verses.text: for every lofty tower and every fortified wall,

verses.name: Isaiah 2:16
verses.text: for every trading ship and every stately vessel.

verses.name: Isaiah 2:17
verses.text: The arrogance of man will be brought low and the pride of men humbled; the LORD alone will be exalted in that day,

verses.name: Isaiah 2:18
verses.text: and the idols will totally disappear.

verses.name: Isaiah 2:19
verses.text: Men will flee to caves in the rocks and to holes in the ground from dread of the LORD and the splendor of his majesty, when he rises to shake the earth.

verses.name: Isaiah 2:20
verses.text: In that day men will throw away to the rodents and bats their idols of silver and idols of gold, which they made to worship.

verses.name: Isaiah 2:21
verses.text: They will flee to caverns in the rocks and to the overhanging crags from dread of the LORD and the splendor of his majesty, when he rises to shake the earth.

verses.name: Isaiah 2:22
verses.text: Stop trusting in man, who has but a breath in his nostrils. Of what account is he?

verses.name: Isaiah 3:1
verses.text: See now, the Lord, the LORD Almighty, is about to take from Jerusalem and Judah both supply and support: all supplies of food and all supplies of water,

verses.name: Isaiah 3:2
verses.text: the hero and warrior, the judge and prophet, the soothsayer and elder,

verses.name: Isaiah 3:3
verses.text: the captain of fifty and man of rank, the counselor, skilled craftsman and clever enchanter.

verses.name: Isaiah 3:4
verses.text: I will make boys their officials; mere children will govern them.

verses.name: Isaiah 3:5
verses.text: People will oppress each other- man against man, neighbor against neighbor. The young will rise up against the old, the base against the honorable.

verses.name: Isaiah 3:6
verses.text: A man will seize one of his brothers at his father's home, and say, "You have a cloak, you be our leader; take charge of this heap of ruins!"

verses.name: Isaiah 3:7
verses.text: But in that day he will cry out, "I have no remedy. I have no food or clothing in my house; do not make me the leader of the people."

verses.name: Isaiah 3:8
verses.text: Jerusalem staggers, Judah is falling; their words and deeds are against the LORD, defying his glorious presence.

verses.name: Isaiah 3:9
verses.text: The look on their faces testifies against them; they parade their sin like Sodom; they do not hide it. Woe to them! They have brought disaster upon themselves.

verses.name: Isaiah 3:10
verses.text: Tell the righteous it will be well with them, for they will enjoy the fruit of their deeds.

verses.name: Isaiah 3:11
verses.text: Woe to the wicked! Disaster is upon them! They will be paid back for what their hands have done.

verses.name: Isaiah 3:12
verses.text: Youths oppress my people, women rule over them. O my people, your guides lead you astray; they turn you from the path.

verses.name: Isaiah 3:13
verses.text: The LORD takes his place in court; he rises to judge the people.

verses.name: Isaiah 3:14
verses.text: The LORD enters into judgment against the elders and leaders of his people: "It is you who have ruined my vineyard; the plunder from the poor is in your houses.

verses.name: Isaiah 3:15
verses.text: What do you mean by crushing my people and grinding the faces of the poor?" declares the Lord, the LORD Almighty.

verses.name: Isaiah 3:16
verses.text: The LORD says, "The women of Zion are haughty, walking along with outstretched necks, flirting with their eyes, tripping along with mincing steps, with ornaments jingling on their ankles.

verses.name: Isaiah 3:17
verses.text: Therefore the Lord will bring sores on the heads of the women of Zion; the LORD will make their scalps bald."

verses.name: Isaiah 3:18
verses.text: In that day the Lord will snatch away their finery: the bangles and headbands and crescent necklaces,

verses.name: Isaiah 3:19
verses.text: the earrings and bracelets and veils,

verses.name: Isaiah 3:20
verses.text: the headdresses and ankle chains and sashes, the perfume bottles and charms,

verses.name: Isaiah 3:21
verses.text: the signet rings and nose rings,

verses.name: Isaiah 3:22
verses.text: the fine robes and the capes and cloaks, the purses

verses.name: Isaiah 3:23
verses.text: and mirrors, and the linen garments and tiaras and shawls.

verses.name: Isaiah 3:24
verses.text: Instead of fragrance there will be a stench; instead of a sash, a rope; instead of well-dressed hair, baldness; instead of fine clothing, sackcloth; instead of beauty, branding.

verses.name: Isaiah 3:25
verses.text: Your men will fall by the sword, your warriors in battle.

verses.name: Isaiah 3:26
verses.text: The gates of Zion will lament and mourn; destitute, she will sit on the ground.

verses.name: Isaiah 4:1
verses.text: In that day seven women will take hold of one man and say, "We will eat our own food and provide our own clothes; only let us be called by your name. Take away our disgrace!"

verses.name: Isaiah 4:2
verses.text: In that day the Branch of the LORD will be beautiful and glorious, and the fruit of the land will be the pride and glory of the survivors in Israel.

verses.name: Isaiah 4:3
verses.text: Those who are left in Zion, who remain in Jerusalem, will be called holy, all who are recorded among the living in Jerusalem.

verses.name: Isaiah 4:4
verses.text: The Lord will wash away the filth of the women of Zion; he will cleanse the bloodstains from Jerusalem by a spirit of judgment and a spirit of fire.

verses.name: Isaiah 4:5
verses.text: Then the LORD will create over all of Mount Zion and over those who assemble there a cloud of smoke by day and a glow of flaming fire by night; over all the glory will be a canopy.

verses.name: Isaiah 4:6
verses.text: It will be a shelter and shade from the heat of the day, and a refuge and hiding place from the storm and rain.

verses.name: Isaiah 5:1
verses.text: I will sing for the one I love a song about his vineyard: My loved one had a vineyard on a fertile hillside.

verses.name: Isaiah 5:2
verses.text: He dug it up and cleared it of stones and planted it with the choicest vines. He built a watchtower in it and cut out a winepress as well. Then he looked for a crop of good grapes, but it yielded only bad fruit.

verses.name: Isaiah 5:3
verses.text: "Now you dwellers in Jerusalem and men of Judah, judge between me and my vineyard.

verses.name: Isaiah 5:4
verses.text: What more could have been done for my vineyard than I have done for it? When I looked for good grapes, why did it yield only bad?

verses.name: Isaiah 5:5
verses.text: Now I will tell you what I am going to do to my vineyard: I will take away its hedge, and it will be destroyed; I will break down its wall, and it will be trampled.

verses.name: Isaiah 5:6
verses.text: I will make it a wasteland, neither pruned nor cultivated, and briers and thorns will grow there. I will command the clouds not to rain on it."

verses.name: Isaiah 5:7
verses.text: The vineyard of the LORD Almighty is the house of Israel, and the men of Judah are the garden of his delight. And he looked for justice, but saw bloodshed; for righteousness, but heard cries of distress.

verses.name: Isaiah 5:8
verses.text: Woe to you who add house to house and join field to field till no space is left and you live alone in the land.

verses.name: Isaiah 5:9
verses.text: The LORD Almighty has declared in my hearing: "Surely the great houses will become desolate, the fine mansions left without occupants.

verses.name: Isaiah 5:10
verses.text: A ten-acre vineyard will produce only a bath of wine, a homer of seed only an ephah of grain."

verses.name: Isaiah 5:11
verses.text: Woe to those who rise early in the morning to run after their drinks, who stay up late at night till they are inflamed with wine.

verses.name: Isaiah 5:12
verses.text: They have harps and lyres at their banquets, tambourines and flutes and wine, but they have no regard for the deeds of the LORD, no respect for the work of his hands.

verses.name: Isaiah 5:13
verses.text: Therefore my people will go into exile for lack of understanding; their men of rank will die of hunger and their masses will be parched with thirst.

verses.name: Isaiah 5:14
verses.text: Therefore the grave enlarges its appetite and opens its mouth without limit; into it will descend their nobles and masses with all their brawlers and revelers.

verses.name: Isaiah 5:15
verses.text: So man will be brought low and mankind humbled, the eyes of the arrogant humbled.

verses.name: Isaiah 5:16
verses.text: But the LORD Almighty will be exalted by his justice, and the holy God will show himself holy by his righteousness.

verses.name: Isaiah 5:17
verses.text: Then sheep will graze as in their own pasture; lambs will feed among the ruins of the rich.

verses.name: Isaiah 5:18
verses.text: Woe to those who draw sin along with cords of deceit, and wickedness as with cart ropes,

verses.name: Isaiah 5:19
verses.text: to those who say, "Let God hurry, let him hasten his work so we may see it. Let it approach, let the plan of the Holy One of Israel come, so we may know it."

verses.name: Isaiah 5:20
verses.text: Woe to those who call evil good and good evil, who put darkness for light and light for darkness, who put bitter for sweet and sweet for bitter.

verses.name: Isaiah 5:21
verses.text: Woe to those who are wise in their own eyes and clever in their own sight.

verses.name: Isaiah 5:22
verses.text: Woe to those who are heroes at drinking wine and champions at mixing drinks,

verses.name: Isaiah 5:23
verses.text: who acquit the guilty for a bribe, but deny justice to the innocent.

verses.name: Isaiah 5:24
verses.text: Therefore, as tongues of fire lick up straw and as dry grass sinks down in the flames, so their roots will decay and their flowers blow away like dust; for they have rejected the law of the LORD Almighty and spurned the word of the Holy One of Israel.

verses.name: Isaiah 5:25
verses.text: Therefore the LORD's anger burns against his people; his hand is raised and he strikes them down. The mountains shake, and the dead bodies are like refuse in the streets. Yet for all this, his anger is not turned away, his hand is still upraised.

verses.name: Isaiah 5:26
verses.text: He lifts up a banner for the distant nations, he whistles for those at the ends of the earth. Here they come, swiftly and speedily!

verses.name: Isaiah 5:27
verses.text: Not one of them grows tired or stumbles, not one slumbers or sleeps; not a belt is loosened at the waist, not a sandal thong is broken.

verses.name: Isaiah 5:28
verses.text: Their arrows are sharp, all their bows are strung; their horses' hoofs seem like flint, their chariot wheels like a whirlwind.

verses.name: Isaiah 5:29
verses.text: Their roar is like that of the lion, they roar like young lions; they growl as they seize their prey and carry it off with no one to rescue.

verses.name: Isaiah 5:30
verses.text: In that day they will roar over it like the roaring of the sea. And if one looks at the land, he will see darkness and distress; even the light will be darkened by the clouds.

verses.name: Isaiah 6:1
verses.text: In the year that King Uzziah died, I saw the Lord seated on a throne, high and exalted, and the train of his robe filled the temple.

verses.name: Isaiah 6:2
verses.text: Above him were seraphs, each with six wings: With two wings they covered their faces, with two they covered their feet, and with two they were flying.

verses.name: Isaiah 6:3
verses.text: And they were calling to one another: "Holy, holy, holy is the LORD Almighty; the whole earth is full of his glory."

verses.name: Isaiah 6:4
verses.text: At the sound of their voices the doorposts and thresholds shook and the temple was filled with smoke.

verses.name: Isaiah 6:5
verses.text: "Woe to me!" I cried. "I am ruined! For I am a man of unclean lips, and I live among a people of unclean lips, and my eyes have seen the King, the LORD Almighty."

verses.name: Isaiah 6:6
verses.text: Then one of the seraphs flew to me with a live coal in his hand, which he had taken with tongs from the altar.

verses.name: Isaiah 6:7
verses.text: With it he touched my mouth and said, "See, this has touched your lips; your guilt is taken away and your sin atoned for."

verses.name: Isaiah 6:8
verses.text: Then I heard the voice of the Lord saying, "Whom shall I send? And who will go for us?" And I said, "Here am I. Send me!"

verses.name: Isaiah 6:9
verses.text: He said, "Go and tell this people: "'Be ever hearing, but never understanding; be ever seeing, but never perceiving.'

verses.name: Isaiah 6:10
verses.text: Make the heart of this people calloused; make their ears dull and close their eyes. Otherwise they might see with their eyes, hear with their ears, understand with their hearts, and turn and be healed."

verses.name: Isaiah 6:11
verses.text: Then I said, "For how long, O Lord?" And he answered: "Until the cities lie ruined and without inhabitant, until the houses are left deserted and the fields ruined and ravaged,

verses.name: Isaiah 6:12
verses.text: until the LORD has sent everyone far away and the land is utterly forsaken.

verses.name: Isaiah 6:13
verses.text: And though a tenth remains in the land, it will again be laid waste. But as the terebinth and oak leave stumps when they are cut down, so the holy seed will be the stump in the land."

verses.name: Isaiah 7:1
verses.text: When Ahaz son of Jotham, the son of Uzziah, was king of Judah, King Rezin of Aram and Pekah son of Remaliah king of Israel marched up to fight against Jerusalem, but they could not overpower it.

verses.name: Isaiah 7:2
verses.text: Now the house of David was told, "Aram has allied itself with Ephraim"; so the hearts of Ahaz and his people were shaken, as the trees of the forest are shaken by the wind.

verses.name: Isaiah 7:3
verses.text: Then the LORD said to Isaiah, "Go out, you and your son Shear-Jashub, to meet Ahaz at the end of the aqueduct of the Upper Pool, on the road to the Washerman's Field.

verses.name: Isaiah 7:4
verses.text: Say to him, 'Be careful, keep calm and don't be afraid. Do not lose heart because of these two smoldering stubs of firewood-because of the fierce anger of Rezin and Aram and of the son of Remaliah.

verses.name: Isaiah 7:5
verses.text: Aram, Ephraim and Remaliah's son have plotted your ruin, saying,

verses.name: Isaiah 7:6
verses.text: "Let us invade Judah; let us tear it apart and divide it among ourselves, and make the son of Tabeel king over it."

verses.name: Isaiah 7:7
verses.text: Yet this is what the Sovereign LORD says: "'It will not take place, it will not happen,

verses.name: Isaiah 7:8
verses.text: for the head of Aram is Damascus, and the head of Damascus is only Rezin. Within sixty-five years Ephraim will be too shattered to be a people.

verses.name: Isaiah 7:9
verses.text: The head of Ephraim is Samaria, and the head of Samaria is only Remaliah's son. If you do not stand firm in your faith, you will not stand at all.'"

verses.name: Isaiah 7:10
verses.text: Again the LORD spoke to Ahaz,

verses.name: Isaiah 7:11
verses.text: "Ask the LORD your God for a sign, whether in the deepest depths or in the highest heights."

verses.name: Isaiah 7:12
verses.text: But Ahaz said, "I will not ask; I will not put the LORD to the test."

verses.name: Isaiah 7:13
verses.text: Then Isaiah said, "Hear now, you house of David! Is it not enough to try the patience of men? Will you try the patience of my God also?

verses.name: Isaiah 7:14
verses.text: Therefore the Lord himself will give you a sign: The virgin will be with child and will give birth to a son, and will call him Immanuel.

verses.name: Isaiah 7:15
verses.text: He will eat curds and honey when he knows enough to reject the wrong and choose the right.

verses.name: Isaiah 7:16
verses.text: But before the boy knows enough to reject the wrong and choose the right, the land of the two kings you dread will be laid waste.

verses.name: Isaiah 7:17
verses.text: The LORD will bring on you and on your people and on the house of your father a time unlike any since Ephraim broke away from Judah-he will bring the king of Assyria."

verses.name: Isaiah 7:18
verses.text: In that day the LORD will whistle for flies from the distant streams of Egypt and for bees from the land of Assyria.

verses.name: Isaiah 7:19
verses.text: They will all come and settle in the steep ravines and in the crevices in the rocks, on all the thornbushes and at all the water holes.

verses.name: Isaiah 7:20
verses.text: In that day the Lord will use a razor hired from beyond the River -the king of Assyria-to shave your head and the hair of your legs, and to take off your beards also.

verses.name: Isaiah 7:21
verses.text: In that day, a man will keep alive a young cow and two goats.

verses.name: Isaiah 7:22
verses.text: And because of the abundance of the milk they give, he will have curds to eat. All who remain in the land will eat curds and honey.

verses.name: Isaiah 7:23
verses.text: In that day, in every place where there were a thousand vines worth a thousand silver shekels, there will be only briers and thorns.

verses.name: Isaiah 7:24
verses.text: Men will go there with bow and arrow, for the land will be covered with briers and thorns.

verses.name: Isaiah 7:25
verses.text: As for all the hills once cultivated by the hoe, you will no longer go there for fear of the briers and thorns; they will become places where cattle are turned loose and where sheep run.

verses.name: Isaiah 8:1
verses.text: The LORD said to me, "Take a large scroll and write on it with an ordinary pen: Maher-Shalal-Hash-Baz.

verses.name: Isaiah 8:2
verses.text: And I will call in Uriah the priest and Zechariah son of Jeberekiah as reliable witnesses for me."

verses.name: Isaiah 8:3
verses.text: Then I went to the prophetess, and she conceived and gave birth to a son. And the LORD said to me, "Name him Maher-Shalal-Hash-Baz.

verses.name: Isaiah 8:4
verses.text: Before the boy knows how to say 'My father' or 'My mother,' the wealth of Damascus and the plunder of Samaria will be carried off by the king of Assyria."

verses.name: Isaiah 8:5
verses.text: The LORD spoke to me again:

verses.name: Isaiah 8:6
verses.text: "Because this people has rejected the gently flowing waters of Shiloah and rejoices over Rezin and the son of Remaliah,

verses.name: Isaiah 8:7
verses.text: therefore the Lord is about to bring against them the mighty floodwaters of the River - the king of Assyria with all his pomp. It will overflow all its channels, run over all its banks

verses.name: Isaiah 8:8
verses.text: and sweep on into Judah, swirling over it, passing through it and reaching up to the neck. Its outspread wings will cover the breadth of your land, O Immanuel!"

verses.name: Isaiah 8:9
verses.text: Raise the war cry, you nations, and be shattered! Listen, all you distant lands. Prepare for battle, and be shattered! Prepare for battle, and be shattered!

verses.name: Isaiah 8:10
verses.text: Devise your strategy, but it will be thwarted; propose your plan, but it will not stand, for God is with us.

verses.name: Isaiah 8:11
verses.text: The LORD spoke to me with his strong hand upon me, warning me not to follow the way of this people. He said:

verses.name: Isaiah 8:12
verses.text: "Do not call conspiracy everything that these people call conspiracy; do not fear what they fear, and do not dread it.

verses.name: Isaiah 8:13
verses.text: The LORD Almighty is the one you are to regard as holy, he is the one you are to fear, he is the one you are to dread,

verses.name: Isaiah 8:14
verses.text: and he will be a sanctuary; but for both houses of Israel he will be a stone that causes men to stumble and a rock that makes them fall. And for the people of Jerusalem he will be a trap and a snare.

verses.name: Isaiah 8:15
verses.text: Many of them will stumble; they will fall and be broken, they will be snared and captured."

verses.name: Isaiah 8:16
verses.text: Bind up the testimony and seal up the law among my disciples.

verses.name: Isaiah 8:17
verses.text: I will wait for the LORD, who is hiding his face from the house of Jacob. I will put my trust in him.

verses.name: Isaiah 8:18
verses.text: Here am I, and the children the LORD has given me. We are signs and symbols in Israel from the LORD Almighty, who dwells on Mount Zion.

verses.name: Isaiah 8:19
verses.text: When men tell you to consult mediums and spiritists, who whisper and mutter, should not a people inquire of their God? Why consult the dead on behalf of the living?

verses.name: Isaiah 8:20
verses.text: To the law and to the testimony! If they do not speak according to this word, they have no light of dawn.

verses.name: Isaiah 8:21
verses.text: Distressed and hungry, they will roam through the land; when they are famished, they will become enraged and, looking upward, will curse their king and their God.

verses.name: Isaiah 8:22
verses.text: Then they will look toward the earth and see only distress and darkness and fearful gloom, and they will be thrust into utter darkness.

verses.name: Isaiah 9:1
verses.text: Nevertheless, there will be no more gloom for those who were in distress. In the past he humbled the land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali, but in the future he will honor Galilee of the Gentiles, by the way of the sea, along the Jordan-

verses.name: Isaiah 9:2
verses.text: The people walking in darkness have seen a great light; on those living in the land of the shadow of death a light has dawned.

verses.name: Isaiah 9:3
verses.text: You have enlarged the nation and increased their joy; they rejoice before you as people rejoice at the harvest, as men rejoice when dividing the plunder.

verses.name: Isaiah 9:4
verses.text: For as in the day of Midian's defeat, you have shattered the yoke that burdens them, the bar across their shoulders, the rod of their oppressor.

verses.name: Isaiah 9:5
verses.text: Every warrior's boot used in battle and every garment rolled in blood will be destined for burning, will be fuel for the fire.

verses.name: Isaiah 9:6
verses.text: For to us a child is born, to us a son is given, and the government will be on his shoulders. And he will be called Wonderful Counselor, Mighty God, Everlasting Father, Prince of Peace.

verses.name: Isaiah 9:7
verses.text: Of the increase of his government and peace there will be no end. He will reign on David's throne and over his kingdom, establishing and upholding it with justice and righteousness from that time on and forever. The zeal of the LORD Almighty will accomplish this.

verses.name: Isaiah 9:8
verses.text: The Lord has sent a message against Jacob; it will fall on Israel.

verses.name: Isaiah 9:9
verses.text: All the people will know it- Ephraim and the inhabitants of Samaria- who say with pride and arrogance of heart,

verses.name: Isaiah 9:10
verses.text: "The bricks have fallen down, but we will rebuild with dressed stone; the fig trees have been felled, but we will replace them with cedars."

verses.name: Isaiah 9:11
verses.text: But the LORD has strengthened Rezin's foes against them and has spurred their enemies on.

verses.name: Isaiah 9:12
verses.text: Arameans from the east and Philistines from the west have devoured Israel with open mouth. Yet for all this, his anger is not turned away, his hand is still upraised.

verses.name: Isaiah 9:13
verses.text: But the people have not returned to him who struck them, nor have they sought the LORD Almighty.

verses.name: Isaiah 9:14
verses.text: So the LORD will cut off from Israel both head and tail, both palm branch and reed in a single day;

verses.name: Isaiah 9:15
verses.text: the elders and prominent men are the head, the prophets who teach lies are the tail.

verses.name: Isaiah 9:16
verses.text: Those who guide this people mislead them, and those who are guided are led astray.

verses.name: Isaiah 9:17
verses.text: Therefore the Lord will take no pleasure in the young men, nor will he pity the fatherless and widows, for everyone is ungodly and wicked, every mouth speaks vileness. Yet for all this, his anger is not turned away, his hand is still upraised.

verses.name: Isaiah 9:18
verses.text: Surely wickedness burns like a fire; it consumes briers and thorns, it sets the forest thickets ablaze, so that it rolls upward in a column of smoke.

verses.name: Isaiah 9:19
verses.text: By the wrath of the LORD Almighty the land will be scorched and the people will be fuel for the fire; no one will spare his brother.

verses.name: Isaiah 9:20
verses.text: On the right they will devour, but still be hungry; on the left they will eat, but not be satisfied. Each will feed on the flesh of his own offspring:

verses.name: Isaiah 9:21
verses.text: Manasseh will feed on Ephraim, and Ephraim on Manasseh; together they will turn against Judah. Yet for all this, his anger is not turned away, his hand is still upraised.

verses.name: Isaiah 10:1
verses.text: Woe to those who make unjust laws, to those who issue oppressive decrees,

verses.name: Isaiah 10:2
verses.text: to deprive the poor of their rights and withhold justice from the oppressed of my people, making widows their prey and robbing the fatherless.

verses.name: Isaiah 10:3
verses.text: What will you do on the day of reckoning, when disaster comes from afar? To whom will you run for help? Where will you leave your riches?

verses.name: Isaiah 10:4
verses.text: Nothing will remain but to cringe among the captives or fall among the slain. Yet for all this, his anger is not turned away, his hand is still upraised.

verses.name: Isaiah 10:5
verses.text: "Woe to the Assyrian, the rod of my anger, in whose hand is the club of my wrath!

verses.name: Isaiah 10:6
verses.text: I send him against a godless nation, I dispatch him against a people who anger me, to seize loot and snatch plunder, and to trample them down like mud in the streets.

verses.name: Isaiah 10:7
verses.text: But this is not what he intends, this is not what he has in mind; his purpose is to destroy, to put an end to many nations.

verses.name: Isaiah 10:8
verses.text: 'Are not my commanders all kings?' he says.

verses.name: Isaiah 10:9
verses.text: 'Has not Calno fared like Carchemish? Is not Hamath like Arpad, and Samaria like Damascus?

verses.name: Isaiah 10:10
verses.text: As my hand seized the kingdoms of the idols, kingdoms whose images excelled those of Jerusalem and Samaria-

verses.name: Isaiah 10:11
verses.text: shall I not deal with Jerusalem and her images as I dealt with Samaria and her idols?'"

verses.name: Isaiah 10:12
verses.text: When the Lord has finished all his work against Mount Zion and Jerusalem, he will say, "I will punish the king of Assyria for the willful pride of his heart and the haughty look in his eyes.

verses.name: Isaiah 10:13
verses.text: For he says: "'By the strength of my hand I have done this, and by my wisdom, because I have understanding. I removed the boundaries of nations, I plundered their treasures; like a mighty one I subdued their kings.

verses.name: Isaiah 10:14
verses.text: As one reaches into a nest, so my hand reached for the wealth of the nations; as men gather abandoned eggs, so I gathered all the countries; not one flapped a wing, or opened its mouth to chirp.'"

verses.name: Isaiah 10:15
verses.text: Does the ax raise itself above him who swings it, or the saw boast against him who uses it? As if a rod were to wield him who lifts it up, or a club brandish him who is not wood!

verses.name: Isaiah 10:16
verses.text: Therefore, the Lord, the LORD Almighty, will send a wasting disease upon his sturdy warriors; under his pomp a fire will be kindled like a blazing flame.

verses.name: Isaiah 10:17
verses.text: The Light of Israel will become a fire, their Holy One a flame; in a single day it will burn and consume his thorns and his briers.

verses.name: Isaiah 10:18
verses.text: The splendor of his forests and fertile fields it will completely destroy, as when a sick man wastes away.

verses.name: Isaiah 10:19
verses.text: And the remaining trees of his forests will be so few that a child could write them down.

verses.name: Isaiah 10:20
verses.text: In that day the remnant of Israel, the survivors of the house of Jacob, will no longer rely on him who struck them down but will truly rely on the LORD, the Holy One of Israel.

verses.name: Isaiah 10:21
verses.text: A remnant will return, a remnant of Jacob will return to the Mighty God.

verses.name: Isaiah 10:22
verses.text: Though your people, O Israel, be like the sand by the sea, only a remnant will return. Destruction has been decreed, overwhelming and righteous.

verses.name: Isaiah 10:23
verses.text: The Lord, the LORD Almighty, will carry out the destruction decreed upon the whole land.

verses.name: Isaiah 10:24
verses.text: Therefore, this is what the Lord, the LORD Almighty, says: "O my people who live in Zion, do not be afraid of the Assyrians, who beat you with a rod and lift up a club against you, as Egypt did.

verses.name: Isaiah 10:25
verses.text: Very soon my anger against you will end and my wrath will be directed to their destruction."

verses.name: Isaiah 10:26
verses.text: The LORD Almighty will lash them with a whip, as when he struck down Midian at the rock of Oreb; and he will raise his staff over the waters, as he did in Egypt.

verses.name: Isaiah 10:27
verses.text: In that day their burden will be lifted from your shoulders, their yoke from your neck; the yoke will be broken because you have grown so fat.

verses.name: Isaiah 10:28
verses.text: They enter Aiath; they pass through Migron; they store supplies at Micmash.

verses.name: Isaiah 10:29
verses.text: They go over the pass, and say, "We will camp overnight at Geba." Ramah trembles; Gibeah of Saul flees.

verses.name: Isaiah 10:30
verses.text: Cry out, O Daughter of Gallim! Listen, O Laishah! Poor Anathoth!

verses.name: Isaiah 10:31
verses.text: Madmenah is in flight; the people of Gebim take cover.

verses.name: Isaiah 10:32
verses.text: This day they will halt at Nob; they will shake their fist at the mount of the Daughter of Zion, at the hill of Jerusalem.

verses.name: Isaiah 10:33
verses.text: See, the Lord, the LORD Almighty, will lop off the boughs with great power. The lofty trees will be felled, the tall ones will be brought low.

verses.name: Isaiah 10:34
verses.text: He will cut down the forest thickets with an ax; Lebanon will fall before the Mighty One.

verses.name: Isaiah 11:1
verses.text: A shoot will come up from the stump of Jesse; from his roots a Branch will bear fruit.

verses.name: Isaiah 11:2
verses.text: The Spirit of the LORD will rest on him- the Spirit of wisdom and of understanding, the Spirit of counsel and of power, the Spirit of knowledge and of the fear of the LORD -

verses.name: Isaiah 11:3
verses.text: and he will delight in the fear of the LORD. He will not judge by what he sees with his eyes, or decide by what he hears with his ears;

verses.name: Isaiah 11:4
verses.text: but with righteousness he will judge the needy, with justice he will give decisions for the poor of the earth. He will strike the earth with the rod of his mouth; with the breath of his lips he will slay the wicked.

verses.name: Isaiah 11:5
verses.text: Righteousness will be his belt and faithfulness the sash around his waist.

verses.name: Isaiah 11:6
verses.text: The wolf will live with the lamb, the leopard will lie down with the goat, the calf and the lion and the yearling together; and a little child will lead them.

verses.name: Isaiah 11:7
verses.text: The cow will feed with the bear, their young will lie down together, and the lion will eat straw like the ox.

verses.name: Isaiah 11:8
verses.text: The infant will play near the hole of the cobra, and the young child put his hand into the viper's nest.

verses.name: Isaiah 11:9
verses.text: They will neither harm nor destroy on all my holy mountain, for the earth will be full of the knowledge of the LORD as the waters cover the sea.

verses.name: Isaiah 11:10
verses.text: In that day the Root of Jesse will stand as a banner for the peoples; the nations will rally to him, and his place of rest will be glorious.

verses.name: Isaiah 11:11
verses.text: In that day the Lord will reach out his hand a second time to reclaim the remnant that is left of his people from Assyria, from Lower Egypt, from Upper Egypt, from Cush, from Elam, from Babylonia, from Hamath and from the islands of the sea.

verses.name: Isaiah 11:12
verses.text: He will raise a banner for the nations and gather the exiles of Israel; he will assemble the scattered people of Judah from the four quarters of the earth.

verses.name: Isaiah 11:13
verses.text: Ephraim's jealousy will vanish, and Judah's enemies will be cut off; Ephraim will not be jealous of Judah, nor Judah hostile toward Ephraim.

verses.name: Isaiah 11:14
verses.text: They will swoop down on the slopes of Philistia to the west; together they will plunder the people to the east. They will lay hands on Edom and Moab, and the Ammonites will be subject to them.

verses.name: Isaiah 11:15
verses.text: The LORD will dry up the gulf of the Egyptian sea; with a scorching wind he will sweep his hand over the Euphrates River. He will break it up into seven streams so that men can cross over in sandals.

verses.name: Isaiah 11:16
verses.text: There will be a highway for the remnant of his people that is left from Assyria, as there was for Israel when they came up from Egypt.

verses.name: Isaiah 12:1
verses.text: In that day you will say: "I will praise you, O LORD. Although you were angry with me, your anger has turned away and you have comforted me.

verses.name: Isaiah 12:2
verses.text: Surely God is my salvation; I will trust and not be afraid. The LORD, the LORD, is my strength and my song; he has become my salvation."

verses.name: Isaiah 12:3
verses.text: With joy you will draw water from the wells of salvation.

verses.name: Isaiah 12:4
verses.text: In that day you will say: "Give thanks to the LORD, call on his name; make known among the nations what he has done, and proclaim that his name is exalted.

verses.name: Isaiah 12:5
verses.text: Sing to the LORD, for he has done glorious things; let this be known to all the world.

verses.name: Isaiah 12:6
verses.text: Shout aloud and sing for joy, people of Zion, for great is the Holy One of Israel among you."

verses.name: Isaiah 13:1
verses.text: An oracle concerning Babylon that Isaiah son of Amoz saw:

verses.name: Isaiah 13:2
verses.text: Raise a banner on a bare hilltop, shout to them; beckon to them to enter the gates of the nobles.

verses.name: Isaiah 13:3
verses.text: I have commanded my holy ones; I have summoned my warriors to carry out my wrath- those who rejoice in my triumph.

verses.name: Isaiah 13:4
verses.text: Listen, a noise on the mountains, like that of a great multitude! Listen, an uproar among the kingdoms, like nations massing together! The LORD Almighty is mustering an army for war.

verses.name: Isaiah 13:5
verses.text: They come from faraway lands, from the ends of the heavens- the LORD and the weapons of his wrath- to destroy the whole country.

verses.name: Isaiah 13:6
verses.text: Wail, for the day of the LORD is near; it will come like destruction from the Almighty.

verses.name: Isaiah 13:7
verses.text: Because of this, all hands will go limp, every man's heart will melt.

verses.name: Isaiah 13:8
verses.text: Terror will seize them, pain and anguish will grip them; they will writhe like a woman in labor. They will look aghast at each other, their faces aflame.

verses.name: Isaiah 13:9
verses.text: See, the day of the LORD is coming -a cruel day, with wrath and fierce anger- to make the land desolate and destroy the sinners within it.

verses.name: Isaiah 13:10
verses.text: The stars of heaven and their constellations will not show their light. The rising sun will be darkened and the moon will not give its light.

verses.name: Isaiah 13:11
verses.text: I will punish the world for its evil, the wicked for their sins. I will put an end to the arrogance of the haughty and will humble the pride of the ruthless.

verses.name: Isaiah 13:12
verses.text: I will make man scarcer than pure gold, more rare than the gold of Ophir.

verses.name: Isaiah 13:13
verses.text: Therefore I will make the heavens tremble; and the earth will shake from its place at the wrath of the LORD Almighty, in the day of his burning anger.

verses.name: Isaiah 13:14
verses.text: Like a hunted gazelle, like sheep without a shepherd, each will return to his own people, each will flee to his native land.

verses.name: Isaiah 13:15
verses.text: Whoever is captured will be thrust through; all who are caught will fall by the sword.

verses.name: Isaiah 13:16
verses.text: Their infants will be dashed to pieces before their eyes; their houses will be looted and their wives ravished.

verses.name: Isaiah 13:17
verses.text: See, I will stir up against them the Medes, who do not care for silver and have no delight in gold.

verses.name: Isaiah 13:18
verses.text: Their bows will strike down the young men; they will have no mercy on infants nor will they look with compassion on children.

verses.name: Isaiah 13:19
verses.text: Babylon, the jewel of kingdoms, the glory of the Babylonians' pride, will be overthrown by God like Sodom and Gomorrah.

verses.name: Isaiah 13:20
verses.text: She will never be inhabited or lived in through all generations; no Arab will pitch his tent there, no shepherd will rest his flocks there.

verses.name: Isaiah 13:21
verses.text: But desert creatures will lie there, jackals will fill her houses; there the owls will dwell, and there the wild goats will leap about.

verses.name: Isaiah 13:22
verses.text: Hyenas will howl in her strongholds, jackals in her luxurious palaces. Her time is at hand, and her days will not be prolonged.

verses.name: Isaiah 14:1
verses.text: The LORD will have compassion on Jacob; once again he will choose Israel and will settle them in their own land. Aliens will join them and unite with the house of Jacob.

verses.name: Isaiah 14:2
verses.text: Nations will take them and bring them to their own place. And the house of Israel will possess the nations as menservants and maidservants in the LORD's land. They will make captives of their captors and rule over their oppressors.

verses.name: Isaiah 14:3
verses.text: On the day the LORD gives you relief from suffering and turmoil and cruel bondage,

verses.name: Isaiah 14:4
verses.text: you will take up this taunt against the king of Babylon: How the oppressor has come to an end! How his fury has ended!

verses.name: Isaiah 14:5
verses.text: The LORD has broken the rod of the wicked, the scepter of the rulers,

verses.name: Isaiah 14:6
verses.text: which in anger struck down peoples with unceasing blows, and in fury subdued nations with relentless aggression.

verses.name: Isaiah 14:7
verses.text: All the lands are at rest and at peace; they break into singing.

verses.name: Isaiah 14:8
verses.text: Even the pine trees and the cedars of Lebanon exult over you and say, "Now that you have been laid low, no woodsman comes to cut us down."

verses.name: Isaiah 14:9
verses.text: The grave below is all astir to meet you at your coming; it rouses the spirits of the departed to greet you- all those who were leaders in the world; it makes them rise from their thrones- all those who were kings over the nations.

verses.name: Isaiah 14:10
verses.text: They will all respond, they will say to you, "You also have become weak, as we are; you have become like us."

verses.name: Isaiah 14:11
verses.text: All your pomp has been brought down to the grave, along with the noise of your harps; maggots are spread out beneath you and worms cover you.

verses.name: Isaiah 14:12
verses.text: How you have fallen from heaven, O morning star, son of the dawn! You have been cast down to the earth, you who once laid low the nations!

verses.name: Isaiah 14:13
verses.text: You said in your heart, "I will ascend to heaven; I will raise my throne above the stars of God; I will sit enthroned on the mount of assembly, on the utmost heights of the sacred mountain.

verses.name: Isaiah 14:14
verses.text: I will ascend above the tops of the clouds; I will make myself like the Most High."

verses.name: Isaiah 14:15
verses.text: But you are brought down to the grave, to the depths of the pit.

verses.name: Isaiah 14:16
verses.text: Those who see you stare at you, they ponder your fate: "Is this the man who shook the earth and made kingdoms tremble,

verses.name: Isaiah 14:17
verses.text: the man who made the world a desert, who overthrew its cities and would not let his captives go home?"

verses.name: Isaiah 14:18
verses.text: All the kings of the nations lie in state, each in his own tomb.

verses.name: Isaiah 14:19
verses.text: But you are cast out of your tomb like a rejected branch; you are covered with the slain, with those pierced by the sword, those who descend to the stones of the pit. Like a corpse trampled underfoot,

verses.name: Isaiah 14:20
verses.text: you will not join them in burial, for you have destroyed your land and killed your people. The offspring of the wicked will never be mentioned again.

verses.name: Isaiah 14:21
verses.text: Prepare a place to slaughter his sons for the sins of their forefathers; they are not to rise to inherit the land and cover the earth with their cities.

verses.name: Isaiah 14:22
verses.text: "I will rise up against them," declares the LORD Almighty. "I will cut off from Babylon her name and survivors, her offspring and descendants," declares the LORD.

verses.name: Isaiah 14:23
verses.text: "I will turn her into a place for owls and into swampland; I will sweep her with the broom of destruction," declares the LORD Almighty.

verses.name: Isaiah 14:24
verses.text: The LORD Almighty has sworn, "Surely, as I have planned, so it will be, and as I have purposed, so it will stand.

verses.name: Isaiah 14:25
verses.text: I will crush the Assyrian in my land; on my mountains I will trample him down. His yoke will be taken from my people, and his burden removed from their shoulders."

verses.name: Isaiah 14:26
verses.text: This is the plan determined for the whole world; this is the hand stretched out over all nations.

verses.name: Isaiah 14:27
verses.text: For the LORD Almighty has purposed, and who can thwart him? His hand is stretched out, and who can turn it back?

verses.name: Isaiah 14:28
verses.text: This oracle came in the year King Ahaz died:

verses.name: Isaiah 14:29
verses.text: Do not rejoice, all you Philistines, that the rod that struck you is broken; from the root of that snake will spring up a viper, its fruit will be a darting, venomous serpent.

verses.name: Isaiah 14:30
verses.text: The poorest of the poor will find pasture, and the needy will lie down in safety. But your root I will destroy by famine; it will slay your survivors.

verses.name: Isaiah 14:31
verses.text: Wail, O gate! Howl, O city! Melt away, all you Philistines! A cloud of smoke comes from the north, and there is not a straggler in its ranks.

verses.name: Isaiah 14:32
verses.text: What answer shall be given to the envoys of that nation? "The LORD has established Zion, and in her his afflicted people will find refuge."

verses.name: Isaiah 15:1
verses.text: An oracle concerning Moab: Ar in Moab is ruined, destroyed in a night! Kir in Moab is ruined, destroyed in a night!

verses.name: Isaiah 15:2
verses.text: Dibon goes up to its temple, to its high places to weep; Moab wails over Nebo and Medeba. Every head is shaved and every beard cut off.

verses.name: Isaiah 15:3
verses.text: In the streets they wear sackcloth; on the roofs and in the public squares they all wail, prostrate with weeping.

verses.name: Isaiah 15:4
verses.text: Heshbon and Elealeh cry out, their voices are heard all the way to Jahaz. Therefore the armed men of Moab cry out, and their hearts are faint.

verses.name: Isaiah 15:5
verses.text: My heart cries out over Moab; her fugitives flee as far as Zoar, as far as Eglath Shelishiyah. They go up the way to Luhith, weeping as they go; on the road to Horonaim they lament their destruction.

verses.name: Isaiah 15:6
verses.text: The waters of Nimrim are dried up and the grass is withered; the vegetation is gone and nothing green is left.

verses.name: Isaiah 15:7
verses.text: So the wealth they have acquired and stored up they carry away over the Ravine of the Poplars.

verses.name: Isaiah 15:8
verses.text: Their outcry echoes along the border of Moab; their wailing reaches as far as Eglaim, their lamentation as far as Beer Elim.

verses.name: Isaiah 15:9
verses.text: Dimon's waters are full of blood, but I will bring still more upon Dimon - a lion upon the fugitives of Moab and upon those who remain in the land.

verses.name: Isaiah 16:1
verses.text: Send lambs as tribute to the ruler of the land, from Sela, across the desert, to the mount of the Daughter of Zion.

verses.name: Isaiah 16:2
verses.text: Like fluttering birds pushed from the nest, so are the women of Moab at the fords of the Arnon.

verses.name: Isaiah 16:3
verses.text: "Give us counsel, render a decision. Make your shadow like night- at high noon. Hide the fugitives, do not betray the refugees.

verses.name: Isaiah 16:4
verses.text: Let the Moabite fugitives stay with you; be their shelter from the destroyer." The oppressor will come to an end, and destruction will cease; the aggressor will vanish from the land.

verses.name: Isaiah 16:5
verses.text: In love a throne will be established; in faithfulness a man will sit on it- one from the house of David- one who in judging seeks justice and speeds the cause of righteousness.

verses.name: Isaiah 16:6
verses.text: We have heard of Moab's pride- her overweening pride and conceit, her pride and her insolence- but her boasts are empty.

verses.name: Isaiah 16:7
verses.text: Therefore the Moabites wail, they wail together for Moab. Lament and grieve for the men of Kir Hareseth.

verses.name: Isaiah 16:8
verses.text: The fields of Heshbon wither, the vines of Sibmah also. The rulers of the nations have trampled down the choicest vines, which once reached Jazer and spread toward the desert. Their shoots spread out and went as far as the sea.

verses.name: Isaiah 16:9
verses.text: So I weep, as Jazer weeps, for the vines of Sibmah. O Heshbon, O Elealeh, I drench you with tears! The shouts of joy over your ripened fruit and over your harvests have been stilled.

verses.name: Isaiah 16:10
verses.text: Joy and gladness are taken away from the orchards; no one sings or shouts in the vineyards; no one treads out wine at the presses, for I have put an end to the shouting.

verses.name: Isaiah 16:11
verses.text: My heart laments for Moab like a harp, my inmost being for Kir Hareseth.

verses.name: Isaiah 16:12
verses.text: When Moab appears at her high place, she only wears herself out; when she goes to her shrine to pray, it is to no avail.

verses.name: Isaiah 16:13
verses.text: This is the word the LORD has already spoken concerning Moab.

verses.name: Isaiah 16:14
verses.text: But now the LORD says: "Within three years, as a servant bound by contract would count them, Moab's splendor and all her many people will be despised, and her survivors will be very few and feeble."

verses.name: Isaiah 17:1
verses.text: An oracle concerning Damascus: "See, Damascus will no longer be a city but will become a heap of ruins.

verses.name: Isaiah 17:2
verses.text: The cities of Aroer will be deserted and left to flocks, which will lie down, with no one to make them afraid.

verses.name: Isaiah 17:3
verses.text: The fortified city will disappear from Ephraim, and royal power from Damascus; the remnant of Aram will be like the glory of the Israelites," declares the LORD Almighty.

verses.name: Isaiah 17:4
verses.text: "In that day the glory of Jacob will fade; the fat of his body will waste away.

verses.name: Isaiah 17:5
verses.text: It will be as when a reaper gathers the standing grain and harvests the grain with his arm- as when a man gleans heads of grain in the Valley of Rephaim.

verses.name: Isaiah 17:6
verses.text: Yet some gleanings will remain, as when an olive tree is beaten, leaving two or three olives on the topmost branches, four or five on the fruitful boughs," declares the LORD, the God of Israel.

verses.name: Isaiah 17:7
verses.text: In that day men will look to their Maker and turn their eyes to the Holy One of Israel.

verses.name: Isaiah 17:8
verses.text: They will not look to the altars, the work of their hands, and they will have no regard for the Asherah poles and the incense altars their fingers have made.

verses.name: Isaiah 17:9
verses.text: In that day their strong cities, which they left because of the Israelites, will be like places abandoned to thickets and undergrowth. And all will be desolation.

verses.name: Isaiah 17:10
verses.text: You have forgotten God your Savior; you have not remembered the Rock, your fortress. Therefore, though you set out the finest plants and plant imported vines,

verses.name: Isaiah 17:11
verses.text: though on the day you set them out, you make them grow, and on the morning when you plant them, you bring them to bud, yet the harvest will be as nothing in the day of disease and incurable pain.

verses.name: Isaiah 17:12
verses.text: Oh, the raging of many nations- they rage like the raging sea! Oh, the uproar of the peoples- they roar like the roaring of great waters!

verses.name: Isaiah 17:13
verses.text: Although the peoples roar like the roar of surging waters, when he rebukes them they flee far away, driven before the wind like chaff on the hills, like tumbleweed before a gale.

verses.name: Isaiah 17:14
verses.text: In the evening, sudden terror! Before the morning, they are gone! This is the portion of those who loot us, the lot of those who plunder us.

verses.name: Isaiah 18:1
verses.text: Woe to the land of whirring wings along the rivers of Cush,

verses.name: Isaiah 18:2
verses.text: which sends envoys by sea in papyrus boats over the water. Go, swift messengers, to a people tall and smooth-skinned, to a people feared far and wide, an aggressive nation of strange speech, whose land is divided by rivers.

verses.name: Isaiah 18:3
verses.text: All you people of the world, you who live on the earth, when a banner is raised on the mountains, you will see it, and when a trumpet sounds, you will hear it.

verses.name: Isaiah 18:4
verses.text: This is what the LORD says to me: "I will remain quiet and will look on from my dwelling place, like shimmering heat in the sunshine, like a cloud of dew in the heat of harvest."

verses.name: Isaiah 18:5
verses.text: For, before the harvest, when the blossom is gone and the flower becomes a ripening grape, he will cut off the shoots with pruning knives, and cut down and take away the spreading branches.

verses.name: Isaiah 18:6
verses.text: They will all be left to the mountain birds of prey and to the wild animals; the birds will feed on them all summer, the wild animals all winter.

verses.name: Isaiah 18:7
verses.text: At that time gifts will be brought to the LORD Almighty from a people tall and smooth-skinned, from a people feared far and wide, an aggressive nation of strange speech, whose land is divided by rivers- the gifts will be brought to Mount Zion, the place of the Name of the LORD Almighty.

verses.name: Isaiah 19:1
verses.text: An oracle concerning Egypt: See, the LORD rides on a swift cloud and is coming to Egypt. The idols of Egypt tremble before him, and the hearts of the Egyptians melt within them.

verses.name: Isaiah 19:2
verses.text: "I will stir up Egyptian against Egyptian- brother will fight against brother, neighbor against neighbor, city against city, kingdom against kingdom.

verses.name: Isaiah 19:3
verses.text: The Egyptians will lose heart, and I will bring their plans to nothing; they will consult the idols and the spirits of the dead, the mediums and the spiritists.

verses.name: Isaiah 19:4
verses.text: I will hand the Egyptians over to the power of a cruel master, and a fierce king will rule over them," declares the Lord, the LORD Almighty.

verses.name: Isaiah 19:5
verses.text: The waters of the river will dry up, and the riverbed will be parched and dry.

verses.name: Isaiah 19:6
verses.text: The canals will stink; the streams of Egypt will dwindle and dry up. The reeds and rushes will wither,

verses.name: Isaiah 19:7
verses.text: also the plants along the Nile, at the mouth of the river. Every sown field along the Nile will become parched, will blow away and be no more.

verses.name: Isaiah 19:8
verses.text: The fishermen will groan and lament, all who cast hooks into the Nile; those who throw nets on the water will pine away.

verses.name: Isaiah 19:9
verses.text: Those who work with combed flax will despair, the weavers of fine linen will lose hope.

verses.name: Isaiah 19:10
verses.text: The workers in cloth will be dejected, and all the wage earners will be sick at heart.

verses.name: Isaiah 19:11
verses.text: The officials of Zoan are nothing but fools; the wise counselors of Pharaoh give senseless advice. How can you say to Pharaoh, "I am one of the wise men, a disciple of the ancient kings"?

verses.name: Isaiah 19:12
verses.text: Where are your wise men now? Let them show you and make known what the LORD Almighty has planned against Egypt.

verses.name: Isaiah 19:13
verses.text: The officials of Zoan have become fools, the leaders of Memphis are deceived; the cornerstones of her peoples have led Egypt astray.

verses.name: Isaiah 19:14
verses.text: The LORD has poured into them a spirit of dizziness; they make Egypt stagger in all that she does, as a drunkard staggers around in his vomit.

verses.name: Isaiah 19:15
verses.text: There is nothing Egypt can do- head or tail, palm branch or reed.

verses.name: Isaiah 19:16
verses.text: In that day the Egyptians will be like women. They will shudder with fear at the uplifted hand that the LORD Almighty raises against them.

verses.name: Isaiah 19:17
verses.text: And the land of Judah will bring terror to the Egyptians; everyone to whom Judah is mentioned will be terrified, because of what the LORD Almighty is planning against them.

verses.name: Isaiah 19:18
verses.text: In that day five cities in Egypt will speak the language of Canaan and swear allegiance to the LORD Almighty. One of them will be called the City of Destruction.

verses.name: Isaiah 19:19
verses.text: In that day there will be an altar to the LORD in the heart of Egypt, and a monument to the LORD at its border.

verses.name: Isaiah 19:20
verses.text: It will be a sign and witness to the LORD Almighty in the land of Egypt. When they cry out to the LORD because of their oppressors, he will send them a savior and defender, and he will rescue them.

verses.name: Isaiah 19:21
verses.text: So the LORD will make himself known to the Egyptians, and in that day they will acknowledge the LORD. They will worship with sacrifices and grain offerings; they will make vows to the LORD and keep them.

verses.name: Isaiah 19:22
verses.text: The LORD will strike Egypt with a plague; he will strike them and heal them. They will turn to the LORD, and he will respond to their pleas and heal them.

verses.name: Isaiah 19:23
verses.text: In that day there will be a highway from Egypt to Assyria. The Assyrians will go to Egypt and the Egyptians to Assyria. The Egyptians and Assyrians will worship together.

verses.name: Isaiah 19:24
verses.text: In that day Israel will be the third, along with Egypt and Assyria, a blessing on the earth.

verses.name: Isaiah 19:25
verses.text: The LORD Almighty will bless them, saying, "Blessed be Egypt my people, Assyria my handiwork, and Israel my inheritance."

verses.name: Isaiah 20:1
verses.text: In the year that the supreme commander, sent by Sargon king of Assyria, came to Ashdod and attacked and captured it-

verses.name: Isaiah 20:2
verses.text: at that time the LORD spoke through Isaiah son of Amoz. He said to him, "Take off the sackcloth from your body and the sandals from your feet." And he did so, going around stripped and barefoot.

verses.name: Isaiah 20:3
verses.text: Then the LORD said, "Just as my servant Isaiah has gone stripped and barefoot for three years, as a sign and portent against Egypt and Cush,

verses.name: Isaiah 20:4
verses.text: so the king of Assyria will lead away stripped and barefoot the Egyptian captives and Cushite exiles, young and old, with buttocks bared-to Egypt's shame.

verses.name: Isaiah 20:5
verses.text: Those who trusted in Cush and boasted in Egypt will be afraid and put to shame.

verses.name: Isaiah 20:6
verses.text: In that day the people who live on this coast will say, 'See what has happened to those we relied on, those we fled to for help and deliverance from the king of Assyria! How then can we escape?'"

verses.name: Isaiah 21:1
verses.text: An oracle concerning the Desert by the Sea: Like whirlwinds sweeping through the southland, an invader comes from the desert, from a land of terror.

verses.name: Isaiah 21:2
verses.text: A dire vision has been shown to me: The traitor betrays, the looter takes loot. Elam, attack! Media, lay siege! I will bring to an end all the groaning she caused.

verses.name: Isaiah 21:3
verses.text: At this my body is racked with pain, pangs seize me, like those of a woman in labor; I am staggered by what I hear, I am bewildered by what I see.

verses.name: Isaiah 21:4
verses.text: My heart falters, fear makes me tremble; the twilight I longed for has become a horror to me.

verses.name: Isaiah 21:5
verses.text: They set the tables, they spread the rugs, they eat, they drink! Get up, you officers, oil the shields!

verses.name: Isaiah 21:6
verses.text: This is what the Lord says to me: "Go, post a lookout and have him report what he sees.

verses.name: Isaiah 21:7
verses.text: When he sees chariots with teams of horses, riders on donkeys or riders on camels, let him be alert, fully alert."

verses.name: Isaiah 21:8
verses.text: And the lookout shouted, "Day after day, my lord, I stand on the watchtower; every night I stay at my post.

verses.name: Isaiah 21:9
verses.text: Look, here comes a man in a chariot with a team of horses. And he gives back the answer: 'Babylon has fallen, has fallen! All the images of its gods lie shattered on the ground!'"

verses.name: Isaiah 21:10
verses.text: O my people, crushed on the threshing floor, I tell you what I have heard from the LORD Almighty, from the God of Israel.

verses.name: Isaiah 21:11
verses.text: An oracle concerning Dumah: Someone calls to me from Seir, "Watchman, what is left of the night? Watchman, what is left of the night?"

verses.name: Isaiah 21:12
verses.text: The watchman replies, "Morning is coming, but also the night. If you would ask, then ask; and come back yet again."

verses.name: Isaiah 21:13
verses.text: An oracle concerning Arabia: You caravans of Dedanites, who camp in the thickets of Arabia,

verses.name: Isaiah 21:14
verses.text: bring water for the thirsty; you who live in Tema, bring food for the fugitives.

verses.name: Isaiah 21:15
verses.text: They flee from the sword, from the drawn sword, from the bent bow and from the heat of battle.

verses.name: Isaiah 21:16
verses.text: This is what the Lord says to me: "Within one year, as a servant bound by contract would count it, all the pomp of Kedar will come to an end.

verses.name: Isaiah 21:17
verses.text: The survivors of the bowmen, the warriors of Kedar, will be few." The LORD, the God of Israel, has spoken.

verses.name: Isaiah 22:1
verses.text: An oracle concerning the Valley of Vision: What troubles you now, that you have all gone up on the roofs,

verses.name: Isaiah 22:2
verses.text: O town full of commotion, O city of tumult and revelry? Your slain were not killed by the sword, nor did they die in battle.

verses.name: Isaiah 22:3
verses.text: All your leaders have fled together; they have been captured without using the bow. All you who were caught were taken prisoner together, having fled while the enemy was still far away.

verses.name: Isaiah 22:4
verses.text: Therefore I said, "Turn away from me; let me weep bitterly. Do not try to console me over the destruction of my people."

verses.name: Isaiah 22:5
verses.text: The Lord, the LORD Almighty, has a day of tumult and trampling and terror in the Valley of Vision, a day of battering down walls and of crying out to the mountains.

verses.name: Isaiah 22:6
verses.text: Elam takes up the quiver, with her charioteers and horses; Kir uncovers the shield.

verses.name: Isaiah 22:7
verses.text: Your choicest valleys are full of chariots, and horsemen are posted at the city gates;

verses.name: Isaiah 22:8
verses.text: the defenses of Judah are stripped away. And you looked in that day to the weapons in the Palace of the Forest;

verses.name: Isaiah 22:9
verses.text: you saw that the City of David had many breaches in its defenses; you stored up water in the Lower Pool.

verses.name: Isaiah 22:10
verses.text: You counted the buildings in Jerusalem and tore down houses to strengthen the wall.

verses.name: Isaiah 22:11
verses.text: You built a reservoir between the two walls for the water of the Old Pool, but you did not look to the One who made it, or have regard for the One who planned it long ago.

verses.name: Isaiah 22:12
verses.text: The Lord, the LORD Almighty, called you on that day to weep and to wail, to tear out your hair and put on sackcloth.

verses.name: Isaiah 22:13
verses.text: But see, there is joy and revelry, slaughtering of cattle and killing of sheep, eating of meat and drinking of wine! "Let us eat and drink," you say, "for tomorrow we die!"

verses.name: Isaiah 22:14
verses.text: The LORD Almighty has revealed this in my hearing: "Till your dying day this sin will not be atoned for," says the Lord, the LORD Almighty.

verses.name: Isaiah 22:15
verses.text: This is what the Lord, the LORD Almighty, says: "Go, say to this steward, to Shebna, who is in charge of the palace:

verses.name: Isaiah 22:16
verses.text: What are you doing here and who gave you permission to cut out a grave for yourself here, hewing your grave on the height and chiseling your resting place in the rock?

verses.name: Isaiah 22:17
verses.text: "Beware, the LORD is about to take firm hold of you and hurl you away, O you mighty man.

verses.name: Isaiah 22:18
verses.text: He will roll you up tightly like a ball and throw you into a large country. There you will die and there your splendid chariots will remain- you disgrace to your master's house!

verses.name: Isaiah 22:19
verses.text: I will depose you from your office, and you will be ousted from your position.

verses.name: Isaiah 22:20
verses.text: "In that day I will summon my servant, Eliakim son of Hilkiah.

verses.name: Isaiah 22:21
verses.text: I will clothe him with your robe and fasten your sash around him and hand your authority over to him. He will be a father to those who live in Jerusalem and to the house of Judah.

verses.name: Isaiah 22:22
verses.text: I will place on his shoulder the key to the house of David; what he opens no one can shut, and what he shuts no one can open.

verses.name: Isaiah 22:23
verses.text: I will drive him like a peg into a firm place; he will be a seat of honor for the house of his father.

verses.name: Isaiah 22:24
verses.text: All the glory of his family will hang on him: its offspring and offshoots-all its lesser vessels, from the bowls to all the jars.

verses.name: Isaiah 22:25
verses.text: "In that day," declares the LORD Almighty, "the peg driven into the firm place will give way; it will be sheared off and will fall, and the load hanging on it will be cut down." The LORD has spoken.

verses.name: Isaiah 23:1
verses.text: An oracle concerning Tyre: Wail, O ships of Tarshish! For Tyre is destroyed and left without house or harbor. From the land of Cyprus word has come to them.

verses.name: Isaiah 23:2
verses.text: Be silent, you people of the island and you merchants of Sidon, whom the seafarers have enriched.

verses.name: Isaiah 23:3
verses.text: On the great waters came the grain of the Shihor; the harvest of the Nile was the revenue of Tyre, and she became the marketplace of the nations.

verses.name: Isaiah 23:4
verses.text: Be ashamed, O Sidon, and you, O fortress of the sea, for the sea has spoken: "I have neither been in labor nor given birth; I have neither reared sons nor brought up daughters."

verses.name: Isaiah 23:5
verses.text: When word comes to Egypt, they will be in anguish at the report from Tyre.

verses.name: Isaiah 23:6
verses.text: Cross over to Tarshish; wail, you people of the island.

verses.name: Isaiah 23:7
verses.text: Is this your city of revelry, the old, old city, whose feet have taken her to settle in far-off lands?

verses.name: Isaiah 23:8
verses.text: Who planned this against Tyre, the bestower of crowns, whose merchants are princes, whose traders are renowned in the earth?

verses.name: Isaiah 23:9
verses.text: The LORD Almighty planned it, to bring low the pride of all glory and to humble all who are renowned on the earth.

verses.name: Isaiah 23:10
verses.text: Till your land as along the Nile, O Daughter of Tarshish, for you no longer have a harbor.

verses.name: Isaiah 23:11
verses.text: The LORD has stretched out his hand over the sea and made its kingdoms tremble. He has given an order concerning Phoenicia that her fortresses be destroyed.

verses.name: Isaiah 23:12
verses.text: He said, "No more of your reveling, O Virgin Daughter of Sidon, now crushed! "Up, cross over to Cyprus; even there you will find no rest."

verses.name: Isaiah 23:13
verses.text: Look at the land of the Babylonians, this people that is now of no account! The Assyrians have made it a place for desert creatures; they raised up their siege towers, they stripped its fortresses bare and turned it into a ruin.

verses.name: Isaiah 23:14
verses.text: Wail, you ships of Tarshish; your fortress is destroyed!

verses.name: Isaiah 23:15
verses.text: At that time Tyre will be forgotten for seventy years, the span of a king's life. But at the end of these seventy years, it will happen to Tyre as in the song of the prostitute:

verses.name: Isaiah 23:16
verses.text: "Take up a harp, walk through the city, O prostitute forgotten; play the harp well, sing many a song, so that you will be remembered."

verses.name: Isaiah 23:17
verses.text: At the end of seventy years, the LORD will deal with Tyre. She will return to her hire as a prostitute and will ply her trade with all the kingdoms on the face of the earth.

verses.name: Isaiah 23:18
verses.text: Yet her profit and her earnings will be set apart for the LORD; they will not be stored up or hoarded. Her profits will go to those who live before the LORD, for abundant food and fine clothes.

verses.name: Isaiah 24:1
verses.text: See, the LORD is going to lay waste the earth and devastate it; he will ruin its face and scatter its inhabitants-

verses.name: Isaiah 24:2
verses.text: it will be the same for priest as for people, for master as for servant, for mistress as for maid, for seller as for buyer, for borrower as for lender, for debtor as for creditor.

verses.name: Isaiah 24:3
verses.text: The earth will be completely laid waste and totally plundered. The LORD has spoken this word.

verses.name: Isaiah 24:4
verses.text: The earth dries up and withers, the world languishes and withers, the exalted of the earth languish.

verses.name: Isaiah 24:5
verses.text: The earth is defiled by its people; they have disobeyed the laws, violated the statutes and broken the everlasting covenant.

verses.name: Isaiah 24:6
verses.text: Therefore a curse consumes the earth; its people must bear their guilt. Therefore earth's inhabitants are burned up, and very few are left.

verses.name: Isaiah 24:7
verses.text: The new wine dries up and the vine withers; all the merrymakers groan.

verses.name: Isaiah 24:8
verses.text: The gaiety of the tambourines is stilled, the noise of the revelers has stopped, the joyful harp is silent.

verses.name: Isaiah 24:9
verses.text: No longer do they drink wine with a song; the beer is bitter to its drinkers.

verses.name: Isaiah 24:10
verses.text: The ruined city lies desolate; the entrance to every house is barred.

verses.name: Isaiah 24:11
verses.text: In the streets they cry out for wine; all joy turns to gloom, all gaiety is banished from the earth.

verses.name: Isaiah 24:12
verses.text: The city is left in ruins, its gate is battered to pieces.

verses.name: Isaiah 24:13
verses.text: So will it be on the earth and among the nations, as when an olive tree is beaten, or as when gleanings are left after the grape harvest.

verses.name: Isaiah 24:14
verses.text: They raise their voices, they shout for joy; from the west they acclaim the LORD's majesty.

verses.name: Isaiah 24:15
verses.text: Therefore in the east give glory to the LORD; exalt the name of the LORD, the God of Israel, in the islands of the sea.

verses.name: Isaiah 24:16
verses.text: From the ends of the earth we hear singing: "Glory to the Righteous One." But I said, "I waste away, I waste away! Woe to me! The treacherous betray! With treachery the treacherous betray!"

verses.name: Isaiah 24:17
verses.text: Terror and pit and snare await you, O people of the earth.

verses.name: Isaiah 24:18
verses.text: Whoever flees at the sound of terror will fall into a pit; whoever climbs out of the pit will be caught in a snare. The floodgates of the heavens are opened, the foundations of the earth shake.

verses.name: Isaiah 24:19
verses.text: The earth is broken up, the earth is split asunder, the earth is thoroughly shaken.

verses.name: Isaiah 24:20
verses.text: The earth reels like a drunkard, it sways like a hut in the wind; so heavy upon it is the guilt of its rebellion that it falls-never to rise again.

verses.name: Isaiah 24:21
verses.text: In that day the LORD will punish the powers in the heavens above and the kings on the earth below.

verses.name: Isaiah 24:22
verses.text: They will be herded together like prisoners bound in a dungeon; they will be shut up in prison and be punished after many days.

verses.name: Isaiah 24:23
verses.text: The moon will be abashed, the sun ashamed; for the LORD Almighty will reign on Mount Zion and in Jerusalem, and before its elders, gloriously.

verses.name: Isaiah 25:1
verses.text: O LORD, you are my God; I will exalt you and praise your name, for in perfect faithfulness you have done marvelous things, things planned long ago.

verses.name: Isaiah 25:2
verses.text: You have made the city a heap of rubble, the fortified town a ruin, the foreigners' stronghold a city no more; it will never be rebuilt.

verses.name: Isaiah 25:3
verses.text: Therefore strong peoples will honor you; cities of ruthless nations will revere you.

verses.name: Isaiah 25:4
verses.text: You have been a refuge for the poor, a refuge for the needy in his distress, a shelter from the storm and a shade from the heat. For the breath of the ruthless is like a storm driving against a wall

verses.name: Isaiah 25:5
verses.text: and like the heat of the desert. You silence the uproar of foreigners; as heat is reduced by the shadow of a cloud, so the song of the ruthless is stilled.

verses.name: Isaiah 25:6
verses.text: On this mountain the LORD Almighty will prepare a feast of rich food for all peoples, a banquet of aged wine- the best of meats and the finest of wines.

verses.name: Isaiah 25:7
verses.text: On this mountain he will destroy the shroud that enfolds all peoples, the sheet that covers all nations;

verses.name: Isaiah 25:8
verses.text: he will swallow up death forever. The Sovereign LORD will wipe away the tears from all faces; he will remove the disgrace of his people from all the earth. The LORD has spoken.

verses.name: Isaiah 25:9
verses.text: In that day they will say, "Surely this is our God; we trusted in him, and he saved us. This is the LORD, we trusted in him; let us rejoice and be glad in his salvation."

verses.name: Isaiah 25:10
