verses.text: The hand of the LORD will rest on this mountain; but Moab will be trampled under him as straw is trampled down in the manure.

verses.name: Isaiah 25:11
verses.text: They will spread out their hands in it, as a swimmer spreads out his hands to swim. God will bring down their pride despite the cleverness of their hands.

verses.name: Isaiah 25:12
verses.text: He will bring down your high fortified walls and lay them low; he will bring them down to the ground, to the very dust.

verses.name: Isaiah 26:1
verses.text: In that day this song will be sung in the land of Judah: We have a strong city; God makes salvation its walls and ramparts.

verses.name: Isaiah 26:2
verses.text: Open the gates that the righteous nation may enter, the nation that keeps faith.

verses.name: Isaiah 26:3
verses.text: You will keep in perfect peace him whose mind is steadfast, because he trusts in you.

verses.name: Isaiah 26:4
verses.text: Trust in the LORD forever, for the LORD, the LORD, is the Rock eternal.

verses.name: Isaiah 26:5
verses.text: He humbles those who dwell on high, he lays the lofty city low; he levels it to the ground and casts it down to the dust.

verses.name: Isaiah 26:6
verses.text: Feet trample it down- the feet of the oppressed, the footsteps of the poor.

verses.name: Isaiah 26:7
verses.text: The path of the righteous is level; O upright One, you make the way of the righteous smooth.

verses.name: Isaiah 26:8
verses.text: Yes, LORD, walking in the way of your laws, we wait for you; your name and renown are the desire of our hearts.

verses.name: Isaiah 26:9
verses.text: My soul yearns for you in the night; in the morning my spirit longs for you. When your judgments come upon the earth, the people of the world learn righteousness.

verses.name: Isaiah 26:10
verses.text: Though grace is shown to the wicked, they do not learn righteousness; even in a land of uprightness they go on doing evil and regard not the majesty of the LORD.

verses.name: Isaiah 26:11
verses.text: O LORD, your hand is lifted high, but they do not see it. Let them see your zeal for your people and be put to shame; let the fire reserved for your enemies consume them.

verses.name: Isaiah 26:12
verses.text: LORD, you establish peace for us; all that we have accomplished you have done for us.

verses.name: Isaiah 26:13
verses.text: O LORD, our God, other lords besides you have ruled over us, but your name alone do we honor.

verses.name: Isaiah 26:14
verses.text: They are now dead, they live no more; those departed spirits do not rise. You punished them and brought them to ruin; you wiped out all memory of them.

verses.name: Isaiah 26:15
verses.text: You have enlarged the nation, O LORD; you have enlarged the nation. You have gained glory for yourself; you have extended all the borders of the land.

verses.name: Isaiah 26:16
verses.text: LORD, they came to you in their distress; when you disciplined them, they could barely whisper a prayer.

verses.name: Isaiah 26:17
verses.text: As a woman with child and about to give birth writhes and cries out in her pain, so were we in your presence, O LORD.

verses.name: Isaiah 26:18
verses.text: We were with child, we writhed in pain, but we gave birth to wind. We have not brought salvation to the earth; we have not given birth to people of the world.

verses.name: Isaiah 26:19
verses.text: But your dead will live; their bodies will rise. You who dwell in the dust, wake up and shout for joy. Your dew is like the dew of the morning; the earth will give birth to her dead.

verses.name: Isaiah 26:20
verses.text: Go, my people, enter your rooms and shut the doors behind you; hide yourselves for a little while until his wrath has passed by.

verses.name: Isaiah 26:21
verses.text: See, the LORD is coming out of his dwelling to punish the people of the earth for their sins. The earth will disclose the blood shed upon her; she will conceal her slain no longer.

verses.name: Isaiah 27:1
verses.text: In that day, the LORD will punish with his sword, his fierce, great and powerful sword, Leviathan the gliding serpent, Leviathan the coiling serpent; he will slay the monster of the sea.

verses.name: Isaiah 27:2
verses.text: In that day- "Sing about a fruitful vineyard:

verses.name: Isaiah 27:3
verses.text: I, the LORD, watch over it; I water it continually. I guard it day and night so that no one may harm it.

verses.name: Isaiah 27:4
verses.text: I am not angry. If only there were briers and thorns confronting me! I would march against them in battle; I would set them all on fire.

verses.name: Isaiah 27:5
verses.text: Or else let them come to me for refuge; let them make peace with me, yes, let them make peace with me."

verses.name: Isaiah 27:6
verses.text: In days to come Jacob will take root, Israel will bud and blossom and fill all the world with fruit.

verses.name: Isaiah 27:7
verses.text: Has the LORD struck her as he struck down those who struck her? Has she been killed as those were killed who killed her?

verses.name: Isaiah 27:8
verses.text: By warfare and exile you contend with her- with his fierce blast he drives her out, as on a day the east wind blows.

verses.name: Isaiah 27:9
verses.text: By this, then, will Jacob's guilt be atoned for, and this will be the full fruitage of the removal of his sin: When he makes all the altar stones to be like chalk stones crushed to pieces, no Asherah poles or incense altars will be left standing.

verses.name: Isaiah 27:10
verses.text: The fortified city stands desolate, an abandoned settlement, forsaken like the desert; there the calves graze, there they lie down; they strip its branches bare.

verses.name: Isaiah 27:11
verses.text: When its twigs are dry, they are broken off and women come and make fires with them. For this is a people without understanding; so their Maker has no compassion on them, and their Creator shows them no favor.

verses.name: Isaiah 27:12
verses.text: In that day the LORD will thresh from the flowing Euphrates to the Wadi of Egypt, and you, O Israelites, will be gathered up one by one.

verses.name: Isaiah 27:13
verses.text: And in that day a great trumpet will sound. Those who were perishing in Assyria and those who were exiled in Egypt will come and worship the LORD on the holy mountain in Jerusalem.

verses.name: Isaiah 28:1
verses.text: Woe to that wreath, the pride of Ephraim's drunkards, to the fading flower, his glorious beauty, set on the head of a fertile valley- to that city, the pride of those laid low by wine!

verses.name: Isaiah 28:2
verses.text: See, the Lord has one who is powerful and strong. Like a hailstorm and a destructive wind, like a driving rain and a flooding downpour, he will throw it forcefully to the ground.

verses.name: Isaiah 28:3
verses.text: That wreath, the pride of Ephraim's drunkards, will be trampled underfoot.

verses.name: Isaiah 28:4
verses.text: That fading flower, his glorious beauty, set on the head of a fertile valley, will be like a fig ripe before harvest- as soon as someone sees it and takes it in his hand, he swallows it.

verses.name: Isaiah 28:5
verses.text: In that day the LORD Almighty will be a glorious crown, a beautiful wreath for the remnant of his people.

verses.name: Isaiah 28:6
verses.text: He will be a spirit of justice to him who sits in judgment, a source of strength to those who turn back the battle at the gate.

verses.name: Isaiah 28:7
verses.text: And these also stagger from wine and reel from beer: Priests and prophets stagger from beer and are befuddled with wine; they reel from beer, they stagger when seeing visions, they stumble when rendering decisions.

verses.name: Isaiah 28:8
verses.text: All the tables are covered with vomit and there is not a spot without filth.

verses.name: Isaiah 28:9
verses.text: "Who is it he is trying to teach? To whom is he explaining his message? To children weaned from their milk, to those just taken from the breast?

verses.name: Isaiah 28:10
verses.text: For it is: Do and do, do and do, rule on rule, rule on rule; a little here, a little there."

verses.name: Isaiah 28:11
verses.text: Very well then, with foreign lips and strange tongues God will speak to this people,

verses.name: Isaiah 28:12
verses.text: to whom he said, "This is the resting place, let the weary rest"; and, "This is the place of repose"- but they would not listen.

verses.name: Isaiah 28:13
verses.text: So then, the word of the LORD to them will become: Do and do, do and do, rule on rule, rule on rule; a little here, a little there- so that they will go and fall backward, be injured and snared and captured.

verses.name: Isaiah 28:14
verses.text: Therefore hear the word of the LORD, you scoffers who rule this people in Jerusalem.

verses.name: Isaiah 28:15
verses.text: You boast, "We have entered into a covenant with death, with the grave we have made an agreement. When an overwhelming scourge sweeps by, it cannot touch us, for we have made a lie our refuge and falsehood our hiding place."

verses.name: Isaiah 28:16
verses.text: So this is what the Sovereign LORD says: "See, I lay a stone in Zion, a tested stone, a precious cornerstone for a sure foundation; the one who trusts will never be dismayed.

verses.name: Isaiah 28:17
verses.text: I will make justice the measuring line and righteousness the plumb line; hail will sweep away your refuge, the lie, and water will overflow your hiding place.

verses.name: Isaiah 28:18
verses.text: Your covenant with death will be annulled; your agreement with the grave will not stand. When the overwhelming scourge sweeps by, you will be beaten down by it.

verses.name: Isaiah 28:19
verses.text: As often as it comes it will carry you away; morning after morning, by day and by night, it will sweep through." The understanding of this message will bring sheer terror.

verses.name: Isaiah 28:20
verses.text: The bed is too short to stretch out on, the blanket too narrow to wrap around you.

verses.name: Isaiah 28:21
verses.text: The LORD will rise up as he did at Mount Perazim, he will rouse himself as in the Valley of Gibeon- to do his work, his strange work, and perform his task, his alien task.

verses.name: Isaiah 28:22
verses.text: Now stop your mocking, or your chains will become heavier; the Lord, the LORD Almighty, has told me of the destruction decreed against the whole land.

verses.name: Isaiah 28:23
verses.text: Listen and hear my voice; pay attention and hear what I say.

verses.name: Isaiah 28:24
verses.text: When a farmer plows for planting, does he plow continually? Does he keep on breaking up and harrowing the soil?

verses.name: Isaiah 28:25
verses.text: When he has leveled the surface, does he not sow caraway and scatter cummin? Does he not plant wheat in its place, barley in its plot, and spelt in its field?

verses.name: Isaiah 28:26
verses.text: His God instructs him and teaches him the right way.

verses.name: Isaiah 28:27
verses.text: Caraway is not threshed with a sledge, nor is a cartwheel rolled over cummin; caraway is beaten out with a rod, and cummin with a stick.

verses.name: Isaiah 28:28
verses.text: Grain must be ground to make bread; so one does not go on threshing it forever. Though he drives the wheels of his threshing cart over it, his horses do not grind it.

verses.name: Isaiah 28:29
verses.text: All this also comes from the LORD Almighty, wonderful in counsel and magnificent in wisdom.

verses.name: Isaiah 29:1
verses.text: Woe to you, Ariel, Ariel, the city where David settled! Add year to year and let your cycle of festivals go on.

verses.name: Isaiah 29:2
verses.text: Yet I will besiege Ariel; she will mourn and lament, she will be to me like an altar hearth.

verses.name: Isaiah 29:3
verses.text: I will encamp against you all around; I will encircle you with towers and set up my siege works against you.

verses.name: Isaiah 29:4
verses.text: Brought low, you will speak from the ground; your speech will mumble out of the dust. Your voice will come ghostlike from the earth; out of the dust your speech will whisper.

verses.name: Isaiah 29:5
verses.text: But your many enemies will become like fine dust, the ruthless hordes like blown chaff. Suddenly, in an instant,

verses.name: Isaiah 29:6
verses.text: the LORD Almighty will come with thunder and earthquake and great noise, with windstorm and tempest and flames of a devouring fire.

verses.name: Isaiah 29:7
verses.text: Then the hordes of all the nations that fight against Ariel, that attack her and her fortress and besiege her, will be as it is with a dream, with a vision in the night-

verses.name: Isaiah 29:8
verses.text: as when a hungry man dreams that he is eating, but he awakens, and his hunger remains; as when a thirsty man dreams that he is drinking, but he awakens faint, with his thirst unquenched. So will it be with the hordes of all the nations that fight against Mount Zion.

verses.name: Isaiah 29:9
verses.text: Be stunned and amazed, blind yourselves and be sightless; be drunk, but not from wine, stagger, but not from beer.

verses.name: Isaiah 29:10
verses.text: The LORD has brought over you a deep sleep: He has sealed your eyes (the prophets); he has covered your heads (the seers).

verses.name: Isaiah 29:11
verses.text: For you this whole vision is nothing but words sealed in a scroll. And if you give the scroll to someone who can read, and say to him, "Read this, please," he will answer, "I can't; it is sealed."

verses.name: Isaiah 29:12
verses.text: Or if you give the scroll to someone who cannot read, and say, "Read this, please," he will answer, "I don't know how to read."

verses.name: Isaiah 29:13
verses.text: The Lord says: "These people come near to me with their mouth and honor me with their lips, but their hearts are far from me. Their worship of me is made up only of rules taught by men.

verses.name: Isaiah 29:14
verses.text: Therefore once more I will astound these people with wonder upon wonder; the wisdom of the wise will perish, the intelligence of the intelligent will vanish."

verses.name: Isaiah 29:15
verses.text: Woe to those who go to great depths to hide their plans from the LORD, who do their work in darkness and think, "Who sees us? Who will know?"

verses.name: Isaiah 29:16
verses.text: You turn things upside down, as if the potter were thought to be like the clay! Shall what is formed say to him who formed it, "He did not make me"? Can the pot say of the potter, "He knows nothing"?

verses.name: Isaiah 29:17
verses.text: In a very short time, will not Lebanon be turned into a fertile field and the fertile field seem like a forest?

verses.name: Isaiah 29:18
verses.text: In that day the deaf will hear the words of the scroll, and out of gloom and darkness the eyes of the blind will see.

verses.name: Isaiah 29:19
verses.text: Once more the humble will rejoice in the LORD; the needy will rejoice in the Holy One of Israel.

verses.name: Isaiah 29:20
verses.text: The ruthless will vanish, the mockers will disappear, and all who have an eye for evil will be cut down-

verses.name: Isaiah 29:21
verses.text: those who with a word make a man out to be guilty, who ensnare the defender in court and with false testimony deprive the innocent of justice.

verses.name: Isaiah 29:22
verses.text: Therefore this is what the LORD, who redeemed Abraham, says to the house of Jacob: "No longer will Jacob be ashamed; no longer will their faces grow pale.

verses.name: Isaiah 29:23
verses.text: When they see among them their children, the work of my hands, they will keep my name holy; they will acknowledge the holiness of the Holy One of Jacob, and will stand in awe of the God of Israel.

verses.name: Isaiah 29:24
verses.text: Those who are wayward in spirit will gain understanding; those who complain will accept instruction."

verses.name: Isaiah 30:1
verses.text: "Woe to the obstinate children," declares the LORD, "to those who carry out plans that are not mine, forming an alliance, but not by my Spirit, heaping sin upon sin;

verses.name: Isaiah 30:2
verses.text: who go down to Egypt without consulting me; who look for help to Pharaoh's protection, to Egypt's shade for refuge.

verses.name: Isaiah 30:3
verses.text: But Pharaoh's protection will be to your shame, Egypt's shade will bring you disgrace.

verses.name: Isaiah 30:4
verses.text: Though they have officials in Zoan and their envoys have arrived in Hanes,

verses.name: Isaiah 30:5
verses.text: everyone will be put to shame because of a people useless to them, who bring neither help nor advantage, but only shame and disgrace."

verses.name: Isaiah 30:6
verses.text: An oracle concerning the animals of the Negev: Through a land of hardship and distress, of lions and lionesses, of adders and darting snakes, the envoys carry their riches on donkeys' backs, their treasures on the humps of camels, to that unprofitable nation,

verses.name: Isaiah 30:7
verses.text: to Egypt, whose help is utterly useless. Therefore I call her Rahab the Do-Nothing.

verses.name: Isaiah 30:8
verses.text: Go now, write it on a tablet for them, inscribe it on a scroll, that for the days to come it may be an everlasting witness.

verses.name: Isaiah 30:9
verses.text: These are rebellious people, deceitful children, children unwilling to listen to the LORD's instruction.

verses.name: Isaiah 30:10
verses.text: They say to the seers, "See no more visions!" and to the prophets, "Give us no more visions of what is right! Tell us pleasant things, prophesy illusions.

verses.name: Isaiah 30:11
verses.text: Leave this way, get off this path, and stop confronting us with the Holy One of Israel!"

verses.name: Isaiah 30:12
verses.text: Therefore, this is what the Holy One of Israel says: "Because you have rejected this message, relied on oppression and depended on deceit,

verses.name: Isaiah 30:13
verses.text: this sin will become for you like a high wall, cracked and bulging, that collapses suddenly, in an instant.

verses.name: Isaiah 30:14
verses.text: It will break in pieces like pottery, shattered so mercilessly that among its pieces not a fragment will be found for taking coals from a hearth or scooping water out of a cistern."

verses.name: Isaiah 30:15
verses.text: This is what the Sovereign LORD, the Holy One of Israel, says: "In repentance and rest is your salvation, in quietness and trust is your strength, but you would have none of it.

verses.name: Isaiah 30:16
verses.text: You said, 'No, we will flee on horses.' Therefore you will flee! You said, 'We will ride off on swift horses.' Therefore your pursuers will be swift!

verses.name: Isaiah 30:17
verses.text: A thousand will flee at the threat of one; at the threat of five you will all flee away, till you are left like a flagstaff on a mountaintop, like a banner on a hill."

verses.name: Isaiah 30:18
verses.text: Yet the LORD longs to be gracious to you; he rises to show you compassion. For the LORD is a God of justice. Blessed are all who wait for him!

verses.name: Isaiah 30:19
verses.text: O people of Zion, who live in Jerusalem, you will weep no more. How gracious he will be when you cry for help! As soon as he hears, he will answer you.

verses.name: Isaiah 30:20
verses.text: Although the Lord gives you the bread of adversity and the water of affliction, your teachers will be hidden no more; with your own eyes you will see them.

verses.name: Isaiah 30:21
verses.text: Whether you turn to the right or to the left, your ears will hear a voice behind you, saying, "This is the way; walk in it."

verses.name: Isaiah 30:22
verses.text: Then you will defile your idols overlaid with silver and your images covered with gold; you will throw them away like a menstrual cloth and say to them, "Away with you!"

verses.name: Isaiah 30:23
verses.text: He will also send you rain for the seed you sow in the ground, and the food that comes from the land will be rich and plentiful. In that day your cattle will graze in broad meadows.

verses.name: Isaiah 30:24
verses.text: The oxen and donkeys that work the soil will eat fodder and mash, spread out with fork and shovel.

verses.name: Isaiah 30:25
verses.text: In the day of great slaughter, when the towers fall, streams of water will flow on every high mountain and every lofty hill.

verses.name: Isaiah 30:26
verses.text: The moon will shine like the sun, and the sunlight will be seven times brighter, like the light of seven full days, when the LORD binds up the bruises of his people and heals the wounds he inflicted.

verses.name: Isaiah 30:27
verses.text: See, the Name of the LORD comes from afar, with burning anger and dense clouds of smoke; his lips are full of wrath, and his tongue is a consuming fire.

verses.name: Isaiah 30:28
verses.text: His breath is like a rushing torrent, rising up to the neck. He shakes the nations in the sieve of destruction; he places in the jaws of the peoples a bit that leads them astray.

verses.name: Isaiah 30:29
verses.text: And you will sing as on the night you celebrate a holy festival; your hearts will rejoice as when people go up with flutes to the mountain of the LORD, to the Rock of Israel.

verses.name: Isaiah 30:30
verses.text: The LORD will cause men to hear his majestic voice and will make them see his arm coming down with raging anger and consuming fire, with cloudburst, thunderstorm and hail.

verses.name: Isaiah 30:31
verses.text: The voice of the LORD will shatter Assyria; with his scepter he will strike them down.

verses.name: Isaiah 30:32
verses.text: Every stroke the LORD lays on them with his punishing rod will be to the music of tambourines and harps, as he fights them in battle with the blows of his arm.

verses.name: Isaiah 30:33
verses.text: Topheth has long been prepared; it has been made ready for the king. Its fire pit has been made deep and wide, with an abundance of fire and wood; the breath of the LORD, like a stream of burning sulfur, sets it ablaze.

verses.name: Isaiah 31:1
verses.text: Woe to those who go down to Egypt for help, who rely on horses, who trust in the multitude of their chariots and in the great strength of their horsemen, but do not look to the Holy One of Israel, or seek help from the LORD.

verses.name: Isaiah 31:2
verses.text: Yet he too is wise and can bring disaster; he does not take back his words. He will rise up against the house of the wicked, against those who help evildoers.

verses.name: Isaiah 31:3
verses.text: But the Egyptians are men and not God; their horses are flesh and not spirit. When the LORD stretches out his hand, he who helps will stumble, he who is helped will fall; both will perish together.

verses.name: Isaiah 31:4
verses.text: This is what the LORD says to me: "As a lion growls, a great lion over his prey- and though a whole band of shepherds is called together against him, he is not frightened by their shouts or disturbed by their clamor- so the LORD Almighty will come down to do battle on Mount Zion and on its heights.

verses.name: Isaiah 31:5
verses.text: Like birds hovering overhead, the LORD Almighty will shield Jerusalem; he will shield it and deliver it, he will 'pass over' it and will rescue it."

verses.name: Isaiah 31:6
verses.text: Return to him you have so greatly revolted against, O Israelites.

verses.name: Isaiah 31:7
verses.text: For in that day every one of you will reject the idols of silver and gold your sinful hands have made.

verses.name: Isaiah 31:8
verses.text: "Assyria will fall by a sword that is not of man; a sword, not of mortals, will devour them. They will flee before the sword and their young men will be put to forced labor.

verses.name: Isaiah 31:9
verses.text: Their stronghold will fall because of terror; at sight of the battle standard their commanders will panic," declares the LORD, whose fire is in Zion, whose furnace is in Jerusalem.

verses.name: Isaiah 32:1
verses.text: See, a king will reign in righteousness and rulers will rule with justice.

verses.name: Isaiah 32:2
verses.text: Each man will be like a shelter from the wind and a refuge from the storm, like streams of water in the desert and the shadow of a great rock in a thirsty land.

verses.name: Isaiah 32:3
verses.text: Then the eyes of those who see will no longer be closed, and the ears of those who hear will listen.

verses.name: Isaiah 32:4
verses.text: The mind of the rash will know and understand, and the stammering tongue will be fluent and clear.

verses.name: Isaiah 32:5
verses.text: No longer will the fool be called noble nor the scoundrel be highly respected.

verses.name: Isaiah 32:6
verses.text: For the fool speaks folly, his mind is busy with evil: He practices ungodliness and spreads error concerning the LORD; the hungry he leaves empty and from the thirsty he withholds water.

verses.name: Isaiah 32:7
verses.text: The scoundrel's methods are wicked, he makes up evil schemes to destroy the poor with lies, even when the plea of the needy is just.

verses.name: Isaiah 32:8
verses.text: But the noble man makes noble plans, and by noble deeds he stands.

verses.name: Isaiah 32:9
verses.text: You women who are so complacent, rise up and listen to me; you daughters who feel secure, hear what I have to say!

verses.name: Isaiah 32:10
verses.text: In little more than a year you who feel secure will tremble; the grape harvest will fail, and the harvest of fruit will not come.

verses.name: Isaiah 32:11
verses.text: Tremble, you complacent women; shudder, you daughters who feel secure! Strip off your clothes, put sackcloth around your waists.

verses.name: Isaiah 32:12
verses.text: Beat your breasts for the pleasant fields, for the fruitful vines

verses.name: Isaiah 32:13
verses.text: and for the land of my people, a land overgrown with thorns and briers- yes, mourn for all houses of merriment and for this city of revelry.

verses.name: Isaiah 32:14
verses.text: The fortress will be abandoned, the noisy city deserted; citadel and watchtower will become a wasteland forever, the delight of donkeys, a pasture for flocks,

verses.name: Isaiah 32:15
verses.text: till the Spirit is poured upon us from on high, and the desert becomes a fertile field, and the fertile field seems like a forest.

verses.name: Isaiah 32:16
verses.text: Justice will dwell in the desert and righteousness live in the fertile field.

verses.name: Isaiah 32:17
verses.text: The fruit of righteousness will be peace; the effect of righteousness will be quietness and confidence forever.

verses.name: Isaiah 32:18
verses.text: My people will live in peaceful dwelling places, in secure homes, in undisturbed places of rest.

verses.name: Isaiah 32:19
verses.text: Though hail flattens the forest and the city is leveled completely,

verses.name: Isaiah 32:20
verses.text: how blessed you will be, sowing your seed by every stream, and letting your cattle and donkeys range free.

verses.name: Isaiah 33:1
verses.text: Woe to you, O destroyer, you who have not been destroyed! Woe to you, O traitor, you who have not been betrayed! When you stop destroying, you will be destroyed; when you stop betraying, you will be betrayed.

verses.name: Isaiah 33:2
verses.text: O LORD, be gracious to us; we long for you. Be our strength every morning, our salvation in time of distress.

verses.name: Isaiah 33:3
verses.text: At the thunder of your voice, the peoples flee; when you rise up, the nations scatter.

verses.name: Isaiah 33:4
verses.text: Your plunder, O nations, is harvested as by young locusts; like a swarm of locusts men pounce on it.

verses.name: Isaiah 33:5
verses.text: The LORD is exalted, for he dwells on high; he will fill Zion with justice and righteousness.

verses.name: Isaiah 33:6
verses.text: He will be the sure foundation for your times, a rich store of salvation and wisdom and knowledge; the fear of the LORD is the key to this treasure.

verses.name: Isaiah 33:7
verses.text: Look, their brave men cry aloud in the streets; the envoys of peace weep bitterly.

verses.name: Isaiah 33:8
verses.text: The highways are deserted, no travelers are on the roads. The treaty is broken, its witnesses are despised, no one is respected.

verses.name: Isaiah 33:9
verses.text: The land mourns and wastes away, Lebanon is ashamed and withers; Sharon is like the Arabah, and Bashan and Carmel drop their leaves.

verses.name: Isaiah 33:10
verses.text: "Now will I arise," says the LORD. "Now will I be exalted; now will I be lifted up.

verses.name: Isaiah 33:11
verses.text: You conceive chaff, you give birth to straw; your breath is a fire that consumes you.

verses.name: Isaiah 33:12
verses.text: The peoples will be burned as if to lime; like cut thornbushes they will be set ablaze."

verses.name: Isaiah 33:13
verses.text: You who are far away, hear what I have done; you who are near, acknowledge my power!

verses.name: Isaiah 33:14
verses.text: The sinners in Zion are terrified; trembling grips the godless: "Who of us can dwell with the consuming fire? Who of us can dwell with everlasting burning?"

verses.name: Isaiah 33:15
verses.text: He who walks righteously and speaks what is right, who rejects gain from extortion and keeps his hand from accepting bribes, who stops his ears against plots of murder and shuts his eyes against contemplating evil-

verses.name: Isaiah 33:16
verses.text: this is the man who will dwell on the heights, whose refuge will be the mountain fortress. His bread will be supplied, and water will not fail him.

verses.name: Isaiah 33:17
verses.text: Your eyes will see the king in his beauty and view a land that stretches afar.

verses.name: Isaiah 33:18
verses.text: In your thoughts you will ponder the former terror: "Where is that chief officer? Where is the one who took the revenue? Where is the officer in charge of the towers?"

verses.name: Isaiah 33:19
verses.text: You will see those arrogant people no more, those people of an obscure speech, with their strange, incomprehensible tongue.

verses.name: Isaiah 33:20
verses.text: Look upon Zion, the city of our festivals; your eyes will see Jerusalem, a peaceful abode, a tent that will not be moved; its stakes will never be pulled up, nor any of its ropes broken.

verses.name: Isaiah 33:21
verses.text: There the LORD will be our Mighty One. It will be like a place of broad rivers and streams. No galley with oars will ride them, no mighty ship will sail them.

verses.name: Isaiah 33:22
verses.text: For the LORD is our judge, the LORD is our lawgiver, the LORD is our king; it is he who will save us.

verses.name: Isaiah 33:23
verses.text: Your rigging hangs loose: The mast is not held secure, the sail is not spread. Then an abundance of spoils will be divided and even the lame will carry off plunder.

verses.name: Isaiah 33:24
verses.text: No one living in Zion will say, "I am ill"; and the sins of those who dwell there will be forgiven.

verses.name: Isaiah 34:1
verses.text: Come near, you nations, and listen; pay attention, you peoples! Let the earth hear, and all that is in it, the world, and all that comes out of it!

verses.name: Isaiah 34:2
verses.text: The LORD is angry with all nations; his wrath is upon all their armies. He will totally destroy them, he will give them over to slaughter.

verses.name: Isaiah 34:3
verses.text: Their slain will be thrown out, their dead bodies will send up a stench; the mountains will be soaked with their blood.

verses.name: Isaiah 34:4
verses.text: All the stars of the heavens will be dissolved and the sky rolled up like a scroll; all the starry host will fall like withered leaves from the vine, like shriveled figs from the fig tree.

verses.name: Isaiah 34:5
verses.text: My sword has drunk its fill in the heavens; see, it descends in judgment on Edom, the people I have totally destroyed.

verses.name: Isaiah 34:6
verses.text: The sword of the LORD is bathed in blood, it is covered with fat- the blood of lambs and goats, fat from the kidneys of rams. For the LORD has a sacrifice in Bozrah and a great slaughter in Edom.

verses.name: Isaiah 34:7
verses.text: And the wild oxen will fall with them, the bull calves and the great bulls. Their land will be drenched with blood, and the dust will be soaked with fat.

verses.name: Isaiah 34:8
verses.text: For the LORD has a day of vengeance, a year of retribution, to uphold Zion's cause.

verses.name: Isaiah 34:9
verses.text: Edom's streams will be turned into pitch, her dust into burning sulfur; her land will become blazing pitch!

verses.name: Isaiah 34:10
verses.text: It will not be quenched night and day; its smoke will rise forever. From generation to generation it will lie desolate; no one will ever pass through it again.

verses.name: Isaiah 34:11
verses.text: The desert owl and screech owl will possess it; the great owl and the raven will nest there. God will stretch out over Edom the measuring line of chaos and the plumb line of desolation.

verses.name: Isaiah 34:12
verses.text: Her nobles will have nothing there to be called a kingdom, all her princes will vanish away.

verses.name: Isaiah 34:13
verses.text: Thorns will overrun her citadels, nettles and brambles her strongholds. She will become a haunt for jackals, a home for owls.

verses.name: Isaiah 34:14
verses.text: Desert creatures will meet with hyenas, and wild goats will bleat to each other; there the night creatures will also repose and find for themselves places of rest.

verses.name: Isaiah 34:15
verses.text: The owl will nest there and lay eggs, she will hatch them, and care for her young under the shadow of her wings; there also the falcons will gather, each with its mate.

verses.name: Isaiah 34:16
verses.text: Look in the scroll of the LORD and read: None of these will be missing, not one will lack her mate. For it is his mouth that has given the order, and his Spirit will gather them together.

verses.name: Isaiah 34:17
verses.text: He allots their portions; his hand distributes them by measure. They will possess it forever and dwell there from generation to generation.

verses.name: Isaiah 35:1
verses.text: The desert and the parched land will be glad; the wilderness will rejoice and blossom. Like the crocus,

verses.name: Isaiah 35:2
verses.text: it will burst into bloom; it will rejoice greatly and shout for joy. The glory of Lebanon will be given to it, the splendor of Carmel and Sharon; they will see the glory of the LORD, the splendor of our God.

verses.name: Isaiah 35:3
verses.text: Strengthen the feeble hands, steady the knees that give way;

verses.name: Isaiah 35:4
verses.text: say to those with fearful hearts, "Be strong, do not fear; your God will come, he will come with vengeance; with divine retribution he will come to save you."

verses.name: Isaiah 35:5
verses.text: Then will the eyes of the blind be opened and the ears of the deaf unstopped.

verses.name: Isaiah 35:6
verses.text: Then will the lame leap like a deer, and the mute tongue shout for joy. Water will gush forth in the wilderness and streams in the desert.

verses.name: Isaiah 35:7
verses.text: The burning sand will become a pool, the thirsty ground bubbling springs. In the haunts where jackals once lay, grass and reeds and papyrus will grow.

verses.name: Isaiah 35:8
verses.text: And a highway will be there; it will be called the Way of Holiness. The unclean will not journey on it; it will be for those who walk in that Way; wicked fools will not go about on it.

verses.name: Isaiah 35:9
verses.text: No lion will be there, nor will any ferocious beast get up on it; they will not be found there. But only the redeemed will walk there,

verses.name: Isaiah 35:10
verses.text: and the ransomed of the LORD will return. They will enter Zion with singing; everlasting joy will crown their heads. Gladness and joy will overtake them, and sorrow and sighing will flee away.

verses.name: Isaiah 36:1
verses.text: In the fourteenth year of King Hezekiah's reign, Sennacherib king of Assyria attacked all the fortified cities of Judah and captured them.

verses.name: Isaiah 36:2
verses.text: Then the king of Assyria sent his field commander with a large army from Lachish to King Hezekiah at Jerusalem. When the commander stopped at the aqueduct of the Upper Pool, on the road to the Washerman's Field,

verses.name: Isaiah 36:3
verses.text: Eliakim son of Hilkiah the palace administrator, Shebna the secretary, and Joah son of Asaph the recorder went out to him.

verses.name: Isaiah 36:4
verses.text: The field commander said to them, "Tell Hezekiah, "'This is what the great king, the king of Assyria, says: On what are you basing this confidence of yours?

verses.name: Isaiah 36:5
verses.text: You say you have strategy and military strength-but you speak only empty words. On whom are you depending, that you rebel against me?

verses.name: Isaiah 36:6
verses.text: Look now, you are depending on Egypt, that splintered reed of a staff, which pierces a man's hand and wounds him if he leans on it! Such is Pharaoh king of Egypt to all who depend on him.

verses.name: Isaiah 36:7
verses.text: And if you say to me, "We are depending on the LORD our God"-isn't he the one whose high places and altars Hezekiah removed, saying to Judah and Jerusalem, "You must worship before this altar"?

verses.name: Isaiah 36:8
verses.text: "'Come now, make a bargain with my master, the king of Assyria: I will give you two thousand horses-if you can put riders on them!

verses.name: Isaiah 36:9
verses.text: How then can you repulse one officer of the least of my master's officials, even though you are depending on Egypt for chariots and horsemen?

verses.name: Isaiah 36:10
verses.text: Furthermore, have I come to attack and destroy this land without the LORD? The LORD himself told me to march against this country and destroy it.'"

verses.name: Isaiah 36:11
verses.text: Then Eliakim, Shebna and Joah said to the field commander, "Please speak to your servants in Aramaic, since we understand it. Don't speak to us in Hebrew in the hearing of the people on the wall."

verses.name: Isaiah 36:12
verses.text: But the commander replied, "Was it only to your master and you that my master sent me to say these things, and not to the men sitting on the wall-who, like you, will have to eat their own filth and drink their own urine?"

verses.name: Isaiah 36:13
verses.text: Then the commander stood and called out in Hebrew, "Hear the words of the great king, the king of Assyria!

verses.name: Isaiah 36:14
verses.text: This is what the king says: Do not let Hezekiah deceive you. He cannot deliver you!

verses.name: Isaiah 36:15
verses.text: Do not let Hezekiah persuade you to trust in the LORD when he says, 'The LORD will surely deliver us; this city will not be given into the hand of the king of Assyria.'

verses.name: Isaiah 36:16
verses.text: "Do not listen to Hezekiah. This is what the king of Assyria says: Make peace with me and come out to me. Then every one of you will eat from his own vine and fig tree and drink water from his own cistern,

verses.name: Isaiah 36:17
verses.text: until I come and take you to a land like your own-a land of grain and new wine, a land of bread and vineyards.

verses.name: Isaiah 36:18
verses.text: "Do not let Hezekiah mislead you when he says, 'The LORD will deliver us.' Has the god of any nation ever delivered his land from the hand of the king of Assyria?

verses.name: Isaiah 36:19
verses.text: Where are the gods of Hamath and Arpad? Where are the gods of Sepharvaim? Have they rescued Samaria from my hand?

verses.name: Isaiah 36:20
verses.text: Who of all the gods of these countries has been able to save his land from me? How then can the LORD deliver Jerusalem from my hand?"

verses.name: Isaiah 36:21
verses.text: But the people remained silent and said nothing in reply, because the king had commanded, "Do not answer him."

verses.name: Isaiah 36:22
verses.text: Then Eliakim son of Hilkiah the palace administrator, Shebna the secretary, and Joah son of Asaph the recorder went to Hezekiah, with their clothes torn, and told him what the field commander had said.

verses.name: Isaiah 37:1
verses.text: When King Hezekiah heard this, he tore his clothes and put on sackcloth and went into the temple of the LORD.

verses.name: Isaiah 37:2
verses.text: He sent Eliakim the palace administrator, Shebna the secretary, and the leading priests, all wearing sackcloth, to the prophet Isaiah son of Amoz.

verses.name: Isaiah 37:3
verses.text: They told him, "This is what Hezekiah says: This day is a day of distress and rebuke and disgrace, as when children come to the point of birth and there is no strength to deliver them.

verses.name: Isaiah 37:4
verses.text: It may be that the LORD your God will hear the words of the field commander, whom his master, the king of Assyria, has sent to ridicule the living God, and that he will rebuke him for the words the LORD your God has heard. Therefore pray for the remnant that still survives."

verses.name: Isaiah 37:5
verses.text: When King Hezekiah's officials came to Isaiah,

verses.name: Isaiah 37:6
verses.text: Isaiah said to them, "Tell your master, 'This is what the LORD says: Do not be afraid of what you have heard-those words with which the underlings of the king of Assyria have blasphemed me.

verses.name: Isaiah 37:7
verses.text: Listen! I am going to put a spirit in him so that when he hears a certain report, he will return to his own country, and there I will have him cut down with the sword.'"

verses.name: Isaiah 37:8
verses.text: When the field commander heard that the king of Assyria had left Lachish, he withdrew and found the king fighting against Libnah.

verses.name: Isaiah 37:9
verses.text: Now Sennacherib received a report that Tirhakah, the Cushite king of Egypt, was marching out to fight against him. When he heard it, he sent messengers to Hezekiah with this word:

verses.name: Isaiah 37:10
verses.text: "Say to Hezekiah king of Judah: Do not let the god you depend on deceive you when he says, 'Jerusalem will not be handed over to the king of Assyria.'

verses.name: Isaiah 37:11
verses.text: Surely you have heard what the kings of Assyria have done to all the countries, destroying them completely. And will you be delivered?

verses.name: Isaiah 37:12
verses.text: Did the gods of the nations that were destroyed by my forefathers deliver them-the gods of Gozan, Haran, Rezeph and the people of Eden who were in Tel Assar?

verses.name: Isaiah 37:13
verses.text: Where is the king of Hamath, the king of Arpad, the king of the city of Sepharvaim, or of Hena or Ivvah?"

verses.name: Isaiah 37:14
verses.text: Hezekiah received the letter from the messengers and read it. Then he went up to the temple of the LORD and spread it out before the LORD.

verses.name: Isaiah 37:15
verses.text: And Hezekiah prayed to the LORD:

verses.name: Isaiah 37:16
verses.text: "O LORD Almighty, God of Israel, enthroned between the cherubim, you alone are God over all the kingdoms of the earth. You have made heaven and earth.

verses.name: Isaiah 37:17
verses.text: Give ear, O LORD, and hear; open your eyes, O LORD, and see; listen to all the words Sennacherib has sent to insult the living God.

verses.name: Isaiah 37:18
verses.text: "It is true, O LORD, that the Assyrian kings have laid waste all these peoples and their lands.

verses.name: Isaiah 37:19
verses.text: They have thrown their gods into the fire and destroyed them, for they were not gods but only wood and stone, fashioned by human hands.

verses.name: Isaiah 37:20
verses.text: Now, O LORD our God, deliver us from his hand, so that all kingdoms on earth may know that you alone, O LORD, are God. "

verses.name: Isaiah 37:21
verses.text: Then Isaiah son of Amoz sent a message to Hezekiah: "This is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: Because you have prayed to me concerning Sennacherib king of Assyria,

verses.name: Isaiah 37:22
verses.text: this is the word the LORD has spoken against him: "The Virgin Daughter of Zion despises and mocks you. The Daughter of Jerusalem tosses her head as you flee.

verses.name: Isaiah 37:23
verses.text: Who is it you have insulted and blasphemed? Against whom have you raised your voice and lifted your eyes in pride? Against the Holy One of Israel!

verses.name: Isaiah 37:24
verses.text: By your messengers you have heaped insults on the Lord. And you have said, 'With my many chariots I have ascended the heights of the mountains, the utmost heights of Lebanon. I have cut down its tallest cedars, the choicest of its pines. I have reached its remotest heights, the finest of its forests.

verses.name: Isaiah 37:25
verses.text: I have dug wells in foreign lands and drunk the water there. With the soles of my feet I have dried up all the streams of Egypt.'

verses.name: Isaiah 37:26
verses.text: "Have you not heard? Long ago I ordained it. In days of old I planned it; now I have brought it to pass, that you have turned fortified cities into piles of stone.

verses.name: Isaiah 37:27
verses.text: Their people, drained of power, are dismayed and put to shame. They are like plants in the field, like tender green shoots, like grass sprouting on the roof, scorched before it grows up.

verses.name: Isaiah 37:28
verses.text: "But I know where you stay and when you come and go and how you rage against me.

verses.name: Isaiah 37:29
verses.text: Because you rage against me and because your insolence has reached my ears, I will put my hook in your nose and my bit in your mouth, and I will make you return by the way you came.

verses.name: Isaiah 37:30
verses.text: "This will be the sign for you, O Hezekiah: "This year you will eat what grows by itself, and the second year what springs from that. But in the third year sow and reap, plant vineyards and eat their fruit.

verses.name: Isaiah 37:31
verses.text: Once more a remnant of the house of Judah will take root below and bear fruit above.

verses.name: Isaiah 37:32
verses.text: For out of Jerusalem will come a remnant, and out of Mount Zion a band of survivors. The zeal of the LORD Almighty will accomplish this.

verses.name: Isaiah 37:33
verses.text: "Therefore this is what the LORD says concerning the king of Assyria: "He will not enter this city or shoot an arrow here. He will not come before it with shield or build a siege ramp against it.

verses.name: Isaiah 37:34
verses.text: By the way that he came he will return; he will not enter this city," declares the LORD.

verses.name: Isaiah 37:35
verses.text: "I will defend this city and save it, for my sake and for the sake of David my servant!"

verses.name: Isaiah 37:36
verses.text: Then the angel of the LORD went out and put to death a hundred and eighty-five thousand men in the Assyrian camp. When the people got up the next morning-there were all the dead bodies!

verses.name: Isaiah 37:37
verses.text: So Sennacherib king of Assyria broke camp and withdrew. He returned to Nineveh and stayed there.

verses.name: Isaiah 37:38
verses.text: One day, while he was worshiping in the temple of his god Nisroch, his sons Adrammelech and Sharezer cut him down with the sword, and they escaped to the land of Ararat. And Esarhaddon his son succeeded him as king.

verses.name: Isaiah 38:1
verses.text: In those days Hezekiah became ill and was at the point of death. The prophet Isaiah son of Amoz went to him and said, "This is what the LORD says: Put your house in order, because you are going to die; you will not recover."

verses.name: Isaiah 38:2
verses.text: Hezekiah turned his face to the wall and prayed to the LORD,

verses.name: Isaiah 38:3
verses.text: "Remember, O LORD, how I have walked before you faithfully and with wholehearted devotion and have done what is good in your eyes." And Hezekiah wept bitterly.

verses.name: Isaiah 38:4
verses.text: Then the word of the LORD came to Isaiah:

verses.name: Isaiah 38:5
verses.text: "Go and tell Hezekiah, 'This is what the LORD, the God of your father David, says: I have heard your prayer and seen your tears; I will add fifteen years to your life.

verses.name: Isaiah 38:6
verses.text: And I will deliver you and this city from the hand of the king of Assyria. I will defend this city.

verses.name: Isaiah 38:7
verses.text: "'This is the LORD's sign to you that the LORD will do what he has promised:

verses.name: Isaiah 38:8
verses.text: I will make the shadow cast by the sun go back the ten steps it has gone down on the stairway of Ahaz.'" So the sunlight went back the ten steps it had gone down.

verses.name: Isaiah 38:9
verses.text: A writing of Hezekiah king of Judah after his illness and recovery:

verses.name: Isaiah 38:10
verses.text: I said, "In the prime of my life must I go through the gates of death and be robbed of the rest of my years?"

verses.name: Isaiah 38:11
verses.text: I said, "I will not again see the LORD, the LORD, in the land of the living; no longer will I look on mankind, or be with those who now dwell in this world.

verses.name: Isaiah 38:12
verses.text: Like a shepherd's tent my house has been pulled down and taken from me. Like a weaver I have rolled up my life, and he has cut me off from the loom; day and night you made an end of me.

verses.name: Isaiah 38:13
verses.text: I waited patiently till dawn, but like a lion he broke all my bones; day and night you made an end of me.

verses.name: Isaiah 38:14
verses.text: I cried like a swift or thrush, I moaned like a mourning dove. My eyes grew weak as I looked to the heavens. I am troubled; O Lord, come to my aid!"

verses.name: Isaiah 38:15
verses.text: But what can I say? He has spoken to me, and he himself has done this. I will walk humbly all my years because of this anguish of my soul.

verses.name: Isaiah 38:16
verses.text: Lord, by such things men live; and my spirit finds life in them too. You restored me to health and let me live.

verses.name: Isaiah 38:17
verses.text: Surely it was for my benefit that I suffered such anguish. In your love you kept me from the pit of destruction; you have put all my sins behind your back.

verses.name: Isaiah 38:18
verses.text: For the grave cannot praise you, death cannot sing your praise; those who go down to the pit cannot hope for your faithfulness.

verses.name: Isaiah 38:19
verses.text: The living, the living-they praise you, as I am doing today; fathers tell their children about your faithfulness.

verses.name: Isaiah 38:20
verses.text: The LORD will save me, and we will sing with stringed instruments all the days of our lives in the temple of the LORD.

verses.name: Isaiah 38:21
verses.text: Isaiah had said, "Prepare a poultice of figs and apply it to the boil, and he will recover."

verses.name: Isaiah 38:22
verses.text: Hezekiah had asked, "What will be the sign that I will go up to the temple of the LORD?"

verses.name: Isaiah 39:1
verses.text: At that time Merodach-Baladan son of Baladan king of Babylon sent Hezekiah letters and a gift, because he had heard of his illness and recovery.

verses.name: Isaiah 39:2
verses.text: Hezekiah received the envoys gladly and showed them what was in his storehouses-the silver, the gold, the spices, the fine oil, his entire armory and everything found among his treasures. There was nothing in his palace or in all his kingdom that Hezekiah did not show them.

verses.name: Isaiah 39:3
verses.text: Then Isaiah the prophet went to King Hezekiah and asked, "What did those men say, and where did they come from?From a distant land," Hezekiah replied. "They came to me from Babylon."

verses.name: Isaiah 39:4
verses.text: The prophet asked, "What did they see in your palace?They saw everything in my palace," Hezekiah said. "There is nothing among my treasures that I did not show them."

verses.name: Isaiah 39:5
verses.text: Then Isaiah said to Hezekiah, "Hear the word of the LORD Almighty:

verses.name: Isaiah 39:6
verses.text: The time will surely come when everything in your palace, and all that your fathers have stored up until this day, will be carried off to Babylon. Nothing will be left, says the LORD.

verses.name: Isaiah 39:7
verses.text: And some of your descendants, your own flesh and blood who will be born to you, will be taken away, and they will become eunuchs in the palace of the king of Babylon."

verses.name: Isaiah 39:8
verses.text: "The word of the LORD you have spoken is good," Hezekiah replied. For he thought, "There will be peace and security in my lifetime."

verses.name: Isaiah 40:1
verses.text: Comfort, comfort my people, says your God.

verses.name: Isaiah 40:2
verses.text: Speak tenderly to Jerusalem, and proclaim to her that her hard service has been completed, that her sin has been paid for, that she has received from the LORD's hand double for all her sins.

verses.name: Isaiah 40:3
verses.text: A voice of one calling: "In the desert prepare the way for the LORD; make straight in the wilderness a highway for our God.

verses.name: Isaiah 40:4
verses.text: Every valley shall be raised up, every mountain and hill made low; the rough ground shall become level, the rugged places a plain.

verses.name: Isaiah 40:5
verses.text: And the glory of the LORD will be revealed, and all mankind together will see it. For the mouth of the LORD has spoken."

verses.name: Isaiah 40:6
verses.text: A voice says, "Cry out." And I said, "What shall I cry?All men are like grass, and all their glory is like the flowers of the field.

verses.name: Isaiah 40:7
verses.text: The grass withers and the flowers fall, because the breath of the LORD blows on them. Surely the people are grass.

verses.name: Isaiah 40:8
verses.text: The grass withers and the flowers fall, but the word of our God stands forever."

verses.name: Isaiah 40:9
verses.text: You who bring good tidings to Zion, go up on a high mountain. You who bring good tidings to Jerusalem, lift up your voice with a shout, lift it up, do not be afraid; say to the towns of Judah, "Here is your God!"

verses.name: Isaiah 40:10
verses.text: See, the Sovereign LORD comes with power, and his arm rules for him. See, his reward is with him, and his recompense accompanies him.

verses.name: Isaiah 40:11
verses.text: He tends his flock like a shepherd: He gathers the lambs in his arms and carries them close to his heart; he gently leads those that have young.

verses.name: Isaiah 40:12
verses.text: Who has measured the waters in the hollow of his hand, or with the breadth of his hand marked off the heavens? Who has held the dust of the earth in a basket, or weighed the mountains on the scales and the hills in a balance?

verses.name: Isaiah 40:13
verses.text: Who has understood the mind of the LORD, or instructed him as his counselor?

verses.name: Isaiah 40:14
verses.text: Whom did the LORD consult to enlighten him, and who taught him the right way? Who was it that taught him knowledge or showed him the path of understanding?

verses.name: Isaiah 40:15
verses.text: Surely the nations are like a drop in a bucket; they are regarded as dust on the scales; he weighs the islands as though they were fine dust.

verses.name: Isaiah 40:16
verses.text: Lebanon is not sufficient for altar fires, nor its animals enough for burnt offerings.

verses.name: Isaiah 40:17
verses.text: Before him all the nations are as nothing; they are regarded by him as worthless and less than nothing.

verses.name: Isaiah 40:18
verses.text: To whom, then, will you compare God? What image will you compare him to?

verses.name: Isaiah 40:19
verses.text: As for an idol, a craftsman casts it, and a goldsmith overlays it with gold and fashions silver chains for it.

verses.name: Isaiah 40:20
verses.text: A man too poor to present such an offering selects wood that will not rot. He looks for a skilled craftsman to set up an idol that will not topple.

verses.name: Isaiah 40:21
verses.text: Do you not know? Have you not heard? Has it not been told you from the beginning? Have you not understood since the earth was founded?

verses.name: Isaiah 40:22
verses.text: He sits enthroned above the circle of the earth, and its people are like grasshoppers. He stretches out the heavens like a canopy, and spreads them out like a tent to live in.

verses.name: Isaiah 40:23
verses.text: He brings princes to naught and reduces the rulers of this world to nothing.

verses.name: Isaiah 40:24
verses.text: No sooner are they planted, no sooner are they sown, no sooner do they take root in the ground, than he blows on them and they wither, and a whirlwind sweeps them away like chaff.

verses.name: Isaiah 40:25
verses.text: "To whom will you compare me? Or who is my equal?" says the Holy One.

verses.name: Isaiah 40:26
verses.text: Lift your eyes and look to the heavens: Who created all these? He who brings out the starry host one by one, and calls them each by name. Because of his great power and mighty strength, not one of them is missing.

verses.name: Isaiah 40:27
verses.text: Why do you say, O Jacob, and complain, O Israel, "My way is hidden from the LORD; my cause is disregarded by my God"?

verses.name: Isaiah 40:28
verses.text: Do you not know? Have you not heard? The LORD is the everlasting God, the Creator of the ends of the earth. He will not grow tired or weary, and his understanding no one can fathom.

verses.name: Isaiah 40:29
verses.text: He gives strength to the weary and increases the power of the weak.

verses.name: Isaiah 40:30
verses.text: Even youths grow tired and weary, and young men stumble and fall;

verses.name: Isaiah 40:31
verses.text: but those who hope in the LORD will renew their strength. They will soar on wings like eagles; they will run and not grow weary, they will walk and not be faint.

verses.name: Isaiah 41:1
verses.text: "Be silent before me, you islands! Let the nations renew their strength! Let them come forward and speak; let us meet together at the place of judgment.

verses.name: Isaiah 41:2
verses.text: "Who has stirred up one from the east, calling him in righteousness to his service? He hands nations over to him and subdues kings before him. He turns them to dust with his sword, to windblown chaff with his bow.

verses.name: Isaiah 41:3
verses.text: He pursues them and moves on unscathed, by a path his feet have not traveled before.

verses.name: Isaiah 41:4
verses.text: Who has done this and carried it through, calling forth the generations from the beginning? I, the LORD -with the first of them and with the last-I am he."

verses.name: Isaiah 41:5
verses.text: The islands have seen it and fear; the ends of the earth tremble. They approach and come forward;

verses.name: Isaiah 41:6
verses.text: each helps the other and says to his brother, "Be strong!"

verses.name: Isaiah 41:7
verses.text: The craftsman encourages the goldsmith, and he who smooths with the hammer spurs on him who strikes the anvil. He says of the welding, "It is good." He nails down the idol so it will not topple.

verses.name: Isaiah 41:8
verses.text: "But you, O Israel, my servant, Jacob, whom I have chosen, you descendants of Abraham my friend,

verses.name: Isaiah 41:9
verses.text: I took you from the ends of the earth, from its farthest corners I called you. I said, 'You are my servant'; I have chosen you and have not rejected you.

verses.name: Isaiah 41:10
verses.text: So do not fear, for I am with you; do not be dismayed, for I am your God. I will strengthen you and help you; I will uphold you with my righteous right hand.

verses.name: Isaiah 41:11
verses.text: "All who rage against you will surely be ashamed and disgraced; those who oppose you will be as nothing and perish.

verses.name: Isaiah 41:12
verses.text: Though you search for your enemies, you will not find them. Those who wage war against you will be as nothing at all.

verses.name: Isaiah 41:13
verses.text: For I am the LORD, your God, who takes hold of your right hand and says to you, Do not fear; I will help you.

verses.name: Isaiah 41:14
verses.text: Do not be afraid, O worm Jacob, O little Israel, for I myself will help you," declares the LORD, your Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel.

verses.name: Isaiah 41:15
verses.text: "See, I will make you into a threshing sledge, new and sharp, with many teeth. You will thresh the mountains and crush them, and reduce the hills to chaff.

verses.name: Isaiah 41:16
verses.text: You will winnow them, the wind will pick them up, and a gale will blow them away. But you will rejoice in the LORD and glory in the Holy One of Israel.

verses.name: Isaiah 41:17
verses.text: "The poor and needy search for water, but there is none; their tongues are parched with thirst. But I the LORD will answer them; I, the God of Israel, will not forsake them.

verses.name: Isaiah 41:18
verses.text: I will make rivers flow on barren heights, and springs within the valleys. I will turn the desert into pools of water, and the parched ground into springs.

verses.name: Isaiah 41:19
verses.text: I will put in the desert the cedar and the acacia, the myrtle and the olive. I will set pines in the wasteland, the fir and the cypress together,

verses.name: Isaiah 41:20
verses.text: so that people may see and know, may consider and understand, that the hand of the LORD has done this, that the Holy One of Israel has created it.

verses.name: Isaiah 41:21
verses.text: "Present your case," says the LORD. "Set forth your arguments," says Jacob's King.

verses.name: Isaiah 41:22
verses.text: "Bring in your idols to tell us what is going to happen. Tell us what the former things were, so that we may consider them and know their final outcome. Or declare to us the things to come,

verses.name: Isaiah 41:23
verses.text: tell us what the future holds, so we may know that you are gods. Do something, whether good or bad, so that we will be dismayed and filled with fear.

verses.name: Isaiah 41:24
verses.text: But you are less than nothing and your works are utterly worthless; he who chooses you is detestable.

verses.name: Isaiah 41:25
verses.text: "I have stirred up one from the north, and he comes- one from the rising sun who calls on my name. He treads on rulers as if they were mortar, as if he were a potter treading the clay.

verses.name: Isaiah 41:26
verses.text: Who told of this from the beginning, so we could know, or beforehand, so we could say, 'He was right'? No one told of this, no one foretold it, no one heard any words from you.

verses.name: Isaiah 41:27
verses.text: I was the first to tell Zion, 'Look, here they are!' I gave to Jerusalem a messenger of good tidings.

verses.name: Isaiah 41:28
verses.text: I look but there is no one- no one among them to give counsel, no one to give answer when I ask them.

verses.name: Isaiah 41:29
verses.text: See, they are all false! Their deeds amount to nothing; their images are but wind and confusion.

verses.name: Isaiah 42:1
verses.text: "Here is my servant, whom I uphold, my chosen one in whom I delight; I will put my Spirit on him and he will bring justice to the nations.

verses.name: Isaiah 42:2
verses.text: He will not shout or cry out, or raise his voice in the streets.

verses.name: Isaiah 42:3
verses.text: A bruised reed he will not break, and a smoldering wick he will not snuff out. In faithfulness he will bring forth justice;

verses.name: Isaiah 42:4
verses.text: he will not falter or be discouraged till he establishes justice on earth. In his law the islands will put their hope."

verses.name: Isaiah 42:5
verses.text: This is what God the LORD says- he who created the heavens and stretched them out, who spread out the earth and all that comes out of it, who gives breath to its people, and life to those who walk on it:

verses.name: Isaiah 42:6
verses.text: "I, the LORD, have called you in righteousness; I will take hold of your hand. I will keep you and will make you to be a covenant for the people and a light for the Gentiles,

verses.name: Isaiah 42:7
verses.text: to open eyes that are blind, to free captives from prison and to release from the dungeon those who sit in darkness.

verses.name: Isaiah 42:8
verses.text: "I am the LORD; that is my name! I will not give my glory to another or my praise to idols.

verses.name: Isaiah 42:9
verses.text: See, the former things have taken place, and new things I declare; before they spring into being I announce them to you."

verses.name: Isaiah 42:10
verses.text: Sing to the LORD a new song, his praise from the ends of the earth, you who go down to the sea, and all that is in it, you islands, and all who live in them.

verses.name: Isaiah 42:11
verses.text: Let the desert and its towns raise their voices; let the settlements where Kedar lives rejoice. Let the people of Sela sing for joy; let them shout from the mountaintops.

verses.name: Isaiah 42:12
verses.text: Let them give glory to the LORD and proclaim his praise in the islands.

verses.name: Isaiah 42:13
verses.text: The LORD will march out like a mighty man, like a warrior he will stir up his zeal; with a shout he will raise the battle cry and will triumph over his enemies.

verses.name: Isaiah 42:14
verses.text: "For a long time I have kept silent, I have been quiet and held myself back. But now, like a woman in childbirth, I cry out, I gasp and pant.

verses.name: Isaiah 42:15
verses.text: I will lay waste the mountains and hills and dry up all their vegetation; I will turn rivers into islands and dry up the pools.

verses.name: Isaiah 42:16
verses.text: I will lead the blind by ways they have not known, along unfamiliar paths I will guide them; I will turn the darkness into light before them and make the rough places smooth. These are the things I will do; I will not forsake them.

verses.name: Isaiah 42:17
verses.text: But those who trust in idols, who say to images, 'You are our gods,' will be turned back in utter shame.

verses.name: Isaiah 42:18
verses.text: "Hear, you deaf; look, you blind, and see!

verses.name: Isaiah 42:19
verses.text: Who is blind but my servant, and deaf like the messenger I send? Who is blind like the one committed to me, blind like the servant of the LORD?

verses.name: Isaiah 42:20
verses.text: You have seen many things, but have paid no attention; your ears are open, but you hear nothing."

verses.name: Isaiah 42:21
verses.text: It pleased the LORD for the sake of his righteousness to make his law great and glorious.

verses.name: Isaiah 42:22
verses.text: But this is a people plundered and looted, all of them trapped in pits or hidden away in prisons. They have become plunder, with no one to rescue them; they have been made loot, with no one to say, "Send them back."

verses.name: Isaiah 42:23
verses.text: Which of you will listen to this or pay close attention in time to come?

verses.name: Isaiah 42:24
verses.text: Who handed Jacob over to become loot, and Israel to the plunderers? Was it not the LORD, against whom we have sinned? For they would not follow his ways; they did not obey his law.

verses.name: Isaiah 42:25
verses.text: So he poured out on them his burning anger, the violence of war. It enveloped them in flames, yet they did not understand; it consumed them, but they did not take it to heart.

verses.name: Isaiah 43:1
verses.text: But now, this is what the LORD says- he who created you, O Jacob, he who formed you, O Israel: "Fear not, for I have redeemed you; I have summoned you by name; you are mine.

verses.name: Isaiah 43:2
verses.text: When you pass through the waters, I will be with you; and when you pass through the rivers, they will not sweep over you. When you walk through the fire, you will not be burned; the flames will not set you ablaze.

verses.name: Isaiah 43:3
verses.text: For I am the LORD, your God, the Holy One of Israel, your Savior; I give Egypt for your ransom, Cush and Seba in your stead.

verses.name: Isaiah 43:4
verses.text: Since you are precious and honored in my sight, and because I love you, I will give men in exchange for you, and people in exchange for your life.

verses.name: Isaiah 43:5
verses.text: Do not be afraid, for I am with you; I will bring your children from the east and gather you from the west.

verses.name: Isaiah 43:6
verses.text: I will say to the north, 'Give them up!' and to the south, 'Do not hold them back.' Bring my sons from afar and my daughters from the ends of the earth-

verses.name: Isaiah 43:7
verses.text: everyone who is called by my name, whom I created for my glory, whom I formed and made."

verses.name: Isaiah 43:8
verses.text: Lead out those who have eyes but are blind, who have ears but are deaf.

verses.name: Isaiah 43:9
verses.text: All the nations gather together and the peoples assemble. Which of them foretold this and proclaimed to us the former things? Let them bring in their witnesses to prove they were right, so that others may hear and say, "It is true."

verses.name: Isaiah 43:10
verses.text: "You are my witnesses," declares the LORD, "and my servant whom I have chosen, so that you may know and believe me and understand that I am he. Before me no god was formed, nor will there be one after me.

verses.name: Isaiah 43:11
verses.text: I, even I, am the LORD, and apart from me there is no savior.

verses.name: Isaiah 43:12
verses.text: I have revealed and saved and proclaimed- I, and not some foreign god among you. You are my witnesses," declares the LORD, "that I am God.

verses.name: Isaiah 43:13
verses.text: Yes, and from ancient days I am he. No one can deliver out of my hand. When I act, who can reverse it?"

verses.name: Isaiah 43:14
verses.text: This is what the LORD says- your Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel: "For your sake I will send to Babylon and bring down as fugitives all the Babylonians, in the ships in which they took pride.

verses.name: Isaiah 43:15
verses.text: I am the LORD, your Holy One, Israel's Creator, your King."

verses.name: Isaiah 43:16
verses.text: This is what the LORD says- he who made a way through the sea, a path through the mighty waters,

verses.name: Isaiah 43:17
verses.text: who drew out the chariots and horses, the army and reinforcements together, and they lay there, never to rise again, extinguished, snuffed out like a wick:

verses.name: Isaiah 43:18
verses.text: "Forget the former things; do not dwell on the past.

verses.name: Isaiah 43:19
verses.text: See, I am doing a new thing! Now it springs up; do you not perceive it? I am making a way in the desert and streams in the wasteland.

verses.name: Isaiah 43:20
verses.text: The wild animals honor me, the jackals and the owls, because I provide water in the desert and streams in the wasteland, to give drink to my people, my chosen,

verses.name: Isaiah 43:21
verses.text: the people I formed for myself that they may proclaim my praise.

verses.name: Isaiah 43:22
verses.text: "Yet you have not called upon me, O Jacob, you have not wearied yourselves for me, O Israel.

verses.name: Isaiah 43:23
verses.text: You have not brought me sheep for burnt offerings, nor honored me with your sacrifices. I have not burdened you with grain offerings nor wearied you with demands for incense.

verses.name: Isaiah 43:24
verses.text: You have not bought any fragrant calamus for me, or lavished on me the fat of your sacrifices. But you have burdened me with your sins and wearied me with your offenses.

verses.name: Isaiah 43:25
verses.text: "I, even I, am he who blots out your transgressions, for my own sake, and remembers your sins no more.

verses.name: Isaiah 43:26
verses.text: Review the past for me, let us argue the matter together; state the case for your innocence.

verses.name: Isaiah 43:27
verses.text: Your first father sinned; your spokesmen rebelled against me.

verses.name: Isaiah 43:28
verses.text: So I will disgrace the dignitaries of your temple, and I will consign Jacob to destruction and Israel to scorn.

verses.name: Isaiah 44:1
verses.text: "But now listen, O Jacob, my servant, Israel, whom I have chosen.

verses.name: Isaiah 44:2
verses.text: This is what the LORD says- he who made you, who formed you in the womb, and who will help you: Do not be afraid, O Jacob, my servant, Jeshurun, whom I have chosen.

verses.name: Isaiah 44:3
verses.text: For I will pour water on the thirsty land, and streams on the dry ground; I will pour out my Spirit on your offspring, and my blessing on your descendants.

verses.name: Isaiah 44:4
verses.text: They will spring up like grass in a meadow, like poplar trees by flowing streams.

verses.name: Isaiah 44:5
verses.text: One will say, 'I belong to the LORD '; another will call himself by the name of Jacob; still another will write on his hand, 'The LORD's,' and will take the name Israel.

verses.name: Isaiah 44:6
verses.text: "This is what the LORD says- Israel's King and Redeemer, the LORD Almighty: I am the first and I am the last; apart from me there is no God.

verses.name: Isaiah 44:7
verses.text: Who then is like me? Let him proclaim it. Let him declare and lay out before me what has happened since I established my ancient people, and what is yet to come- yes, let him foretell what will come.

verses.name: Isaiah 44:8
verses.text: Do not tremble, do not be afraid. Did I not proclaim this and foretell it long ago? You are my witnesses. Is there any God besides me? No, there is no other Rock; I know not one."

verses.name: Isaiah 44:9
verses.text: All who make idols are nothing, and the things they treasure are worthless. Those who would speak up for them are blind; they are ignorant, to their own shame.

verses.name: Isaiah 44:10
verses.text: Who shapes a god and casts an idol, which can profit him nothing?

verses.name: Isaiah 44:11
verses.text: He and his kind will be put to shame; craftsmen are nothing but men. Let them all come together and take their stand; they will be brought down to terror and infamy.

verses.name: Isaiah 44:12
verses.text: The blacksmith takes a tool and works with it in the coals; he shapes an idol with hammers, he forges it with the might of his arm. He gets hungry and loses his strength; he drinks no water and grows faint.

verses.name: Isaiah 44:13
verses.text: The carpenter measures with a line and makes an outline with a marker; he roughs it out with chisels and marks it with compasses. He shapes it in the form of man, of man in all his glory, that it may dwell in a shrine.

verses.name: Isaiah 44:14
verses.text: He cut down cedars, or perhaps took a cypress or oak. He let it grow among the trees of the forest, or planted a pine, and the rain made it grow.

verses.name: Isaiah 44:15
verses.text: It is man's fuel for burning; some of it he takes and warms himself, he kindles a fire and bakes bread. But he also fashions a god and worships it; he makes an idol and bows down to it.

verses.name: Isaiah 44:16
verses.text: Half of the wood he burns in the fire; over it he prepares his meal, he roasts his meat and eats his fill. He also warms himself and says, "Ah! I am warm; I see the fire."

verses.name: Isaiah 44:17
verses.text: From the rest he makes a god, his idol; he bows down to it and worships. He prays to it and says, "Save me; you are my god."

verses.name: Isaiah 44:18
verses.text: They know nothing, they understand nothing; their eyes are plastered over so they cannot see, and their minds closed so they cannot understand.

verses.name: Isaiah 44:19
verses.text: No one stops to think, no one has the knowledge or understanding to say, "Half of it I used for fuel; I even baked bread over its coals, I roasted meat and I ate. Shall I make a detestable thing from what is left? Shall I bow down to a block of wood?"

verses.name: Isaiah 44:20
verses.text: He feeds on ashes, a deluded heart misleads him; he cannot save himself, or say, "Is not this thing in my right hand a lie?"

verses.name: Isaiah 44:21
verses.text: "Remember these things, O Jacob, for you are my servant, O Israel. I have made you, you are my servant; O Israel, I will not forget you.

verses.name: Isaiah 44:22
verses.text: I have swept away your offenses like a cloud, your sins like the morning mist. Return to me, for I have redeemed you."

verses.name: Isaiah 44:23
verses.text: Sing for joy, O heavens, for the LORD has done this; shout aloud, O earth beneath. Burst into song, you mountains, you forests and all your trees, for the LORD has redeemed Jacob, he displays his glory in Israel.

verses.name: Isaiah 44:24
verses.text: "This is what the LORD says- your Redeemer, who formed you in the womb: I am the LORD, who has made all things, who alone stretched out the heavens, who spread out the earth by myself,

verses.name: Isaiah 44:25
verses.text: who foils the signs of false prophets and makes fools of diviners, who overthrows the learning of the wise and turns it into nonsense,

verses.name: Isaiah 44:26
verses.text: who carries out the words of his servants and fulfills the predictions of his messengers, who says of Jerusalem, 'It shall be inhabited,' of the towns of Judah, 'They shall be built,' and of their ruins, 'I will restore them,'

verses.name: Isaiah 44:27
verses.text: who says to the watery deep, 'Be dry, and I will dry up your streams,'

verses.name: Isaiah 44:28
verses.text: who says of Cyrus, 'He is my shepherd and will accomplish all that I please; he will say of Jerusalem, "Let it be rebuilt," and of the temple, "Let its foundations be laid."'

verses.name: Isaiah 45:1
verses.text: "This is what the LORD says to his anointed, to Cyrus, whose right hand I take hold of to subdue nations before him and to strip kings of their armor, to open doors before him so that gates will not be shut:

verses.name: Isaiah 45:2
verses.text: I will go before you and will level the mountains; I will break down gates of bronze and cut through bars of iron.

verses.name: Isaiah 45:3
verses.text: I will give you the treasures of darkness, riches stored in secret places, so that you may know that I am the LORD, the God of Israel, who summons you by name.

verses.name: Isaiah 45:4
verses.text: For the sake of Jacob my servant, of Israel my chosen, I summon you by name and bestow on you a title of honor, though you do not acknowledge me.

verses.name: Isaiah 45:5
verses.text: I am the LORD, and there is no other; apart from me there is no God. I will strengthen you, though you have not acknowledged me,

verses.name: Isaiah 45:6
verses.text: so that from the rising of the sun to the place of its setting men may know there is none besides me. I am the LORD, and there is no other.

verses.name: Isaiah 45:7
verses.text: I form the light and create darkness, I bring prosperity and create disaster; I, the LORD, do all these things.

verses.name: Isaiah 45:8
verses.text: "You heavens above, rain down righteousness; let the clouds shower it down. Let the earth open wide, let salvation spring up, let righteousness grow with it; I, the LORD, have created it.

verses.name: Isaiah 45:9
verses.text: "Woe to him who quarrels with his Maker, to him who is but a potsherd among the potsherds on the ground. Does the clay say to the potter, 'What are you making?' Does your work say, 'He has no hands'?

verses.name: Isaiah 45:10
verses.text: Woe to him who says to his father, 'What have you begotten?' or to his mother, 'What have you brought to birth?'

verses.name: Isaiah 45:11
verses.text: "This is what the LORD says- the Holy One of Israel, and its Maker: Concerning things to come, do you question me about my children, or give me orders about the work of my hands?

verses.name: Isaiah 45:12
verses.text: It is I who made the earth and created mankind upon it. My own hands stretched out the heavens; I marshaled their starry hosts.

verses.name: Isaiah 45:13
verses.text: I will raise up Cyrus in my righteousness: I will make all his ways straight. He will rebuild my city and set my exiles free, but not for a price or reward, says the LORD Almighty."

verses.name: Isaiah 45:14
