verses.text: This is what the LORD says: "The products of Egypt and the merchandise of Cush, and those tall Sabeans- they will come over to you and will be yours; they will trudge behind you, coming over to you in chains. They will bow down before you and plead with you, saying, 'Surely God is with you, and there is no other; there is no other god.'"

verses.name: Isaiah 45:15
verses.text: Truly you are a God who hides himself, O God and Savior of Israel.

verses.name: Isaiah 45:16
verses.text: All the makers of idols will be put to shame and disgraced; they will go off into disgrace together.

verses.name: Isaiah 45:17
verses.text: But Israel will be saved by the LORD with an everlasting salvation; you will never be put to shame or disgraced, to ages everlasting.

verses.name: Isaiah 45:18
verses.text: For this is what the LORD says- he who created the heavens, he is God; he who fashioned and made the earth, he founded it; he did not create it to be empty, but formed it to be inhabited- he says: "I am the LORD, and there is no other.

verses.name: Isaiah 45:19
verses.text: I have not spoken in secret, from somewhere in a land of darkness; I have not said to Jacob's descendants, 'Seek me in vain.' I, the LORD, speak the truth; I declare what is right.

verses.name: Isaiah 45:20
verses.text: "Gather together and come; assemble, you fugitives from the nations. Ignorant are those who carry about idols of wood, who pray to gods that cannot save.

verses.name: Isaiah 45:21
verses.text: Declare what is to be, present it- let them take counsel together. Who foretold this long ago, who declared it from the distant past? Was it not I, the LORD? And there is no God apart from me, a righteous God and a Savior; there is none but me.

verses.name: Isaiah 45:22
verses.text: "Turn to me and be saved, all you ends of the earth; for I am God, and there is no other.

verses.name: Isaiah 45:23
verses.text: By myself I have sworn, my mouth has uttered in all integrity a word that will not be revoked: Before me every knee will bow; by me every tongue will swear.

verses.name: Isaiah 45:24
verses.text: They will say of me, 'In the LORD alone are righteousness and strength.'" All who have raged against him will come to him and be put to shame.

verses.name: Isaiah 45:25
verses.text: But in the LORD all the descendants of Israel will be found righteous and will exult.

verses.name: Isaiah 46:1
verses.text: Bel bows down, Nebo stoops low; their idols are borne by beasts of burden. The images that are carried about are burdensome, a burden for the weary.

verses.name: Isaiah 46:2
verses.text: They stoop and bow down together; unable to rescue the burden, they themselves go off into captivity.

verses.name: Isaiah 46:3
verses.text: "Listen to me, O house of Jacob, all you who remain of the house of Israel, you whom I have upheld since you were conceived, and have carried since your birth.

verses.name: Isaiah 46:4
verses.text: Even to your old age and gray hairs I am he, I am he who will sustain you. I have made you and I will carry you; I will sustain you and I will rescue you.

verses.name: Isaiah 46:5
verses.text: "To whom will you compare me or count me equal? To whom will you liken me that we may be compared?

verses.name: Isaiah 46:6
verses.text: Some pour out gold from their bags and weigh out silver on the scales; they hire a goldsmith to make it into a god, and they bow down and worship it.

verses.name: Isaiah 46:7
verses.text: They lift it to their shoulders and carry it; they set it up in its place, and there it stands. From that spot it cannot move. Though one cries out to it, it does not answer; it cannot save him from his troubles.

verses.name: Isaiah 46:8
verses.text: "Remember this, fix it in mind, take it to heart, you rebels.

verses.name: Isaiah 46:9
verses.text: Remember the former things, those of long ago; I am God, and there is no other; I am God, and there is none like me.

verses.name: Isaiah 46:10
verses.text: I make known the end from the beginning, from ancient times, what is still to come. I say: My purpose will stand, and I will do all that I please.

verses.name: Isaiah 46:11
verses.text: From the east I summon a bird of prey; from a far-off land, a man to fulfill my purpose. What I have said, that will I bring about; what I have planned, that will I do.

verses.name: Isaiah 46:12
verses.text: Listen to me, you stubborn-hearted, you who are far from righteousness.

verses.name: Isaiah 46:13
verses.text: I am bringing my righteousness near, it is not far away; and my salvation will not be delayed. I will grant salvation to Zion, my splendor to Israel.

verses.name: Isaiah 47:1
verses.text: "Go down, sit in the dust, Virgin Daughter of Babylon; sit on the ground without a throne, Daughter of the Babylonians. No more will you be called tender or delicate.

verses.name: Isaiah 47:2
verses.text: Take millstones and grind flour; take off your veil. Lift up your skirts, bare your legs, and wade through the streams.

verses.name: Isaiah 47:3
verses.text: Your nakedness will be exposed and your shame uncovered. I will take vengeance; I will spare no one."

verses.name: Isaiah 47:4
verses.text: Our Redeemer-the LORD Almighty is his name- is the Holy One of Israel.

verses.name: Isaiah 47:5
verses.text: "Sit in silence, go into darkness, Daughter of the Babylonians; no more will you be called queen of kingdoms.

verses.name: Isaiah 47:6
verses.text: I was angry with my people and desecrated my inheritance; I gave them into your hand, and you showed them no mercy. Even on the aged you laid a very heavy yoke.

verses.name: Isaiah 47:7
verses.text: You said, 'I will continue forever- the eternal queen!' But you did not consider these things or reflect on what might happen.

verses.name: Isaiah 47:8
verses.text: "Now then, listen, you wanton creature, lounging in your security and saying to yourself, 'I am, and there is none besides me. I will never be a widow or suffer the loss of children.'

verses.name: Isaiah 47:9
verses.text: Both of these will overtake you in a moment, on a single day: loss of children and widowhood. They will come upon you in full measure, in spite of your many sorceries and all your potent spells.

verses.name: Isaiah 47:10
verses.text: You have trusted in your wickedness and have said, 'No one sees me.' Your wisdom and knowledge mislead you when you say to yourself, 'I am, and there is none besides me.'

verses.name: Isaiah 47:11
verses.text: Disaster will come upon you, and you will not know how to conjure it away. A calamity will fall upon you that you cannot ward off with a ransom; a catastrophe you cannot foresee will suddenly come upon you.

verses.name: Isaiah 47:12
verses.text: "Keep on, then, with your magic spells and with your many sorceries, which you have labored at since childhood. Perhaps you will succeed, perhaps you will cause terror.

verses.name: Isaiah 47:13
verses.text: All the counsel you have received has only worn you out! Let your astrologers come forward, those stargazers who make predictions month by month, let them save you from what is coming upon you.

verses.name: Isaiah 47:14
verses.text: Surely they are like stubble; the fire will burn them up. They cannot even save themselves from the power of the flame. Here are no coals to warm anyone; here is no fire to sit by.

verses.name: Isaiah 47:15
verses.text: That is all they can do for you- these you have labored with and trafficked with since childhood. Each of them goes on in his error; there is not one that can save you.

verses.name: Isaiah 48:1
verses.text: "Listen to this, O house of Jacob, you who are called by the name of Israel and come from the line of Judah, you who take oaths in the name of the LORD and invoke the God of Israel- but not in truth or righteousness-

verses.name: Isaiah 48:2
verses.text: you who call yourselves citizens of the holy city and rely on the God of Israel- the LORD Almighty is his name:

verses.name: Isaiah 48:3
verses.text: I foretold the former things long ago, my mouth announced them and I made them known; then suddenly I acted, and they came to pass.

verses.name: Isaiah 48:4
verses.text: For I knew how stubborn you were; the sinews of your neck were iron, your forehead was bronze.

verses.name: Isaiah 48:5
verses.text: Therefore I told you these things long ago; before they happened I announced them to you so that you could not say, 'My idols did them; my wooden image and metal god ordained them.'

verses.name: Isaiah 48:6
verses.text: You have heard these things; look at them all. Will you not admit them? "From now on I will tell you of new things, of hidden things unknown to you.

verses.name: Isaiah 48:7
verses.text: They are created now, and not long ago; you have not heard of them before today. So you cannot say, 'Yes, I knew of them.'

verses.name: Isaiah 48:8
verses.text: You have neither heard nor understood; from of old your ear has not been open. Well do I know how treacherous you are; you were called a rebel from birth.

verses.name: Isaiah 48:9
verses.text: For my own name's sake I delay my wrath; for the sake of my praise I hold it back from you, so as not to cut you off.

verses.name: Isaiah 48:10
verses.text: See, I have refined you, though not as silver; I have tested you in the furnace of affliction.

verses.name: Isaiah 48:11
verses.text: For my own sake, for my own sake, I do this. How can I let myself be defamed? I will not yield my glory to another.

verses.name: Isaiah 48:12
verses.text: "Listen to me, O Jacob, Israel, whom I have called: I am he; I am the first and I am the last.

verses.name: Isaiah 48:13
verses.text: My own hand laid the foundations of the earth, and my right hand spread out the heavens; when I summon them, they all stand up together.

verses.name: Isaiah 48:14
verses.text: "Come together, all of you, and listen: Which of the idols has foretold these things? The LORD's chosen ally will carry out his purpose against Babylon; his arm will be against the Babylonians.

verses.name: Isaiah 48:15
verses.text: I, even I, have spoken; yes, I have called him. I will bring him, and he will succeed in his mission.

verses.name: Isaiah 48:16
verses.text: "Come near me and listen to this: "From the first announcement I have not spoken in secret; at the time it happens, I am there." And now the Sovereign LORD has sent me, with his Spirit.

verses.name: Isaiah 48:17
verses.text: This is what the LORD says- your Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel: "I am the LORD your God, who teaches you what is best for you, who directs you in the way you should go.

verses.name: Isaiah 48:18
verses.text: If only you had paid attention to my commands, your peace would have been like a river, your righteousness like the waves of the sea.

verses.name: Isaiah 48:19
verses.text: Your descendants would have been like the sand, your children like its numberless grains; their name would never be cut off nor destroyed from before me."

verses.name: Isaiah 48:20
verses.text: Leave Babylon, flee from the Babylonians! Announce this with shouts of joy and proclaim it. Send it out to the ends of the earth; say, "The LORD has redeemed his servant Jacob."

verses.name: Isaiah 48:21
verses.text: They did not thirst when he led them through the deserts; he made water flow for them from the rock; he split the rock and water gushed out.

verses.name: Isaiah 48:22
verses.text: "There is no peace," says the LORD, "for the wicked."

verses.name: Isaiah 49:1
verses.text: Listen to me, you islands; hear this, you distant nations: Before I was born the LORD called me; from my birth he has made mention of my name.

verses.name: Isaiah 49:2
verses.text: He made my mouth like a sharpened sword, in the shadow of his hand he hid me; he made me into a polished arrow and concealed me in his quiver.

verses.name: Isaiah 49:3
verses.text: He said to me, "You are my servant, Israel, in whom I will display my splendor."

verses.name: Isaiah 49:4
verses.text: But I said, "I have labored to no purpose; I have spent my strength in vain and for nothing. Yet what is due me is in the LORD's hand, and my reward is with my God."

verses.name: Isaiah 49:5
verses.text: And now the LORD says- he who formed me in the womb to be his servant to bring Jacob back to him and gather Israel to himself, for I am honored in the eyes of the LORD and my God has been my strength-

verses.name: Isaiah 49:6
verses.text: he says: "It is too small a thing for you to be my servant to restore the tribes of Jacob and bring back those of Israel I have kept. I will also make you a light for the Gentiles, that you may bring my salvation to the ends of the earth."

verses.name: Isaiah 49:7
verses.text: This is what the LORD says- the Redeemer and Holy One of Israel- to him who was despised and abhorred by the nation, to the servant of rulers: "Kings will see you and rise up, princes will see and bow down, because of the LORD, who is faithful, the Holy One of Israel, who has chosen you."

verses.name: Isaiah 49:8
verses.text: This is what the LORD says: "In the time of my favor I will answer you, and in the day of salvation I will help you; I will keep you and will make you to be a covenant for the people, to restore the land and to reassign its desolate inheritances,

verses.name: Isaiah 49:9
verses.text: to say to the captives, 'Come out,' and to those in darkness, 'Be free!'"They will feed beside the roads and find pasture on every barren hill.

verses.name: Isaiah 49:10
verses.text: They will neither hunger nor thirst, nor will the desert heat or the sun beat upon them. He who has compassion on them will guide them and lead them beside springs of water.

verses.name: Isaiah 49:11
verses.text: I will turn all my mountains into roads, and my highways will be raised up.

verses.name: Isaiah 49:12
verses.text: See, they will come from afar- some from the north, some from the west, some from the region of Aswan. "

verses.name: Isaiah 49:13
verses.text: Shout for joy, O heavens; rejoice, O earth; burst into song, O mountains! For the LORD comforts his people and will have compassion on his afflicted ones.

verses.name: Isaiah 49:14
verses.text: But Zion said, "The LORD has forsaken me, the Lord has forgotten me."

verses.name: Isaiah 49:15
verses.text: "Can a mother forget the baby at her breast and have no compassion on the child she has borne? Though she may forget, I will not forget you!

verses.name: Isaiah 49:16
verses.text: See, I have engraved you on the palms of my hands; your walls are ever before me.

verses.name: Isaiah 49:17
verses.text: Your sons hasten back, and those who laid you waste depart from you.

verses.name: Isaiah 49:18
verses.text: Lift up your eyes and look around; all your sons gather and come to you. As surely as I live," declares the LORD, "you will wear them all as ornaments; you will put them on, like a bride.

verses.name: Isaiah 49:19
verses.text: "Though you were ruined and made desolate and your land laid waste, now you will be too small for your people, and those who devoured you will be far away.

verses.name: Isaiah 49:20
verses.text: The children born during your bereavement will yet say in your hearing, 'This place is too small for us; give us more space to live in.'

verses.name: Isaiah 49:21
verses.text: Then you will say in your heart, 'Who bore me these? I was bereaved and barren; I was exiled and rejected. Who brought these up? I was left all alone, but these-where have they come from?'"

verses.name: Isaiah 49:22
verses.text: This is what the Sovereign LORD says: "See, I will beckon to the Gentiles, I will lift up my banner to the peoples; they will bring your sons in their arms and carry your daughters on their shoulders.

verses.name: Isaiah 49:23
verses.text: Kings will be your foster fathers, and their queens your nursing mothers. They will bow down before you with their faces to the ground; they will lick the dust at your feet. Then you will know that I am the LORD; those who hope in me will not be disappointed."

verses.name: Isaiah 49:24
verses.text: Can plunder be taken from warriors, or captives rescued from the fierce?

verses.name: Isaiah 49:25
verses.text: But this is what the LORD says: "Yes, captives will be taken from warriors, and plunder retrieved from the fierce; I will contend with those who contend with you, and your children I will save.

verses.name: Isaiah 49:26
verses.text: I will make your oppressors eat their own flesh; they will be drunk on their own blood, as with wine. Then all mankind will know that I, the LORD, am your Savior, your Redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob."

verses.name: Isaiah 50:1
verses.text: This is what the LORD says: "Where is your mother's certificate of divorce with which I sent her away? Or to which of my creditors did I sell you? Because of your sins you were sold; because of your transgressions your mother was sent away.

verses.name: Isaiah 50:2
verses.text: When I came, why was there no one? When I called, why was there no one to answer? Was my arm too short to ransom you? Do I lack the strength to rescue you? By a mere rebuke I dry up the sea, I turn rivers into a desert; their fish rot for lack of water and die of thirst.

verses.name: Isaiah 50:3
verses.text: I clothe the sky with darkness and make sackcloth its covering."

verses.name: Isaiah 50:4
verses.text: The Sovereign LORD has given me an instructed tongue, to know the word that sustains the weary. He wakens me morning by morning, wakens my ear to listen like one being taught.

verses.name: Isaiah 50:5
verses.text: The Sovereign LORD has opened my ears, and I have not been rebellious; I have not drawn back.

verses.name: Isaiah 50:6
verses.text: I offered my back to those who beat me, my cheeks to those who pulled out my beard; I did not hide my face from mocking and spitting.

verses.name: Isaiah 50:7
verses.text: Because the Sovereign LORD helps me, I will not be disgraced. Therefore have I set my face like flint, and I know I will not be put to shame.

verses.name: Isaiah 50:8
verses.text: He who vindicates me is near. Who then will bring charges against me? Let us face each other! Who is my accuser? Let him confront me!

verses.name: Isaiah 50:9
verses.text: It is the Sovereign LORD who helps me. Who is he that will condemn me? They will all wear out like a garment; the moths will eat them up.

verses.name: Isaiah 50:10
verses.text: Who among you fears the LORD and obeys the word of his servant? Let him who walks in the dark, who has no light, trust in the name of the LORD and rely on his God.

verses.name: Isaiah 50:11
verses.text: But now, all you who light fires and provide yourselves with flaming torches, go, walk in the light of your fires and of the torches you have set ablaze. This is what you shall receive from my hand: You will lie down in torment.

verses.name: Isaiah 51:1
verses.text: "Listen to me, you who pursue righteousness and who seek the LORD: Look to the rock from which you were cut and to the quarry from which you were hewn;

verses.name: Isaiah 51:2
verses.text: look to Abraham, your father, and to Sarah, who gave you birth. When I called him he was but one, and I blessed him and made him many.

verses.name: Isaiah 51:3
verses.text: The LORD will surely comfort Zion and will look with compassion on all her ruins; he will make her deserts like Eden, her wastelands like the garden of the LORD. Joy and gladness will be found in her, thanksgiving and the sound of singing.

verses.name: Isaiah 51:4
verses.text: "Listen to me, my people; hear me, my nation: The law will go out from me; my justice will become a light to the nations.

verses.name: Isaiah 51:5
verses.text: My righteousness draws near speedily, my salvation is on the way, and my arm will bring justice to the nations. The islands will look to me and wait in hope for my arm.

verses.name: Isaiah 51:6
verses.text: Lift up your eyes to the heavens, look at the earth beneath; the heavens will vanish like smoke, the earth will wear out like a garment and its inhabitants die like flies. But my salvation will last forever, my righteousness will never fail.

verses.name: Isaiah 51:7
verses.text: "Hear me, you who know what is right, you people who have my law in your hearts: Do not fear the reproach of men or be terrified by their insults.

verses.name: Isaiah 51:8
verses.text: For the moth will eat them up like a garment; the worm will devour them like wool. But my righteousness will last forever, my salvation through all generations."

verses.name: Isaiah 51:9
verses.text: Awake, awake! Clothe yourself with strength, O arm of the LORD; awake, as in days gone by, as in generations of old. Was it not you who cut Rahab to pieces, who pierced that monster through?

verses.name: Isaiah 51:10
verses.text: Was it not you who dried up the sea, the waters of the great deep, who made a road in the depths of the sea so that the redeemed might cross over?

verses.name: Isaiah 51:11
verses.text: The ransomed of the LORD will return. They will enter Zion with singing; everlasting joy will crown their heads. Gladness and joy will overtake them, and sorrow and sighing will flee away.

verses.name: Isaiah 51:12
verses.text: "I, even I, am he who comforts you. Who are you that you fear mortal men, the sons of men, who are but grass,

verses.name: Isaiah 51:13
verses.text: that you forget the LORD your Maker, who stretched out the heavens and laid the foundations of the earth, that you live in constant terror every day because of the wrath of the oppressor, who is bent on destruction? For where is the wrath of the oppressor?

verses.name: Isaiah 51:14
verses.text: The cowering prisoners will soon be set free; they will not die in their dungeon, nor will they lack bread.

verses.name: Isaiah 51:15
verses.text: For I am the LORD your God, who churns up the sea so that its waves roar- the LORD Almighty is his name.

verses.name: Isaiah 51:16
verses.text: I have put my words in your mouth and covered you with the shadow of my hand- I who set the heavens in place, who laid the foundations of the earth, and who say to Zion, 'You are my people.'"

verses.name: Isaiah 51:17
verses.text: Awake, awake! Rise up, O Jerusalem, you who have drunk from the hand of the LORD the cup of his wrath, you who have drained to its dregs the goblet that makes men stagger.

verses.name: Isaiah 51:18
verses.text: Of all the sons she bore there was none to guide her; of all the sons she reared there was none to take her by the hand.

verses.name: Isaiah 51:19
verses.text: These double calamities have come upon you- who can comfort you?- ruin and destruction, famine and sword- who can console you?

verses.name: Isaiah 51:20
verses.text: Your sons have fainted; they lie at the head of every street, like antelope caught in a net. They are filled with the wrath of the LORD and the rebuke of your God.

verses.name: Isaiah 51:21
verses.text: Therefore hear this, you afflicted one, made drunk, but not with wine.

verses.name: Isaiah 51:22
verses.text: This is what your Sovereign LORD says, your God, who defends his people: "See, I have taken out of your hand the cup that made you stagger; from that cup, the goblet of my wrath, you will never drink again.

verses.name: Isaiah 51:23
verses.text: I will put it into the hands of your tormentors, who said to you, 'Fall prostrate that we may walk over you.' And you made your back like the ground, like a street to be walked over."

verses.name: Isaiah 52:1
verses.text: Awake, awake, O Zion, clothe yourself with strength. Put on your garments of splendor, O Jerusalem, the holy city. The uncircumcised and defiled will not enter you again.

verses.name: Isaiah 52:2
verses.text: Shake off your dust; rise up, sit enthroned, O Jerusalem. Free yourself from the chains on your neck, O captive Daughter of Zion.

verses.name: Isaiah 52:3
verses.text: For this is what the LORD says: "You were sold for nothing, and without money you will be redeemed."

verses.name: Isaiah 52:4
verses.text: For this is what the Sovereign LORD says: "At first my people went down to Egypt to live; lately, Assyria has oppressed them.

verses.name: Isaiah 52:5
verses.text: "And now what do I have here?" declares the LORD. "For my people have been taken away for nothing, and those who rule them mock, "declares the LORD. "And all day long my name is constantly blasphemed.

verses.name: Isaiah 52:6
verses.text: Therefore my people will know my name; therefore in that day they will know that it is I who foretold it. Yes, it is I."

verses.name: Isaiah 52:7
verses.text: How beautiful on the mountains are the feet of those who bring good news, who proclaim peace, who bring good tidings, who proclaim salvation, who say to Zion, "Your God reigns!"

verses.name: Isaiah 52:8
verses.text: Listen! Your watchmen lift up their voices; together they shout for joy. When the LORD returns to Zion, they will see it with their own eyes.

verses.name: Isaiah 52:9
verses.text: Burst into songs of joy together, you ruins of Jerusalem, for the LORD has comforted his people, he has redeemed Jerusalem.

verses.name: Isaiah 52:10
verses.text: The LORD will lay bare his holy arm in the sight of all the nations, and all the ends of the earth will see the salvation of our God.

verses.name: Isaiah 52:11
verses.text: Depart, depart, go out from there! Touch no unclean thing! Come out from it and be pure, you who carry the vessels of the LORD.

verses.name: Isaiah 52:12
verses.text: But you will not leave in haste or go in flight; for the LORD will go before you, the God of Israel will be your rear guard.

verses.name: Isaiah 52:13
verses.text: See, my servant will act wisely; he will be raised and lifted up and highly exalted.

verses.name: Isaiah 52:14
verses.text: Just as there were many who were appalled at him - his appearance was so disfigured beyond that of any man and his form marred beyond human likeness-

verses.name: Isaiah 52:15
verses.text: so will he sprinkle many nations, and kings will shut their mouths because of him. For what they were not told, they will see, and what they have not heard, they will understand.

verses.name: Isaiah 53:1
verses.text: Who has believed our message and to whom has the arm of the LORD been revealed?

verses.name: Isaiah 53:2
verses.text: He grew up before him like a tender shoot, and like a root out of dry ground. He had no beauty or majesty to attract us to him, nothing in his appearance that we should desire him.

verses.name: Isaiah 53:3
verses.text: He was despised and rejected by men, a man of sorrows, and familiar with suffering. Like one from whom men hide their faces he was despised, and we esteemed him not.

verses.name: Isaiah 53:4
verses.text: Surely he took up our infirmities and carried our sorrows, yet we considered him stricken by God, smitten by him, and afflicted.

verses.name: Isaiah 53:5
verses.text: But he was pierced for our transgressions, he was crushed for our iniquities; the punishment that brought us peace was upon him, and by his wounds we are healed.

verses.name: Isaiah 53:6
verses.text: We all, like sheep, have gone astray, each of us has turned to his own way; and the LORD has laid on him the iniquity of us all.

verses.name: Isaiah 53:7
verses.text: He was oppressed and afflicted, yet he did not open his mouth; he was led like a lamb to the slaughter, and as a sheep before her shearers is silent, so he did not open his mouth.

verses.name: Isaiah 53:8
verses.text: By oppression and judgment he was taken away. And who can speak of his descendants? For he was cut off from the land of the living; for the transgression of my people he was stricken.

verses.name: Isaiah 53:9
verses.text: He was assigned a grave with the wicked, and with the rich in his death, though he had done no violence, nor was any deceit in his mouth.

verses.name: Isaiah 53:10
verses.text: Yet it was the LORD's will to crush him and cause him to suffer, and though the LORD makes his life a guilt offering, he will see his offspring and prolong his days, and the will of the LORD will prosper in his hand.

verses.name: Isaiah 53:11
verses.text: After the suffering of his soul, he will see the light of life and be satisfied; by his knowledge my righteous servant will justify many, and he will bear their iniquities.

verses.name: Isaiah 53:12
verses.text: Therefore I will give him a portion among the great, and he will divide the spoils with the strong, because he poured out his life unto death, and was numbered with the transgressors. For he bore the sin of many, and made intercession for the transgressors.

verses.name: Isaiah 54:1
verses.text: "Sing, O barren woman, you who never bore a child; burst into song, shout for joy, you who were never in labor; because more are the children of the desolate woman than of her who has a husband," says the LORD.

verses.name: Isaiah 54:2
verses.text: "Enlarge the place of your tent, stretch your tent curtains wide, do not hold back; lengthen your cords, strengthen your stakes.

verses.name: Isaiah 54:3
verses.text: For you will spread out to the right and to the left; your descendants will dispossess nations and settle in their desolate cities.

verses.name: Isaiah 54:4
verses.text: "Do not be afraid; you will not suffer shame. Do not fear disgrace; you will not be humiliated. You will forget the shame of your youth and remember no more the reproach of your widowhood.

verses.name: Isaiah 54:5
verses.text: For your Maker is your husband- the LORD Almighty is his name- the Holy One of Israel is your Redeemer; he is called the God of all the earth.

verses.name: Isaiah 54:6
verses.text: The LORD will call you back as if you were a wife deserted and distressed in spirit- a wife who married young, only to be rejected," says your God.

verses.name: Isaiah 54:7
verses.text: "For a brief moment I abandoned you, but with deep compassion I will bring you back.

verses.name: Isaiah 54:8
verses.text: In a surge of anger I hid my face from you for a moment, but with everlasting kindness I will have compassion on you," says the LORD your Redeemer.

verses.name: Isaiah 54:9
verses.text: "To me this is like the days of Noah, when I swore that the waters of Noah would never again cover the earth. So now I have sworn not to be angry with you, never to rebuke you again.

verses.name: Isaiah 54:10
verses.text: Though the mountains be shaken and the hills be removed, yet my unfailing love for you will not be shaken nor my covenant of peace be removed," says the LORD, who has compassion on you.

verses.name: Isaiah 54:11
verses.text: "O afflicted city, lashed by storms and not comforted, I will build you with stones of turquoise, your foundations with sapphires.

verses.name: Isaiah 54:12
verses.text: I will make your battlements of rubies, your gates of sparkling jewels, and all your walls of precious stones.

verses.name: Isaiah 54:13
verses.text: All your sons will be taught by the LORD, and great will be your children's peace.

verses.name: Isaiah 54:14
verses.text: In righteousness you will be established: Tyranny will be far from you; you will have nothing to fear. Terror will be far removed; it will not come near you.

verses.name: Isaiah 54:15
verses.text: If anyone does attack you, it will not be my doing; whoever attacks you will surrender to you.

verses.name: Isaiah 54:16
verses.text: "See, it is I who created the blacksmith who fans the coals into flame and forges a weapon fit for its work. And it is I who have created the destroyer to work havoc;

verses.name: Isaiah 54:17
verses.text: no weapon forged against you will prevail, and you will refute every tongue that accuses you. This is the heritage of the servants of the LORD, and this is their vindication from me," declares the LORD.

verses.name: Isaiah 55:1
verses.text: "Come, all you who are thirsty, come to the waters; and you who have no money, come, buy and eat! Come, buy wine and milk without money and without cost.

verses.name: Isaiah 55:2
verses.text: Why spend money on what is not bread, and your labor on what does not satisfy? Listen, listen to me, and eat what is good, and your soul will delight in the richest of fare.

verses.name: Isaiah 55:3
verses.text: Give ear and come to me; hear me, that your soul may live. I will make an everlasting covenant with you, my faithful love promised to David.

verses.name: Isaiah 55:4
verses.text: See, I have made him a witness to the peoples, a leader and commander of the peoples.

verses.name: Isaiah 55:5
verses.text: Surely you will summon nations you know not, and nations that do not know you will hasten to you, because of the LORD your God, the Holy One of Israel, for he has endowed you with splendor."

verses.name: Isaiah 55:6
verses.text: Seek the LORD while he may be found; call on him while he is near.

verses.name: Isaiah 55:7
verses.text: Let the wicked forsake his way and the evil man his thoughts. Let him turn to the LORD, and he will have mercy on him, and to our God, for he will freely pardon.

verses.name: Isaiah 55:8
verses.text: "For my thoughts are not your thoughts, neither are your ways my ways," declares the LORD.

verses.name: Isaiah 55:9
verses.text: "As the heavens are higher than the earth, so are my ways higher than your ways and my thoughts than your thoughts.

verses.name: Isaiah 55:10
verses.text: As the rain and the snow come down from heaven, and do not return to it without watering the earth and making it bud and flourish, so that it yields seed for the sower and bread for the eater,

verses.name: Isaiah 55:11
verses.text: so is my word that goes out from my mouth: It will not return to me empty, but will accomplish what I desire and achieve the purpose for which I sent it.

verses.name: Isaiah 55:12
verses.text: You will go out in joy and be led forth in peace; the mountains and hills will burst into song before you, and all the trees of the field will clap their hands.

verses.name: Isaiah 55:13
verses.text: Instead of the thornbush will grow the pine tree, and instead of briers the myrtle will grow. This will be for the LORD's renown, for an everlasting sign, which will not be destroyed."

verses.name: Isaiah 56:1
verses.text: This is what the LORD says: "Maintain justice and do what is right, for my salvation is close at hand and my righteousness will soon be revealed.

verses.name: Isaiah 56:2
verses.text: Blessed is the man who does this, the man who holds it fast, who keeps the Sabbath without desecrating it, and keeps his hand from doing any evil."

verses.name: Isaiah 56:3
verses.text: Let no foreigner who has bound himself to the LORD say, "The LORD will surely exclude me from his people." And let not any eunuch complain, "I am only a dry tree."

verses.name: Isaiah 56:4
verses.text: For this is what the LORD says: "To the eunuchs who keep my Sabbaths, who choose what pleases me and hold fast to my covenant-

verses.name: Isaiah 56:5
verses.text: to them I will give within my temple and its walls a memorial and a name better than sons and daughters; I will give them an everlasting name that will not be cut off.

verses.name: Isaiah 56:6
verses.text: And foreigners who bind themselves to the LORD to serve him, to love the name of the LORD, and to worship him, all who keep the Sabbath without desecrating it and who hold fast to my covenant-

verses.name: Isaiah 56:7
verses.text: these I will bring to my holy mountain and give them joy in my house of prayer. Their burnt offerings and sacrifices will be accepted on my altar; for my house will be called a house of prayer for all nations."

verses.name: Isaiah 56:8
verses.text: The Sovereign LORD declares- he who gathers the exiles of Israel: "I will gather still others to them besides those already gathered."

verses.name: Isaiah 56:9
verses.text: Come, all you beasts of the field, come and devour, all you beasts of the forest!

verses.name: Isaiah 56:10
verses.text: Israel's watchmen are blind, they all lack knowledge; they are all mute dogs, they cannot bark; they lie around and dream, they love to sleep.

verses.name: Isaiah 56:11
verses.text: They are dogs with mighty appetites; they never have enough. They are shepherds who lack understanding; they all turn to their own way, each seeks his own gain.

verses.name: Isaiah 56:12
verses.text: "Come," each one cries, "let me get wine! Let us drink our fill of beer! And tomorrow will be like today, or even far better."

verses.name: Isaiah 57:1
verses.text: The righteous perish, and no one ponders it in his heart; devout men are taken away, and no one understands that the righteous are taken away to be spared from evil.

verses.name: Isaiah 57:2
verses.text: Those who walk uprightly enter into peace; they find rest as they lie in death.

verses.name: Isaiah 57:3
verses.text: "But you-come here, you sons of a sorceress, you offspring of adulterers and prostitutes!

verses.name: Isaiah 57:4
verses.text: Whom are you mocking? At whom do you sneer and stick out your tongue? Are you not a brood of rebels, the offspring of liars?

verses.name: Isaiah 57:5
verses.text: You burn with lust among the oaks and under every spreading tree; you sacrifice your children in the ravines and under the overhanging crags.

verses.name: Isaiah 57:6
verses.text: The idols among the smooth stones of the ravines are your portion; they, they are your lot. Yes, to them you have poured out drink offerings and offered grain offerings. In the light of these things, should I relent?

verses.name: Isaiah 57:7
verses.text: You have made your bed on a high and lofty hill; there you went up to offer your sacrifices.

verses.name: Isaiah 57:8
verses.text: Behind your doors and your doorposts you have put your pagan symbols. Forsaking me, you uncovered your bed, you climbed into it and opened it wide; you made a pact with those whose beds you love, and you looked on their nakedness.

verses.name: Isaiah 57:9
verses.text: You went to Molech with olive oil and increased your perfumes. You sent your ambassadors far away; you descended to the grave itself!

verses.name: Isaiah 57:10
verses.text: You were wearied by all your ways, but you would not say, 'It is hopeless.' You found renewal of your strength, and so you did not faint.

verses.name: Isaiah 57:11
verses.text: "Whom have you so dreaded and feared that you have been false to me, and have neither remembered me nor pondered this in your hearts? Is it not because I have long been silent that you do not fear me?

verses.name: Isaiah 57:12
verses.text: I will expose your righteousness and your works, and they will not benefit you.

verses.name: Isaiah 57:13
verses.text: When you cry out for help, let your collection of idols save you! The wind will carry all of them off, a mere breath will blow them away. But the man who makes me his refuge will inherit the land and possess my holy mountain."

verses.name: Isaiah 57:14
verses.text: And it will be said: "Build up, build up, prepare the road! Remove the obstacles out of the way of my people."

verses.name: Isaiah 57:15
verses.text: For this is what the high and lofty One says- he who lives forever, whose name is holy: "I live in a high and holy place, but also with him who is contrite and lowly in spirit, to revive the spirit of the lowly and to revive the heart of the contrite.

verses.name: Isaiah 57:16
verses.text: I will not accuse forever, nor will I always be angry, for then the spirit of man would grow faint before me- the breath of man that I have created.

verses.name: Isaiah 57:17
verses.text: I was enraged by his sinful greed; I punished him, and hid my face in anger, yet he kept on in his willful ways.

verses.name: Isaiah 57:18
verses.text: I have seen his ways, but I will heal him; I will guide him and restore comfort to him,

verses.name: Isaiah 57:19
verses.text: creating praise on the lips of the mourners in Israel. Peace, peace, to those far and near," says the LORD. "And I will heal them."

verses.name: Isaiah 57:20
verses.text: But the wicked are like the tossing sea, which cannot rest, whose waves cast up mire and mud.

verses.name: Isaiah 57:21
verses.text: "There is no peace," says my God, "for the wicked."

verses.name: Isaiah 58:1
verses.text: "Shout it aloud, do not hold back. Raise your voice like a trumpet. Declare to my people their rebellion and to the house of Jacob their sins.

verses.name: Isaiah 58:2
verses.text: For day after day they seek me out; they seem eager to know my ways, as if they were a nation that does what is right and has not forsaken the commands of its God. They ask me for just decisions and seem eager for God to come near them.

verses.name: Isaiah 58:3
verses.text: 'Why have we fasted,' they say, 'and you have not seen it? Why have we humbled ourselves, and you have not noticed?'"Yet on the day of your fasting, you do as you please and exploit all your workers.

verses.name: Isaiah 58:4
verses.text: Your fasting ends in quarreling and strife, and in striking each other with wicked fists. You cannot fast as you do today and expect your voice to be heard on high.

verses.name: Isaiah 58:5
verses.text: Is this the kind of fast I have chosen, only a day for a man to humble himself? Is it only for bowing one's head like a reed and for lying on sackcloth and ashes? Is that what you call a fast, a day acceptable to the LORD?

verses.name: Isaiah 58:6
verses.text: "Is not this the kind of fasting I have chosen: to loose the chains of injustice and untie the cords of the yoke, to set the oppressed free and break every yoke?

verses.name: Isaiah 58:7
verses.text: Is it not to share your food with the hungry and to provide the poor wanderer with shelter- when you see the naked, to clothe him, and not to turn away from your own flesh and blood?

verses.name: Isaiah 58:8
verses.text: Then your light will break forth like the dawn, and your healing will quickly appear; then your righteousness will go before you, and the glory of the LORD will be your rear guard.

verses.name: Isaiah 58:9
verses.text: Then you will call, and the LORD will answer; you will cry for help, and he will say: Here am I. "If you do away with the yoke of oppression, with the pointing finger and malicious talk,

verses.name: Isaiah 58:10
verses.text: and if you spend yourselves in behalf of the hungry and satisfy the needs of the oppressed, then your light will rise in the darkness, and your night will become like the noonday.

verses.name: Isaiah 58:11
verses.text: The LORD will guide you always; he will satisfy your needs in a sun-scorched land and will strengthen your frame. You will be like a well-watered garden, like a spring whose waters never fail.

verses.name: Isaiah 58:12
verses.text: Your people will rebuild the ancient ruins and will raise up the age-old foundations; you will be called Repairer of Broken Walls, Restorer of Streets with Dwellings.

verses.name: Isaiah 58:13
verses.text: "If you keep your feet from breaking the Sabbath and from doing as you please on my holy day, if you call the Sabbath a delight and the LORD's holy day honorable, and if you honor it by not going your own way and not doing as you please or speaking idle words,

verses.name: Isaiah 58:14
verses.text: then you will find your joy in the LORD, and I will cause you to ride on the heights of the land and to feast on the inheritance of your father Jacob." The mouth of the LORD has spoken.

verses.name: Isaiah 59:1
verses.text: Surely the arm of the LORD is not too short to save, nor his ear too dull to hear.

verses.name: Isaiah 59:2
verses.text: But your iniquities have separated you from your God; your sins have hidden his face from you, so that he will not hear.

verses.name: Isaiah 59:3
verses.text: For your hands are stained with blood, your fingers with guilt. Your lips have spoken lies, and your tongue mutters wicked things.

verses.name: Isaiah 59:4
verses.text: No one calls for justice; no one pleads his case with integrity. They rely on empty arguments and speak lies; they conceive trouble and give birth to evil.

verses.name: Isaiah 59:5
verses.text: They hatch the eggs of vipers and spin a spider's web. Whoever eats their eggs will die, and when one is broken, an adder is hatched.

verses.name: Isaiah 59:6
verses.text: Their cobwebs are useless for clothing; they cannot cover themselves with what they make. Their deeds are evil deeds, and acts of violence are in their hands.

verses.name: Isaiah 59:7
verses.text: Their feet rush into sin; they are swift to shed innocent blood. Their thoughts are evil thoughts; ruin and destruction mark their ways.

verses.name: Isaiah 59:8
verses.text: The way of peace they do not know; there is no justice in their paths. They have turned them into crooked roads; no one who walks in them will know peace.

verses.name: Isaiah 59:9
verses.text: So justice is far from us, and righteousness does not reach us. We look for light, but all is darkness; for brightness, but we walk in deep shadows.

verses.name: Isaiah 59:10
verses.text: Like the blind we grope along the wall, feeling our way like men without eyes. At midday we stumble as if it were twilight; among the strong, we are like the dead.

verses.name: Isaiah 59:11
verses.text: We all growl like bears; we moan mournfully like doves. We look for justice, but find none; for deliverance, but it is far away.

verses.name: Isaiah 59:12
verses.text: For our offenses are many in your sight, and our sins testify against us. Our offenses are ever with us, and we acknowledge our iniquities:

verses.name: Isaiah 59:13
verses.text: rebellion and treachery against the LORD, turning our backs on our God, fomenting oppression and revolt, uttering lies our hearts have conceived.

verses.name: Isaiah 59:14
verses.text: So justice is driven back, and righteousness stands at a distance; truth has stumbled in the streets, honesty cannot enter.

verses.name: Isaiah 59:15
verses.text: Truth is nowhere to be found, and whoever shuns evil becomes a prey. The LORD looked and was displeased that there was no justice.

verses.name: Isaiah 59:16
verses.text: He saw that there was no one, he was appalled that there was no one to intervene; so his own arm worked salvation for him, and his own righteousness sustained him.

verses.name: Isaiah 59:17
verses.text: He put on righteousness as his breastplate, and the helmet of salvation on his head; he put on the garments of vengeance and wrapped himself in zeal as in a cloak.

verses.name: Isaiah 59:18
verses.text: According to what they have done, so will he repay wrath to his enemies and retribution to his foes; he will repay the islands their due.

verses.name: Isaiah 59:19
verses.text: From the west, men will fear the name of the LORD, and from the rising of the sun, they will revere his glory. For he will come like a pent-up flood that the breath of the LORD drives along.

verses.name: Isaiah 59:20
verses.text: "The Redeemer will come to Zion, to those in Jacob who repent of their sins," declares the LORD.

verses.name: Isaiah 59:21
verses.text: "As for me, this is my covenant with them," says the LORD. "My Spirit, who is on you, and my words that I have put in your mouth will not depart from your mouth, or from the mouths of your children, or from the mouths of their descendants from this time on and forever," says the LORD.

verses.name: Isaiah 60:1
verses.text: "Arise, shine, for your light has come, and the glory of the LORD rises upon you.

verses.name: Isaiah 60:2
verses.text: See, darkness covers the earth and thick darkness is over the peoples, but the LORD rises upon you and his glory appears over you.

verses.name: Isaiah 60:3
verses.text: Nations will come to your light, and kings to the brightness of your dawn.

verses.name: Isaiah 60:4
verses.text: "Lift up your eyes and look about you: All assemble and come to you; your sons come from afar, and your daughters are carried on the arm.

verses.name: Isaiah 60:5
verses.text: Then you will look and be radiant, your heart will throb and swell with joy; the wealth on the seas will be brought to you, to you the riches of the nations will come.

verses.name: Isaiah 60:6
verses.text: Herds of camels will cover your land, young camels of Midian and Ephah. And all from Sheba will come, bearing gold and incense and proclaiming the praise of the LORD.

verses.name: Isaiah 60:7
verses.text: All Kedar's flocks will be gathered to you, the rams of Nebaioth will serve you; they will be accepted as offerings on my altar, and I will adorn my glorious temple.

verses.name: Isaiah 60:8
verses.text: "Who are these that fly along like clouds, like doves to their nests?

verses.name: Isaiah 60:9
verses.text: Surely the islands look to me; in the lead are the ships of Tarshish, bringing your sons from afar, with their silver and gold, to the honor of the LORD your God, the Holy One of Israel, for he has endowed you with splendor.

verses.name: Isaiah 60:10
verses.text: "Foreigners will rebuild your walls, and their kings will serve you. Though in anger I struck you, in favor I will show you compassion.

verses.name: Isaiah 60:11
verses.text: Your gates will always stand open, they will never be shut, day or night, so that men may bring you the wealth of the nations- their kings led in triumphal procession.

verses.name: Isaiah 60:12
verses.text: For the nation or kingdom that will not serve you will perish; it will be utterly ruined.

verses.name: Isaiah 60:13
verses.text: "The glory of Lebanon will come to you, the pine, the fir and the cypress together, to adorn the place of my sanctuary; and I will glorify the place of my feet.

verses.name: Isaiah 60:14
verses.text: The sons of your oppressors will come bowing before you; all who despise you will bow down at your feet and will call you the City of the LORD, Zion of the Holy One of Israel.

verses.name: Isaiah 60:15
verses.text: "Although you have been forsaken and hated, with no one traveling through, I will make you the everlasting pride and the joy of all generations.

verses.name: Isaiah 60:16
verses.text: You will drink the milk of nations and be nursed at royal breasts. Then you will know that I, the LORD, am your Savior, your Redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob.

verses.name: Isaiah 60:17
verses.text: Instead of bronze I will bring you gold, and silver in place of iron. Instead of wood I will bring you bronze, and iron in place of stones. I will make peace your governor and righteousness your ruler.

verses.name: Isaiah 60:18
verses.text: No longer will violence be heard in your land, nor ruin or destruction within your borders, but you will call your walls Salvation and your gates Praise.

verses.name: Isaiah 60:19
verses.text: The sun will no more be your light by day, nor will the brightness of the moon shine on you, for the LORD will be your everlasting light, and your God will be your glory.

verses.name: Isaiah 60:20
verses.text: Your sun will never set again, and your moon will wane no more; the LORD will be your everlasting light, and your days of sorrow will end.

verses.name: Isaiah 60:21
verses.text: Then will all your people be righteous and they will possess the land forever. They are the shoot I have planted, the work of my hands, for the display of my splendor.

verses.name: Isaiah 60:22
verses.text: The least of you will become a thousand, the smallest a mighty nation. I am the LORD; in its time I will do this swiftly."

verses.name: Isaiah 61:1
verses.text: The Spirit of the Sovereign LORD is on me, because the LORD has anointed me to preach good news to the poor. He has sent me to bind up the brokenhearted, to proclaim freedom for the captives and release from darkness for the prisoners,

verses.name: Isaiah 61:2
verses.text: to proclaim the year of the LORD's favor and the day of vengeance of our God, to comfort all who mourn,

verses.name: Isaiah 61:3
verses.text: and provide for those who grieve in Zion- to bestow on them a crown of beauty instead of ashes, the oil of gladness instead of mourning, and a garment of praise instead of a spirit of despair. They will be called oaks of righteousness, a planting of the LORD for the display of his splendor.

verses.name: Isaiah 61:4
verses.text: They will rebuild the ancient ruins and restore the places long devastated; they will renew the ruined cities that have been devastated for generations.

verses.name: Isaiah 61:5
verses.text: Aliens will shepherd your flocks; foreigners will work your fields and vineyards.

verses.name: Isaiah 61:6
verses.text: And you will be called priests of the LORD, you will be named ministers of our God. You will feed on the wealth of nations, and in their riches you will boast.

verses.name: Isaiah 61:7
verses.text: Instead of their shame my people will receive a double portion, and instead of disgrace they will rejoice in their inheritance; and so they will inherit a double portion in their land, and everlasting joy will be theirs.

verses.name: Isaiah 61:8
verses.text: "For I, the LORD, love justice; I hate robbery and iniquity. In my faithfulness I will reward them and make an everlasting covenant with them.

verses.name: Isaiah 61:9
verses.text: Their descendants will be known among the nations and their offspring among the peoples. All who see them will acknowledge that they are a people the LORD has blessed."

verses.name: Isaiah 61:10
verses.text: I delight greatly in the LORD; my soul rejoices in my God. For he has clothed me with garments of salvation and arrayed me in a robe of righteousness, as a bridegroom adorns his head like a priest, and as a bride adorns herself with her jewels.

verses.name: Isaiah 61:11
verses.text: For as the soil makes the sprout come up and a garden causes seeds to grow, so the Sovereign LORD will make righteousness and praise spring up before all nations.

verses.name: Isaiah 62:1
verses.text: For Zion's sake I will not keep silent, for Jerusalem's sake I will not remain quiet, till her righteousness shines out like the dawn, her salvation like a blazing torch.

verses.name: Isaiah 62:2
verses.text: The nations will see your righteousness, and all kings your glory; you will be called by a new name that the mouth of the LORD will bestow.

verses.name: Isaiah 62:3
verses.text: You will be a crown of splendor in the LORD's hand, a royal diadem in the hand of your God.

verses.name: Isaiah 62:4
verses.text: No longer will they call you Deserted, or name your land Desolate. But you will be called Hephzibah, and your land Beulah; for the LORD will take delight in you, and your land will be married.

verses.name: Isaiah 62:5
verses.text: As a young man marries a maiden, so will your sons marry you; as a bridegroom rejoices over his bride, so will your God rejoice over you.

verses.name: Isaiah 62:6
verses.text: I have posted watchmen on your walls, O Jerusalem; they will never be silent day or night. You who call on the LORD, give yourselves no rest,

verses.name: Isaiah 62:7
verses.text: and give him no rest till he establishes Jerusalem and makes her the praise of the earth.

verses.name: Isaiah 62:8
verses.text: The LORD has sworn by his right hand and by his mighty arm: "Never again will I give your grain as food for your enemies, and never again will foreigners drink the new wine for which you have toiled;

verses.name: Isaiah 62:9
verses.text: but those who harvest it will eat it and praise the LORD, and those who gather the grapes will drink it in the courts of my sanctuary."

verses.name: Isaiah 62:10
verses.text: Pass through, pass through the gates! Prepare the way for the people. Build up, build up the highway! Remove the stones. Raise a banner for the nations.

verses.name: Isaiah 62:11
verses.text: The LORD has made proclamation to the ends of the earth: "Say to the Daughter of Zion, 'See, your Savior comes! See, his reward is with him, and his recompense accompanies him.'"

verses.name: Isaiah 62:12
verses.text: They will be called the Holy People, the Redeemed of the LORD; and you will be called Sought After, the City No Longer Deserted.

verses.name: Isaiah 63:1
verses.text: Who is this coming from Edom, from Bozrah, with his garments stained crimson? Who is this, robed in splendor, striding forward in the greatness of his strength? "It is I, speaking in righteousness, mighty to save."

verses.name: Isaiah 63:2
verses.text: Why are your garments red, like those of one treading the winepress?

verses.name: Isaiah 63:3
verses.text: "I have trodden the winepress alone; from the nations no one was with me. I trampled them in my anger and trod them down in my wrath; their blood spattered my garments, and I stained all my clothing.

verses.name: Isaiah 63:4
verses.text: For the day of vengeance was in my heart, and the year of my redemption has come.

verses.name: Isaiah 63:5
verses.text: I looked, but there was no one to help, I was appalled that no one gave support; so my own arm worked salvation for me, and my own wrath sustained me.

verses.name: Isaiah 63:6
verses.text: I trampled the nations in my anger; in my wrath I made them drunk and poured their blood on the ground."

verses.name: Isaiah 63:7
verses.text: I will tell of the kindnesses of the LORD, the deeds for which he is to be praised, according to all the LORD has done for us- yes, the many good things he has done for the house of Israel, according to his compassion and many kindnesses.

verses.name: Isaiah 63:8
verses.text: He said, "Surely they are my people, sons who will not be false to me"; and so he became their Savior.

verses.name: Isaiah 63:9
verses.text: In all their distress he too was distressed, and the angel of his presence saved them. In his love and mercy he redeemed them; he lifted them up and carried them all the days of old.

verses.name: Isaiah 63:10
verses.text: Yet they rebelled and grieved his Holy Spirit. So he turned and became their enemy and he himself fought against them.

verses.name: Isaiah 63:11
verses.text: Then his people recalled the days of old, the days of Moses and his people- where is he who brought them through the sea, with the shepherd of his flock? Where is he who set his Holy Spirit among them,

verses.name: Isaiah 63:12
verses.text: who sent his glorious arm of power to be at Moses' right hand, who divided the waters before them, to gain for himself everlasting renown,

verses.name: Isaiah 63:13
verses.text: who led them through the depths? Like a horse in open country, they did not stumble;

verses.name: Isaiah 63:14
verses.text: like cattle that go down to the plain, they were given rest by the Spirit of the LORD. This is how you guided your people to make for yourself a glorious name.

verses.name: Isaiah 63:15
verses.text: Look down from heaven and see from your lofty throne, holy and glorious. Where are your zeal and your might? Your tenderness and compassion are withheld from us.

verses.name: Isaiah 63:16
verses.text: But you are our Father, though Abraham does not know us or Israel acknowledge us; you, O LORD, are our Father, our Redeemer from of old is your name.

verses.name: Isaiah 63:17
verses.text: Why, O LORD, do you make us wander from your ways and harden our hearts so we do not revere you? Return for the sake of your servants, the tribes that are your inheritance.

verses.name: Isaiah 63:18
verses.text: For a little while your people possessed your holy place, but now our enemies have trampled down your sanctuary.

verses.name: Isaiah 63:19
verses.text: We are yours from of old; but you have not ruled over them, they have not been called by your name.

verses.name: Isaiah 64:1
verses.text: Oh, that you would rend the heavens and come down, that the mountains would tremble before you!

verses.name: Isaiah 64:2
verses.text: As when fire sets twigs ablaze and causes water to boil, come down to make your name known to your enemies and cause the nations to quake before you!

verses.name: Isaiah 64:3
verses.text: For when you did awesome things that we did not expect, you came down, and the mountains trembled before you.

verses.name: Isaiah 64:4
verses.text: Since ancient times no one has heard, no ear has perceived, no eye has seen any God besides you, who acts on behalf of those who wait for him.

verses.name: Isaiah 64:5
verses.text: You come to the help of those who gladly do right, who remember your ways. But when we continued to sin against them, you were angry. How then can we be saved?

verses.name: Isaiah 64:6
verses.text: All of us have become like one who is unclean, and all our righteous acts are like filthy rags; we all shrivel up like a leaf, and like the wind our sins sweep us away.

verses.name: Isaiah 64:7
verses.text: No one calls on your name or strives to lay hold of you; for you have hidden your face from us and made us waste away because of our sins.

verses.name: Isaiah 64:8
verses.text: Yet, O LORD, you are our Father. We are the clay, you are the potter; we are all the work of your hand.

verses.name: Isaiah 64:9
verses.text: Do not be angry beyond measure, O LORD; do not remember our sins forever. Oh, look upon us, we pray, for we are all your people.

verses.name: Isaiah 64:10
verses.text: Your sacred cities have become a desert; even Zion is a desert, Jerusalem a desolation.

verses.name: Isaiah 64:11
verses.text: Our holy and glorious temple, where our fathers praised you, has been burned with fire, and all that we treasured lies in ruins.

verses.name: Isaiah 64:12
verses.text: After all this, O LORD, will you hold yourself back? Will you keep silent and punish us beyond measure?

verses.name: Isaiah 65:1
verses.text: "I revealed myself to those who did not ask for me; I was found by those who did not seek me. To a nation that did not call on my name, I said, 'Here am I, here am I.'

verses.name: Isaiah 65:2
verses.text: All day long I have held out my hands to an obstinate people, who walk in ways not good, pursuing their own imaginations-

verses.name: Isaiah 65:3
verses.text: a people who continually provoke me to my very face, offering sacrifices in gardens and burning incense on altars of brick;

verses.name: Isaiah 65:4
verses.text: who sit among the graves and spend their nights keeping secret vigil; who eat the flesh of pigs, and whose pots hold broth of unclean meat;

verses.name: Isaiah 65:5
verses.text: who say, 'Keep away; don't come near me, for I am too sacred for you!' Such people are smoke in my nostrils, a fire that keeps burning all day.

verses.name: Isaiah 65:6
verses.text: "See, it stands written before me: I will not keep silent but will pay back in full; I will pay it back into their laps-

verses.name: Isaiah 65:7
verses.text: both your sins and the sins of your fathers," says the LORD. "Because they burned sacrifices on the mountains and defied me on the hills, I will measure into their laps the full payment for their former deeds."

verses.name: Isaiah 65:8
verses.text: This is what the LORD says: "As when juice is still found in a cluster of grapes and men say, 'Don't destroy it, there is yet some good in it,' so will I do in behalf of my servants; I will not destroy them all.

verses.name: Isaiah 65:9
verses.text: I will bring forth descendants from Jacob, and from Judah those who will possess my mountains; my chosen people will inherit them, and there will my servants live.

verses.name: Isaiah 65:10
verses.text: Sharon will become a pasture for flocks, and the Valley of Achor a resting place for herds, for my people who seek me.

verses.name: Isaiah 65:11
verses.text: "But as for you who forsake the LORD and forget my holy mountain, who spread a table for Fortune and fill bowls of mixed wine for Destiny,

verses.name: Isaiah 65:12
verses.text: I will destine you for the sword, and you will all bend down for the slaughter; for I called but you did not answer, I spoke but you did not listen. You did evil in my sight and chose what displeases me."

verses.name: Isaiah 65:13
verses.text: Therefore this is what the Sovereign LORD says: "My servants will eat, but you will go hungry; my servants will drink, but you will go thirsty; my servants will rejoice, but you will be put to shame.

verses.name: Isaiah 65:14
verses.text: My servants will sing out of the joy of their hearts, but you will cry out from anguish of heart and wail in brokenness of spirit.

verses.name: Isaiah 65:15
verses.text: You will leave your name to my chosen ones as a curse; the Sovereign LORD will put you to death, but to his servants he will give another name.

verses.name: Isaiah 65:16
verses.text: Whoever invokes a blessing in the land will do so by the God of truth; he who takes an oath in the land will swear by the God of truth. For the past troubles will be forgotten and hidden from my eyes.

verses.name: Isaiah 65:17
verses.text: "Behold, I will create new heavens and a new earth. The former things will not be remembered, nor will they come to mind.

verses.name: Isaiah 65:18
verses.text: But be glad and rejoice forever in what I will create, for I will create Jerusalem to be a delight and its people a joy.

verses.name: Isaiah 65:19
verses.text: I will rejoice over Jerusalem and take delight in my people; the sound of weeping and of crying will be heard in it no more.

verses.name: Isaiah 65:20
verses.text: "Never again will there be in it an infant who lives but a few days, or an old man who does not live out his years; he who dies at a hundred will be thought a mere youth; he who fails to reach a hundred will be considered accursed.

verses.name: Isaiah 65:21
verses.text: They will build houses and dwell in them; they will plant vineyards and eat their fruit.

verses.name: Isaiah 65:22
verses.text: No longer will they build houses and others live in them, or plant and others eat. For as the days of a tree, so will be the days of my people; my chosen ones will long enjoy the works of their hands.

verses.name: Isaiah 65:23
verses.text: They will not toil in vain or bear children doomed to misfortune; for they will be a people blessed by the LORD, they and their descendants with them.

verses.name: Isaiah 65:24
verses.text: Before they call I will answer; while they are still speaking I will hear.

verses.name: Isaiah 65:25
verses.text: The wolf and the lamb will feed together, and the lion will eat straw like the ox, but dust will be the serpent's food. They will neither harm nor destroy on all my holy mountain," says the LORD.

verses.name: Isaiah 66:1
verses.text: This is what the LORD says: "Heaven is my throne, and the earth is my footstool. Where is the house you will build for me? Where will my resting place be?

verses.name: Isaiah 66:2
verses.text: Has not my hand made all these things, and so they came into being?" declares the LORD. "This is the one I esteem: he who is humble and contrite in spirit, and trembles at my word.

verses.name: Isaiah 66:3
verses.text: But whoever sacrifices a bull is like one who kills a man, and whoever offers a lamb, like one who breaks a dog's neck; whoever makes a grain offering is like one who presents pig's blood, and whoever burns memorial incense, like one who worships an idol. They have chosen their own ways, and their souls delight in their abominations;

verses.name: Isaiah 66:4
verses.text: so I also will choose harsh treatment for them and will bring upon them what they dread. For when I called, no one answered, when I spoke, no one listened. They did evil in my sight and chose what displeases me."

verses.name: Isaiah 66:5
verses.text: Hear the word of the LORD, you who tremble at his word: "Your brothers who hate you, and exclude you because of my name, have said, 'Let the LORD be glorified, that we may see your joy!' Yet they will be put to shame.

verses.name: Isaiah 66:6
verses.text: Hear that uproar from the city, hear that noise from the temple! It is the sound of the LORD repaying his enemies all they deserve.

verses.name: Isaiah 66:7
verses.text: "Before she goes into labor, she gives birth; before the pains come upon her, she delivers a son.

verses.name: Isaiah 66:8
verses.text: Who has ever heard of such a thing? Who has ever seen such things? Can a country be born in a day or a nation be brought forth in a moment? Yet no sooner is Zion in labor than she gives birth to her children.

verses.name: Isaiah 66:9
verses.text: Do I bring to the moment of birth and not give delivery?" says the LORD. "Do I close up the womb when I bring to delivery?" says your God.

verses.name: Isaiah 66:10
verses.text: "Rejoice with Jerusalem and be glad for her, all you who love her; rejoice greatly with her, all you who mourn over her.

verses.name: Isaiah 66:11
verses.text: For you will nurse and be satisfied at her comforting breasts; you will drink deeply and delight in her overflowing abundance."

verses.name: Isaiah 66:12
verses.text: For this is what the LORD says: "I will extend peace to her like a river, and the wealth of nations like a flooding stream; you will nurse and be carried on her arm and dandled on her knees.

verses.name: Isaiah 66:13
verses.text: As a mother comforts her child, so will I comfort you; and you will be comforted over Jerusalem."

verses.name: Isaiah 66:14
verses.text: When you see this, your heart will rejoice and you will flourish like grass; the hand of the LORD will be made known to his servants, but his fury will be shown to his foes.

verses.name: Isaiah 66:15
verses.text: See, the LORD is coming with fire, and his chariots are like a whirlwind; he will bring down his anger with fury, and his rebuke with flames of fire.

verses.name: Isaiah 66:16
verses.text: For with fire and with his sword the LORD will execute judgment upon all men, and many will be those slain by the LORD.

verses.name: Isaiah 66:17
verses.text: "Those who consecrate and purify themselves to go into the gardens, following the one in the midst of those who eat the flesh of pigs and rats and other abominable things-they will meet their end together," declares the LORD.

verses.name: Isaiah 66:18
verses.text: "And I, because of their actions and their imaginations, am about to come and gather all nations and tongues, and they will come and see my glory.

verses.name: Isaiah 66:19
verses.text: "I will set a sign among them, and I will send some of those who survive to the nations-to Tarshish, to the Libyans and Lydians (famous as archers), to Tubal and Greece, and to the distant islands that have not heard of my fame or seen my glory. They will proclaim my glory among the nations.

verses.name: Isaiah 66:20
verses.text: And they will bring all your brothers, from all the nations, to my holy mountain in Jerusalem as an offering to the LORD -on horses, in chariots and wagons, and on mules and camels," says the LORD. "They will bring them, as the Israelites bring their grain offerings, to the temple of the LORD in ceremonially clean vessels.

verses.name: Isaiah 66:21
verses.text: And I will select some of them also to be priests and Levites," says the LORD.

verses.name: Isaiah 66:22
verses.text: "As the new heavens and the new earth that I make will endure before me," declares the LORD, "so will your name and descendants endure.

verses.name: Isaiah 66:23
verses.text: From one New Moon to another and from one Sabbath to another, all mankind will come and bow down before me," says the LORD.

verses.name: Isaiah 66:24
verses.text: "And they will go out and look upon the dead bodies of those who rebelled against me; their worm will not die, nor will their fire be quenched, and they will be loathsome to all mankind."
